Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Moira L
Reviews.Content: The rooms are abit long in the tooth but the location is absolutely perfect!! I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but worn”
Reviews.Author: Grande2305
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline. Got a decent price. Checkin was quick and efficient. There seemed to be a lot of teenagers -- I guess they were on spring break. They were chaperoned and well behaved. The room is dated with indicators that the hotel, whle well maintaining the property, has not renovated. For example, the bottoms of the doors were chipped and shredded from years of use. The night tables had nail heads pushing through. The bathroom was quite small with little room because the door swept through most of the floor space. The tub failed to drain adequately when showering. There was no wifi available in the rooms -- another indicator of the long overdue need to upgrade. The remote control was weak. The a/c worked quite well. Sleeping was comfortable but a lot of outside noise. The location was superb -- just steps from the subway and Times Square. Check out was a breeze. Because of the dated, worn look, I agree with Priceline with three stars -- average. It's clean with a great location and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “simply splendid”
Reviews.Author: pert_11
Reviews.Content: From 3/8 through 3/17/2012, I, my daughter and 14 year old grandson, stayed here. Several members of a simply splendid hotel staff deserve special recognition. Along with a number of reviewers, we found Mohammed making a room adjustment, which enhanced our stay. On two days, two cleaning women considerately attended to our particular needs. On week days, the pool manager delayed until after my early morning swim, to chlorinate. On the day we left, the NY Marathon viewers clogged the streets nearby preventing taxi service; our doorman led us a block and a half away (50th St and 6th Ave), where he blew his whistle summoning a taxi. Hopefully other hotels will emulate Manhattan's service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location but a bit grubby and staff not that helpful”
Reviews.Author: Paulbo4
Reviews.Content: Amazing location but a bit grubby and staff not that helpful. right in Times Square near Planet Hollywood, great for Broadway shows and everything is 10 to 20 minutes walk in this amazing city. Breakfast was really nice (Great coffee!) but the room was a bit grubby and dark even though it was pretty big! If you get a good price the location is worth it. More of a sleeper hotel than a amenities one.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jsilver3
Reviews.Content: Smaller room and older rooms, but awesome location, especially since we named our price on Priceline and paid under 200 for a weekend in December. Staff was also great and Lobby was recently remodeled and very nice. I imagine once rooms are remodeled the priced will increase but it was great for us, especially since we didn't want to spend time in the room

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: deblykin
Reviews.Content: The public spaces and our room were very well maintained. The room was clean and a good size. Bathroom didn't have quite as much counterspace as other hotels we have stayed in but was adequate. We didn't notice any street noise or noise in the hallways even though there were at least two high school groups in the hotel. We had a great stay and would gladly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Superb Rooms and Staff”
Reviews.Author: JAMES S
Reviews.Content: After reading the initial reviews i was slightly concerned about this hotel, but upon arriving i was pleasantly suprised. The hotel was located in a superb area, the check-in was super fast and we got a free upgrade to a large corner room on the top floor. The staff were very helpful and friendly, anything you needed you got, whilst we were there for 10 days we only used the pool 5 times but it was immaculate and very warm. We didnt find noise a problem at night being on the top floor and unlike other reviews we could not hear anyone on either side of us, so to some up a superb hotel, which really is good value for money and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Reception staff... What a Joke”
Reviews.Author: Urbanwarrior1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 Nights in March. Got to the reception only to find out we had only been booked for one night. The man said he would look into this and call us tomorrow. Got to our first room 1205.. the phone rang.. they wanted us to move rooms as this one was getting re decorated!!! Got to the second room to find only one of the beds have been made. Called room service they wanted us to move rooms AGAIN. We said no and just wanted the bed made. The lady was really nice and said she didnt think anyone would be checking into this room. The second day we came back from a day out and couldnt get into our room, we went to reception who said they only has us booked in for 3 nights. This made no sense... why couldnt we get into our room? We never had a call from the man who checked us in. We spoke to the manager who didnt even apologise until we asked her to. We showed her the proof we were booked in for 4 nights and still she didn not believe us. After a long argument she offered is free breakfast for our stay. We then got a phone call the next day to say we were booked in for 4 Nights. The staff were very unproffesional and not very happy to sort this matter out for us. We booked the hotel through get a room.com I will not be booking through them or staying at this hotel again!! Apart from the reception staff the hotel is in a good location in Times Square. The breakfast is lovely but expensive if you were to pay for it. Rooms The rooms are a good size for New York rooms. However the walls are really thin and you can hear everything that is going on next door and in the hall. I have also stayed at the Millennium Broadway which I found a much better hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Crosbytony
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February,the hotel is very nice , rooms are kept crisply clean. Staff were warm friendly and more than helpful with everything. It's a great location, well worth a visit, I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Really 3.5 stars....”
Reviews.Author: ceeceerose
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel back when it was a Sheraton and it was newer. Back in 2001, it was a fantastic hotel. In 2011, it looked very much the same, but a bit worn out. It definitely hasn't had any work done to it in the 10 years between stays. And the rooms especially showed some wear. But, the location still cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “No climate control in the room”
Reviews.Author: M Z
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in this hotel. Never again. There was no way to control the temperature in the room and by 2 am I was reduced to sleeping on the floor next to the open window as it was the only spot in the room that wasn't boiling. Of course, an open window meant plenty of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Old but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rabeileen
Reviews.Content: Just had a great holiday in NY, hotel was in great location close to everything but the rooms need a make-over but apart from that it was clean and had all you need plus a large comfy bed

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for visiting New York”
Reviews.Author: Wendy2601
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed in New York and the first time at this hotel. The location is great, near Times Square and all the attractions, close to the subway and great restaurants. I asked for a room on the higher floors and away from the lifts as other guests had recommended. They gave us a free upgrade to a kingsize room and I thought it was a generous size for NY. The bathroom was small, but the shower was great, blasting me awake each morning. The room was a bit tired but very clean. It was over Â£300 cheaper than the next hotel I looked at. My boyfriend insists on a gym with weights, so it limits my choice a bit, but I definitely thought it was better to save the Â£600 for spending money than have up to the minute decor, but that was my choice. The staff were very friendly and helpful when we needed to ask them anything and they organised a late checkout for us at no extra charge. I would say that the lifts were noisy and although they didn't keep us awake we were aware of the noise, but not sure what they can do about that. In all I think this is a good hotel in a great location, it is comfortable and has all you need for a sightseeing holiday in NY. If you want luxury then you will need to up your budget considerably to get a better hotel with the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Safe for females in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sadebausdeb
Reviews.Content: Our request to the travel agent was somewhere convenient to all the tourist highlights but safe for two females if we stayed out late. Its certainly was convenient not only to all the best spots but to public transport as well. We stayed out after midnight every night and there was always plenty of people around because you are right in the heart of it all. Room was clean and well stocked. I checked the linen and mattress for bed bugs as I heard there was an epidemic, but it was bug free. The room was quiet even though we were only about 3 rooms from the lift. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable about the sights and special deals available. We were there to see the sites so a clean pillow to lay our heads on and clean bathroom facilities were what we wanted and what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Worst value”
Reviews.Author: champagnetraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel flop: biggest rip off. It's a hotel you wish you weren't blowing, with tax, 300.00 on but 65.00. Old, falling apart, staff did not honor my room request, they charge for toothbrushes, lighting is fluorescent office style, bed sheets and pillows like sleeping on straw, pillows are sponges, and you can hear your neighbors TV all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, but not much else”
Reviews.Author: MYKNN
Reviews.Content: Top score for this hotel for location -- if Broadway and getting to the subway is your intent, you will like how convenient this hotel is. The hotel puts you right in the middle of Broadway, so getting to your Broadway shows is really just one or two short blocks away. The number 1 subway station is also just one block away, so going around via NY subway is also quite convenient. A couple of office buildings around the area make this also quite easy for the business traveler. There are very good restaurants around (but you can say this for most parts of mid-town anyway). There is nothing extra-special in this hotel. The rooms are what you expect a Sheraton or Westin to be -- clean, classic lines, comfortable, functional. I will not say no to staying here again, mainly because you know what to expect -- everything works! You will not get unobstructed views, since the hotel is surrounded by tall buildings from all sides. That is the trade-off for being in the middle of the city. There were quite a few disappointments: 1. the gym is really inadequate --- just a few machines, and one all-around for weight training. 2. The lobby can get quite crowded, and there is hardly any place to sit if you are waiting for guests --- the free wireless internet at the lobby makes it the station for people checking email of checking stuff on Facebook. 3. I checked in quite early in the day, so I think housekeeping was not given enough time to clean up my room. I found a used razor in the bathtub -- it'll freak out the over-fuzzy, but if you choose to let this go, welcome to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Location worth the money alone”
Reviews.Author: Vivienne_Pollock
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New York, had a fab time,only advice for tea drinkers bring your own kettle to the hotel as the hot water facilities in the room makes the water taste of coffee, we asked for the heater to be changed but it was worse, (just gave up and bought tea outside), this was the only problem we encountered with this hotel, everything else was excellent. I was sharing a room with my daughter and we were booked into a queen room but on arrival they upgraded us, without asking and for free, to a king size bed. The location was excellent, a stone throw away from the centre of times square and is surrounded with places to eat and drink. I personally reccomend rays pizza almost facing the hotel, the slices of Pizza are very large and prices were reasonable. We are not picky eaters but found it hard to get a meal which was not 'fast food', most mornings we ate in a deli (EZ Deli) on broadway down toward time square where you could get porridge (oatmeal) , pancakes with fruit and bagels etc. to give a rough price, oatmeal & pancakes with strawberrrys & 2 large cups of tea was $8.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location.”
Reviews.Author: GriffoBristol
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, perfect location for all the Manhattan main sites. Rooms a little bit tired, but clean and great value. With coffee machine, flat screen TV, and decent size. Very helpful concierge team. Times Sq about 8 mins walk. Plenty of great Deli places and restaurants. Gray Line city tour office and starting point is a 5 minute walk away. All in all, a bargain for the above average quality and location!

Reviews.Title: “Location and pool other than that just basic”
Reviews.Author: tmoo6
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute decision after a busy day in the city. I wanted a hotel offering a pool and without paying more than $300 a night. The pool itself was decent not very heated, but nice enough. The location was excellent and the parking garage was $45 for 24 hours.My room I wasn't very happy with, it was very basic and nothing really to write home about. My stay was decent but for the money not really worth it. I have stayed in cheaper hotels which offered more then what was given here. If I had more time to research might of chosen different.It's decent but if your looking for a wow this isn't the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Tired but still Good!”
Reviews.Author: WillyWonka79
Reviews.Content: My mum, sister and me have just returned from New York. We stayed at the Manhatten at Times Square. My sister booked this hotel for us and we had all looked at the reviews both here and other sites and were a little reluctant after reading some reviews that weren't that great. However overall we were impressed. The hotel has a fantastic location in Times Square, a 5-10 minute walk from Times Square, Rockerfeller and more which is the hotels biggest advantage. Although areas of the hotel and the room seemed a little old, the room was very clean. The room had two very comfortable beds a large tv, a drinks facility, a room safe (free of charge), a hairdryer, an iron and and ironing board, pretty much everything you need when staying in a hotel. I visited the leisure facilities on the 5th Floor which again seemed old but clean, the pool was a decent size and there was a sauna facility within the changing rooms which was a added bonus! We were able to store our luggage on our day of departure to allow us to shop a little more before departing for the airport, the conceirge was very friendly in assisting us. We found all staff very professional and friendly. I would most definitely recomend this hotel to anyone who isnt looking for a modern hotel or luxury facilities but a good friendly hotel with a fantastic location and good amenities, when returning with my husband and children I will definitely be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: nikkiphillips4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid December 2011, it was our second time in New York and definitely enjoy it more every time. The location of the hotel was fabulous with everything on the door step and a stone throw away from the park. The subway was round the corner so everything easily accessible via the subway. The rooms were great, very spacious and clean and the bed was comfy which was great as the first thing you want to do after the long journey is sleep. Would definitely recommend this hotel if it's your first few times to NYC. If we return we would like stay in SoHo or Grenwich Village as it's not as commercialised.

Reviews.Title: “loudest hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: spursliverpool
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from new york this was our second visit this hotel was clean and tidy but the doors in the hotel room need to have something done with them they are so noisey its unbeleivable we stayed on floor seven with a upgrade from the receiptionist when we checked in we did complaine about the banging doors but where told to call done when this was happening and the security would come up and sort it ,but by the time security got up in the lift it all went quite we ended up using the virgin ear plugs when we went to sleep to see us through the night location of the hotel is great but if you are a light sleeper dont stay here there is a good irish bar across the road from the hotel very good food and live music plenty of restaurants to eat out in and nice deli where you can stock your room up from we will be going back to new york but hotel again because of the noise

Reviews.Title: “a great stay! worth every penny if not more!”
Reviews.Author: mymitch
Reviews.Content: it is a great hotel, in a great location. the staff is very fast and professional. the hotel is clean (particular compliments go to mrs. milagros my room keeper for the vacation there). i will not look for anything different when i will go back to ny! The Hotel in general: 22 floors, swimming pool (that i did not visit! shame on me!) a nice hall, with wi fi available for your own pc or 4 computers with wide screens and printers available for guests. The Room: quite comfortable with nice a nice queen bed and a good television (flat screen 42''); room temperature is adjustable with the electronical thermostat. The Bathroom: comfortable for 1 person. it is not very big but it has a nice bathtub with shower. For every service i asked i was promptly satisfied at every moment. I would definitely suggest it to anyone. Also consider that it is rated as a 3 star hotel so don't expect too much from it but it is surely worth every penny of its cost if not more! Consider that i took the standard room and i stayed 6 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in midtown”
Reviews.Author: jeaterhoops
Reviews.Content: Just returned from NYC having spent a week at the Manhattan at Times Square. The hotel is excellent situated, close to Times Square, Broadway, and a subway station. It's at 51st Street and other sites are easily walkable. The rooms are a decent size for NYC, there's a flat screen TV, tea and coffee making machine, no fridge not an issue in February. The bathroom was adequate, and complimentary newspapers always welcome. There is Internet access in the lobby. The staff are helpful. The restaurant seemed expensive for breakfast, but there's an excellent local deli on 53rd Street, and plenty of bars and convenience stores nearby. All in all we were very pleased with our choice of hotels and would return there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and Safe Location”
Reviews.Author: suezwalsh
Reviews.Content: Did the usual worrying before I arrived as some reviews didn't sound great but I needn't have panicked! Arrived around 9pm and the staff were very polite. My Virgin Itinery said "discounted room" so I presumed we would have a room near the lift shaft that I had read about and I was right, they may have moved us but as we were so tired every night it really didn't disturb us, it just sounded like a very windy night. We were so close to everything that walking was not an issue with my 17yr old daughter as the NYPD are everywhere, even when being sold comic tickets on the street they made sure the man was legal. We went out for breakfast so can't comment on the food but the room and staff were perfect for our 5 night trip. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, can't beat the price.”
Reviews.Author: Wendy S
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, very small, could hear everything going on around you (no privacy and hard for kids to sleep), pretty bare bones. But completely fine. Would stay again for the price. Kids loved swimming pool!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location "large" rooms”
Reviews.Author: sbcb824
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend, very pleased with the hotel. The rooms were "large" and roomy by New York standards, that was unexpected. Walking out the front door, Times Square was 1 block to your right, Central Park 6 blocks to your left. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the bed felt great after sightseeing all day. We did end up with a room right next to the elevators (saw some reviews about noise).............we never heard a thing from them. Bathrooms/linens were clean and the staff was professional and courteous. They were more than happy to provide information on restaurants and other points of interest. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaB93
Reviews.Content: The location, a stones throw from time square, was absolutely brilliant. The rooms were spacious and reasonably equipped (safe, tea and coffee facilities, hairdryer etc.). As others have said, they are in need of a bit of a touch up (for example one of the handles on the chest of drawers was different to the others) but nothing majorly wrong or broken at all. Helpful staff gave us some different pillows as my friend was allergic to the feather ones they supply. Overall, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Central location to everything, a good hotel with clean comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Scud2010
Reviews.Content: A great place in central times square, clean and friendly hotel. Rooms a little small but comfy beds, flat screen tv, coffee machine etc. hotel a little scruffy but it's so busy but don't be put off as great location for NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SMAMPF
Reviews.Content: We returned today from a 3 night/4 day stay at the Manhattan. We booked this hotel as the price was reasonable and the location good. On arrival we were kept waiting for a while even though there were 3 members of staff on reception. Anyway when we checked in we were given free wifi as it was my birthday (have since found out a few people were given this anyway) The wifi didn't work in the room and only in reception, which was a bit pointless as we didn't spend much time in reception. When we got to the room, which was at the end of the corridor on floor 6, we were happy with the size and layout of the facilities. However, after closer inspection the bed sheets were not the cleanest, the bath had hairs in it and the room needed a good clean and quite possibly a good refurb. We also had to get someone to come and sort the safe as it was closed, therefore we could not use it until someone came up. We decided to grin and bear it (the queue at reception also put us off complaining, we had little time in new york as it was) The next day the room was cleaned much better and sheets were cleaner so we got over the initial dissapointment. However this dissapointment returned on the first night when the maid decided to hoover right outside our bedroom at 2am! this happened 2 out of the 3 nights we were there and then on the final night we had noisy neighbours in the adjoining room (to be honest it could of been a lot worse, parties etc but still not very good soundproofing) The location of the hotel was excellent and the bellboys and concierge were very helpful (reception staff, not so much) Overall, we were quite dissapointed with this hotel but not with our trip to New York. The things I have mentioned here did not ruin our holiday, they just put a slight dampner on it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: lindi31
Reviews.Content: As others have said, it could be grander, there could be more facilities (ie room service) but it's true that you spend very little time in your room when in NYC ! We walked literally everywhere. Was amazingto have the buzz of Tines Square on your doorstep. Room was quite big actually and I can't fault it in terms of cleanliness. Nice powerful shower as well which is what I always look for ! We did not eat at the hotel, Again, why would you with so much just outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: joed14edwards
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights February 2012. The hotel is in a fantastic location. Bedrooms and bathrooms could do a refit but it was clean & tidy. Only wanted some where to sleep and this place fit the bill for what we paid. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is as others say in need of a refurb but it is clean, tidy, has an amazing location and afterall how long do you spend on your room when in NY ?? The staff were helpful and my daughters made use of the free computer usage. The pool was very under used as was the sauna but a lovely way to end a busy day sightseeing. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as I remembered”
Reviews.Author: pingading
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in 2010 and was happy with my stay so I decided to re book her for my recent holiday but was quiet dissapointed this time. I was happy with the fact that the security staff remembered me this time and were not constantly asking to see my room key.well done!! my biggest problem was the noise. I had a room on the 15th floor and after two days of hearing every conversation in the next room, I asked to be moved. Then I was moved to the 18th floor were we had two days of quiet untill another noisy party of Guest were moved in next door. the walls are very thin. A few other things that let us down were: 1) The fixtures in the rooms are getting old and worn...light switches not working, cracks in the baths, dripping taps, broken clothes line 2) no guest information about the hotel in the room, no room service information. 3) our safe was locked when we arrived in our room and had to wait for someone to come open it.

Reviews.Title: “A HOTEL,IN A GOOD SPOT,”
Reviews.Author: colin d
Reviews.Content: i arrived in new york on the 9/02/12,staying for 4 nights,this hotel is ok for its money,there is no bar in this hotel and no bathrooms for you to use only the one in your room,so if your where like me and needed to goto the bathroom i have to go back up 22 floors to my room to go, there is a dinning room but you can only get breakfast here ,there is no lunch of dinner served here,,there is a ice machine on every floor good point,no room service(because no bar or serve food)the hotel is only 4 blocks from central park to the left and times square is about 5 blocks to the right,so great location,rooms are ok ,bathroom is very small you cant get 2 people in the bathroom at the same time,beds are nice,rooms are clean. for me i only needed somewhere to sleep ,because i would be out all day sight seeing,so this hotel works for me,it says its a 4 star hotel i would give it a 3 star,there is internet conections in every room for free,and there are computers in lobby that guests can use, hope this helps you out ,,i would go back to this hotel because of the location

Reviews.Title: “dark, depressing, stained carpeting, cryptlike rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dcbuck
Reviews.Content: I have been a starwood platinum for 8 years and have stayed at starwoods all over the world. have experienced crap all the way up to suites with butlers. this place is waaayyyy towards the crap side of the scale. one would think that with the fantastic location that they would renovate and make it a respectable property. its just old, tired, stained with limited services. This was my first visit there, and will be my last. i have stayed in 10+ starwoods in NYC. nice to be able to cross one off the return list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoc42
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice so far. This is a former Sheraton and still part of Starwood chain. Itâ€™s sort of â€œSheraton Lightâ€�. The rooms and the lobby are Sheratonâ€“like ( including great bed, concierge, bellmen and free WI-FI in Lobby), but there is no club floor, restaurant is only a pricy breakfast place, there are no suites(we were told), no special Starwood Elite perks ( just extra points for Platinums like me) and only hard wired Internet service is available in the rooms. Service was great ( though I never quite get used to having to show security a room key each time I use elevator-but that is common to all Manhattan Hotels, I guess) and everything seemed clean and well maintained. We were there during off-season and the hotel was an excellent value ($134 +taxes & fees). Location was near to everything important, but a bit far from Times Square to have it in their name ( 51st street vs. 42nd Street).

Reviews.Title: “Great price great location”
Reviews.Author: jjbawoods
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value. The location is great and the price is second to none. The rooms are clean the staff friendly. If you want a hotel with a bar and 3meal restaurant this may not be your place, but if you want a great location and reasonable price for New York this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location, but no bar, restaurant”
Reviews.Author: travelinpalladin
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at the Manhattan, whose chief virtue is price relative to proximity to Times Square, Hellâ€™s Kitchen, theaters, and midtown attractions. I paid just $147 a night for a room in January â€“ prepaid, of course. Thatâ€™s about half or less than other nearby hotels. Granted, the property is dated, and I donâ€™t recommend walking on the carpet barefoot, a practice one should avoid as a rule. Further, I could not get the room to cool off, and I cannot sleep in the heat. No matter how many times I set the thermostat, it keep resetting to 72 degrees. I finally took the blamed thing off the wall and removed the batteries. That worked! They have free wireless in the lobby. Also, the hotel has no bar and the restaurant is open only for breakfast. Apparently these amenities fell victim to the Great Recession. But, never fear! There is for sure no shortage of restaurants and watering holes in that part of Manhattan. The walls are a bit thin. One night, I was entertained by some hearty-partying neighbors who clearly had had a great night on the town. They were not shouting, but were certainly speaking enthusiastically! A gentleman neighbor was prome to break into song at intervals. So I donâ€™t know if they had come from a show or what. But there were having fun. I was going to go join them! They settled down by 11-ish. Point is, the walls are a long way from soundproofed. All in all, a good place to stay in an expensive, happening area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Debbie316
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the The Manhattan at Times Square Hotel 2days after New Years Eve. The hotel itself is nothing fancy, but the rooms were very clean and quite big for New York. Hotel was in an excellent location and you could pretty much everywhere, right in the heart of time square. Nice time to visit New York, Christmas decorations were still up and the crowds were considerably smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: dppl1535
Reviews.Content: Location: This hotel was the perfect resting point for our weekend in NYC. While the room didn't face Times Square, we were only one block from the crossroads of the world. Sleeping: Luckily I like a firm mattress, my wife doesn't so she had trouble sleeping. However the room/hallway was very quiet. Pool: We were hoping to relax in the pool after a day walking around Manhattan. Although the pool was described as heated, it wasn't very warm. Overall a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Sharon H
Reviews.Content: This was a great central place to be in NY city.clean friendly, nice size room

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for tourists...”
Reviews.Author: Pumps1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from the 30th Jan. When we checked in we were informed that a room was ready for us but we were advised to wait for one which wasn't near an elevator. It only took an extra half hour and we were so glad we waited and thankful to the reception staff for the advice. The room was a good size. The bathroom was small but ample. The room was clean. You could hear people walking up and down the passageway and people in the next room on the phone but I do think he was speaking rather loudly. We were lucky to be on the 18th floor so didn't hear the traffic but could still hear construction work one night (with widow closed) but nothing too bad. The room was very warm and the aircon was noisey so we just had the window open. The room was cleaned everyday and there is a safe to use and also safes in the lobby. The location of the hotel is superb, 2 min from Broardway, 4 min from Times Square, about 5 mins from Central Park. We didn't eat in the hotel and really only used it to sleep. I would recommend this hotel to people who are touring around and not planning on spending too much time sat in, after all, if your in NYC then why would you sit in? The concierge staff were very helpful and looked after our bags after we had checked out and sorted us a car for our journey back to the airport. Overall a very good stay for a reasonable price and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel for the price, with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Axsdata
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip because the Sheraton across the street was full. It is obviously a tourist hotel but that did not detract from the quality of the stay. The check in process was fine. My room was clean and quiet, though a colleague who had a room room lower down did not get much sleep due to construction going on all night next door to the hotel. Frank Sinatra was right when he called New York the city that never sleeps. My biggest disappointment was the bed. My personal preference is for a firm mattress and the one I got was quite soft and uneven. I ended up sleeping sideways across the bed for comfort. Other than that I felt I got my money's worth, especially for a hotel at the heart of a major tourist attraction. Given that the trip was in February, maybe the price was off- season.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: Miles B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manhattan at Times Square for 5 nights to celebrate my girlfriends 40th birthday and we had a fantastic time. The hotel is in an ideal location, the hotel is just a few minutes walk from Times Square. The hotel was clean and tidy and our room was nice but the view wasn't the best. We didn't eat in the hotel, we had room only but there are plenty of nice bars and restaurants to choose from. I did use the hotel pool once, it was one of the reasons why we chose this particular hotel however it wasn't the greatest of pools and it was quite cold. Overall I would recommend this hotel for it's central location and we would stay there again if we went back and they had a good deal on again. Miles Best, England

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Nae123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends. When we arrived at 6.30pm after a very long and tiring flight, We were informed that our room was still not ready (check-in on our documents stated 2pm??) and they asked us to come back in an hour or so. We went out to dinner, and came back at 9pm wanting to check in. We were informed that it still was not ready, and to come back later. I was furious and asked to speak to a manager. The manager was very disinterested in my complaint, but managed to move my room and put me up straight away. I asked the front counter staff to include breakfast free due to the inconvenience, she just laughed in my face. When we got to the room, it was very dated. The bathroom was tiny and the tap was leaking. There was no effort on the hotels behalf to fix this, so instead water was constantly being wasted. I tried to book a dinner show on broad way with the concierge. He told me he was very busy that day and that I should just go outside and book it with a street merchant instead. Overall, service was incredibly poor. I was disgusted with how they treated their clients and the attitudes that most of them had. The location of this hotel was fantastic- you couldn't have gotten much closer to Times Square. They also offered free internet in the hotel lobby. Unfortunately tho, this would not be enough to make me stay at this hotel ever again, and I certainly do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An ok stay for a SPG hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayu312
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manhattan at TImes Square hotel for one night a couple weeks ago. The location is pretty good. Quite close to all major sightseeing tourist attractions. However, we were disappointed about this hotel in terms of their staff services, the dated rooms,... We are loyal SGP (Starwood chain) hotel customers and we have stayed at many of their hotels. I have to say this is gonna be the worst hotel ever that we have ever stayed. Compared to other SPG hotels, the staff here is not as professional and they seem to have some sort of attitude! Not so friendly and nice. The room is smaller and dated. The small part is fine since you are in the middle of NY center... But really, the room was old... We also requested a king sized bed but then we got a queen sized bed... We were too lazy to request to change the room but this should not have happened to begin with... We definitely will try to avoid this hotel in the future...Quite a disappointment for a SPG hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An interesting family hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: atesakinci
Reviews.Content: It is very interesting to find a family hotel in the middle of Manhattan. It is my third visit in three years and on my each stay I had noticed that mainly families preferred this hotel more than business people. Half of the people around you are children from all of the world, which shows that it is mostly preferred by the families. The location of the hotel is very central for the visitors. Central of many interesting activities. A couple block to the Central Park, close to many theaters. It is a very good family hotel run by the Starwood hotel group.

Reviews.Title: “I got more than I paid for”
Reviews.Author: wiredtens
Reviews.Content: Visited last week of January which is typically a very slow week in New York. Was able to get a rate of less than $150 per night. For this price, the hotel is fantastic. This hotel is old but clean. The first room I got had an over active (loud) heater so requested a move. Got a room on the 14th floor - was surprising quiet. Great access to subway lines and Times Square. Great front desk staff at 11:00pm when I checked in. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Broadway”
Reviews.Author: BAMTGG
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location. We booked on the hotel site and selected a rate for AAA members with onsite parking included.We were able to check in early. Our room was on the 8th floor, with not much of view, but it was very clean and comfortable. We'd return !

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, nice location”
Reviews.Author: KathleenL01
Reviews.Content: Not bad, noisy and expensive to park, small room, restaurant was also expensive. Friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Not your standard SPG Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hdwkinggrl
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I was expecting something nicer than the Westin since it's a "boutique" SPG hotel. I found the hotel be be run down and dirty. Mold in the shower grout, peeling wallpaper and dingy dirty walls. For the price, I guess I shouldn't complain. I think my expectations may have just been too high. As for service, the front desk guy I spoke to (Eduardo) was curt and rude. I was asking when we could check in since I got in early and he spoke as if I didn't know that I was early. Hello? That's why I asked when I could check in. Anyway, maybe he was having a rough day... We also called once to the front desk to say that the ice machine was broken and asked if they could send up some ice. They said room service doesn't exist in that hotel. Again, i think my expectations were too high. One last gripe... There's no wifi in the room! The hotel description says wifi available for purchase but only if you have a jack to plug into. No ipods or phones can get on. Only place where wifi is available is in the lobby. Big minus in my book. I've stayed at the Hudson before and it's much much smaller but the experience was so much better.

Reviews.Title: “gerat time”
Reviews.Author: Thomas S
Reviews.Content: the hotel was really good, right in the action of new york. the hotel was all ways clean and well prepared.i must commend our cleaner called (sonia). on the 10th floor. that comment is for hotel. i would recommend this hotel for a young person.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Thanks Ms. Woods!! (Front Office Manager)”
Reviews.Author: iranak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were planning on staying just one night on December 30th. On our way back from exploring the city at 2:30pm we were nervous and surprised to see that police officers had already started blocking off the Times Square area for the new years celebration. After 30 minutes of waiting in a large crowd the officers let us go to the hotel after we showed them the parking garage ticket. We rushed inside the hotel, and asked a police officer if we would be able to take the car out to leave the city. He laughed and said after 1 a.m we maybe able to leave. We told the front desk the situation and Ms. Woods came out. She apologized for the situation. I asked her what the room rate was that night, because we didn't want to be sitting in the lobby for the next 8 hours. She said the normal rate was $600.00 and that the hotel had been sold out since last year! Yikes! We definitely couldn't afford that even if there were rooms. Soon after she said she is counting on a person not showing up, and she let me use my Starwood points towards a room. So the bad situation became a once in a lifetime opportunity of seeing the ball drop from a few blocks away on New Years. It was an amazing trip. Ill also note that Ms. Woods had been running around all day and looked Exhausted yet she stayed with us until we checked in. Its really rare that you meet people who find it important to do their jobs well in the service industry. Its also really rare that even after a long day she was still cordial. People notice the extra mile. If anyone stays at the hotel be sure to tell her there is a comment about her on tripadvisor :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: cedric666
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in September 2011. The hotel is right on Times Square and Broadway theatre. For that location you can't have a better deal. Rooms a quite small for any other cities in US but for NYC it's a good size! We had a partial view on Broadway on the 15th floor, again nothing amazing but still better than a view on a wall. We had a room close to the elevator and I wouldnâ€™t recommend it. You could hear the noise of the elevators during the night. Too bad since the rooms were sound proof from the busy streets. Parking is on the premises (you have to leave your car to a valet). Hotel have a small fitness room with a large pool on the 10th floor (no sauna, no spa). An outdoor patio is linked to the pool where you could have some sun. This is a great add-on. Overall I would recommend this hotel. It does worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Awesome Location, Awesome City...”
Reviews.Author: Leo M
Reviews.Content: Since we arrived to the hotel at 11 am the service was unforgettable. we arrived 3 hours before check in and eventhoug they should not have they gave us the room. The rooms were nice and we had an incredible, yet unforgettable time.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, good and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: WillyM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well lcoated at the 7th avenue, it has very good looks. The receptionists could be a little nicer, as they seem to be too tired for doing their jobs :) All in all, the rooms are very confort and clean. The price is not cheap, but fare is good for the area it is located. For that price and area, and the looks of the hotel, it is a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: Truth_in_MD
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is an older hotel but the location is excellent. Walk put the door and your at Tine Square! A few blocks over is Rockefeller Center where there is ice skating, morning new shows and SNL. The only con I can think of is that my room was too warm and I cracked my window for a breeze, the subway is across the street and kept me up but hey, it is NYC. They charge me $45 bucks to park in the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value in significant area of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Chicagohoosier07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was surprisingly nice with more spacious rooms than I have previously seen in NYC. If you stay above the 5th floor, it is quiet. Beds were very comfortable and staff was very helpful with directions, recommendations, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: yismail
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Manhattan @ Time Square. Kids loved the indoor pool. Confortable beds to rest before heading out to Time Square...exceptionally located walking distance to everything (central park/ 5th avenue/ time square of course)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an ideal central location.”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_Mark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Manhattan for St Patricks weekend last year (sorry for the late review, I did write one back in May but must have forgot to press send, my opinions are the same nevertheless). This was our third trip to NY from the UK and we are used to the small and old fashioned style of rooms you get in the city so we were prepared for the same here, however when we got to our room we were surprised and very pleased to see that the room was quite big for New York sizes and modern looking. We did get an upgrade as it was my wifeâ€™s birthday so I am not sure whether all rooms are this standard. The location of this hotel was the big selling point to us, we wanted a central location so being 3 blocks north of times square and 3 west of the Rockefeller was ideal for us. From here it is a 15 min walk down to Macyâ€™s or 2 min walk to Broadway. Check-in was a breeze, we arrived around 17:00 and there was only one couple ahead of us, the girl on the desk was very nice and helpful, as mentioned above we got an upgrade after mentioning it was my wifeâ€™s birthday, however, donâ€™t expect this every time, we dropped on well, not all staff members on check-in desks give an upgrade, a $20 tip does help sometimes but most hotel chains are now trying to cut down the $20 sandwich upgrade trick. Room: The room had a big king sizes bed and was really comfy with lots of pillows, we had a flat screen TV on the wall which was nice to relax and watch while getting ready to go out at night. There is also coffee making facilities, however my one gripe with this was they gave us 3 sachets of install on arrival and not re-stocked, I am sure if you ring down they will bring more up but I wasnâ€™t overly concerned by this. The bathroom the usual, half-tub with shower, sink and toilet, they bubble bath and shower gel provided by the hotel smelled lovely and did the job (these were replaced daily). We had a view out over 52nd St and up 7th Ave towards Central Park, as with everywhere in New York you get traffic noise 24/7 but what do expect from being in the centre of a big city?? We did not use the concierge during this trip but after checking out we waited around the lobby for an hour for our lift to the airport and overheard the concierge helping a lot of people and these guys were super friendly and very helpful. From giving directions to booking taxiâ€™s, trips or shows they were doing the lot and all with a smile, so from that experience I would say they are worth a visit. The service with a smile seemed to be a common theme around this hotel and it makes a difference, it made us feel like we were welcome here and that we are being listened too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for New Year but doesn't tick all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: flexible
Reviews.Content: You only get one chance to make a first impression and the management/owner of this hotel was sadly let down when we arrived by your staff. We arrived at 18.30 to be told that although we had pre-booked two rooms together about 8 months before they actually wasn't together. The guy on the reception said we could have the two rooms now on the same floor, not together, or if we wanted them together would have to wait for them to be cleaned. We asked how long would we have to wait as we would pop out for something to eat and know when to get back, he went to the back office, came back and said he was waiting for a call and would let us know in a moment. I asked why when you have to check-out by 12 noon and you have this booking are the rooms not ready, he was quite abrupt and rude and said some rooms are ready......he ignored the point completely. Well we stood there and waited to be told what time they would be ready and we waited and waited. Well we could not believe what we witnessed whilst waiting. The most rudest man we've ever seen, one of the hotels concierges.......make a note of his name "Ronald", avoid this man and if the hotel has any sense and wants paying guests to recommend or return here get rid of him. A French couple, paying guests mind you, made a mistake. It was due to a breakdown in the language barrier. Well hello Ronald but this hotel will get people from all over the world, and sadly you are employed there to assist these guests....yes they are guests, if no guests then no jobs.....you may want to remember that. Looks like you need to retire as you are past it as no patience or customer service skills whatsoever. You will get guests who annoy you or make mistakes but thats part of the job - deal with it. These people had asked him to book a car for the next day to take them to the airport, which he did. Then they went away a little confused as they'd paid him.....the confusion arose as they'd already paid for a car but actually just needed to arrange the time for collection.........an easy mistake to make if neither sides speaks each others language. They then went back to "Friendly" Ronald...........he was so rude to them and went on and on how they had made the mistake and how they should have shown him this particular piece of paper they now had beforehand, no kidding he repeated himself over and over again and was waving the piece of paper literally in their faces, he wanted everyone in the hotel foyer to hear, which we all did, "You made the mistake.....not me", over and over again, "I can refund it, no problem but you made the mistake not me......" then went over it all again, and again and again, instead of just refunding it. He then called a colleague over and asked him if he spoke french to which he responded that he didn't, that colleague then went to the back office and brought a lady out who spoke to them but not before good old "Friendly" Ronald told her it all again, only Ronald did embellish it more now and said how the couple were not listening to him and arguing back, well I beg to differ there old chum as that couple deserved a medal as anyone else would have told you straight, they just stood there not saying a word, the poor woman was so embarrassed we really felt sorry for them and said so to the receptionist staff, who too were clearly embarrassed. I got the impression that this was normal for "Friendly Ronald". Well after that long marathan write up you have probably realised that to witness all of that we must have been stood there a while..........oh yes......we were still waiting to be told what time the rooms would be ready.........40 minutes later still waiting. Then the receptionist looked up and said "One is ready now"??? Er we weren't actually waiting for it to be cleaned all this time, we could have been out eating all this time. So we went to this one room and dropped the luggage and went out. When we got back the guy on the reception had gone so someone else gave us the other room key and guess what..........the rooms were still not together. Incredibly they were on the same floor which apparently we could have had when we arrived so we waited 40 minutes for absolutely nothing, other than witnessing The Manhattans own floor show starring Ronald. This receptionist guy, meant to get his name but sadly didn't, something like Paoblo or something, could be wrong short guy with glasses, very nice man so helpful and kind and apologetic, he said he didn't know why the first guy, larger bald and miserable had said the room next to the one given to us earlier would have been ours as that was never the case as someone else was in it. But he kindly arranged to meet us the next day to move us to be together, which he did. Thats the kind of staff you need, perhaps he can train Ronald and the other guy. If anyone from this hotel is actually reading this and is really interested in improving the customer experience look at your staff rota for the night of 28 Dec 2011 at 18.30 you'll know to whom we refer. When we got our rooms the next day, location good but not brilliant rooms. Sheets and towels clean, bathroom cleaned but the carpets could do with a really good hoover rather than a quick skim over, the alarm clocks were thick with dust in both rooms. I've stayed in better in NYC. That together with the staff experience has sadly put me off, however if I really want to stay in Times Square and nowhere else available I would go back. Great location for the New Years Eve experience but there again so would some of the hotels be as well. Could have all been so different. Had the pre-booked rooms been ready we wouldn't have had the couldn't care less attitude of one receptionist and not seen the "All shouting and all blazing Ronald" in all his glory, such is life eh! I feel sorry for the managers if not aware of this but there again as you get thousands of visitors every year to Times Square for everyone not coming back you get plenty more coming along, so probably not bothered. You did take the edge off what was a 12 month planned celebration for our sons 18th birthday, not the greatest of welcomes.

Reviews.Title: “Returning visitor enjoys great Christmas stay 2011”
Reviews.Author: eurospender
Reviews.Content: We returned here to once again visit our son who is currently starring in Boradway's "Spideman Turn Off the Dark " as Spiderman ! We were last here in the summer , the weekend Hurricane Irene hit New York when we were pleasantly looked after , having to stay an extra 3 days due to cancelled flights. The hotel was bustling with activity at Christmas but we were quickly looked after at reception, taken courteously to our room, 1146 and enjoyed its amenities. Yes the hotel probably does look a bit dated and could do with a modernisation but rooms are a decent , no small size, facilties work, rooms are changed daily and there is a coffee/tea service in room. Ice and vending machine down the hall. One reason we book here is the pool and gym facility. On our 8 day stay, there was only one day when we were NOT the only people in the pool 8am - 9 am ! So we felt it was just ours. We commend the pool staff for their friendliness. Thank you to them . For our purposes, the hotel is ideally situated - we walk everywhere taxiing / subwaying as required. It is just 5 minutes walk to heart of times square. Delis/mcdonalds starbucks, even a chinese are within a stones throw and of course theatre land is on the door step. We recommend this hotel to others . I am sure there are probably better out there, but we return because our experience has been uniform on each visit and we are satisfied with what we have found. Our only gripe is that internet service is charged ( $14.95 per 24 hours )and not discounted over the week long stay period.

Reviews.Title: “Has the room ever been cleaned?”
Reviews.Author: mandyandbryson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in October. We were nervous about our stay because we read all of the reviews. While the location was excellent, the cleanliness of our room was absolutely unacceptable. We found dirty men's bikini briefs in our room as well as several pairs of socks. Based upon the large amount of dust that accumulated on these, I'm guessing they were there for a very long time. Additionally, our bathroom was filthy! It looked like it was not cleaned between stays. I have stayed in cleaner budget hotels in third world countires.

Reviews.Title: “Average & Old”
Reviews.Author: ManoloMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: Good location. The oldest elevators I've ever ridden. The pool smells chlorine even one floor above or below the floor it is located. The rooms look empty, a couch would be a good idea, small closet, mini bathroom. Adapting an old building requires more than changing beds and linen, the rooms should be remodelled.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvlBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night using points. The locations is fantastic, blocks from Times Square and within walking distance of so much more. The room was small (as expected for NYC) but clean and comfortable. We did not visit the bar or use the pool but both looked nice. The hotel staff was fantastic, special mention to the concierge who let us borrow his iPhone charger. For the location, this is a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay,super location!”
Reviews.Author: Henzey4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in d beginning of December 2011. D lobby is very attractive. Rooms are nice,nothing spectacular but definitely no problems with them. Without doubt the location is d main attraction. Times square can be seen from d entrance. Overall an enjoyable stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable room. Close to times square. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable room. Close to times square. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to it but you CANNOT beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: TheSantiagos
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! The price was a little higher than I thought it would be for what it was but overall I was happy. Staff isn't the greatest but I was too busy to care. I just need a clean bed, and a central location to stay while I'm in NYC...this is my spot!

Reviews.Title: “if your a light sleeper do not book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: john287
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel 23rd dec 2011 for a week ,was unable to sleep walls r like paper and doors bang constant all night ,the amenities and location were great but hotel is very dated but could have lived with that if we could have got a nights sleep reception was not one bit helpful even though i explained we were here for a week i found the main reception staff were not friendly but the information and security staff were friendly and helpful,ive stayed at the beacon hotel and also the affinia manhattan on prior trips and never lost a nights sleep so was totally unprepared for this after site seeing and shopping you need to rest well this is not the hotel for this, we also asked if we could have a late checkout instead of 1pm could we extend it to 5pm as we had a 9.35pm flight they said it would be $299 dollars i told them to forget it

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: romazzino
Reviews.Content: Traveled to NYC for a quick overnight before year end. Given that I was in the city the day before New Year's Eve, most hotel rates were extremely high. I found The Manhattan to be moderately priced and upon arriving amazed by the fantastic location. You are truly in the middle of it all between Central Park and Times Square. Great restaurants and of course theaters all within blocks of the hotel. It is no secret that this hotel is in need of a refresh as compared to other hotels it is dated, but kudos to housekeeping as the room was extremely clean and smelled fresh. My biggest surprises were the comfortable bed and the great bed linens. The pillows were amazing! so soft and thick they felt like clouds. A very large plasma screen and generous desk workspace. The Comfort Zone Italian-Made bathroom amenities were a definite treat! The room was extremely clean. All the employees were genuine and very welcoming. Guillermo at the front desk was a delight. The housekeeping personnel on my floor was very friendly and smiley.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay.”
Reviews.Author: GRIFFONEAGLE
Reviews.Content: Rooms were okay, but very small by American standards. Nice pool and gym and great location, but the staff were not as friendly as they could have been. The good thing is that this is a hotel that is not as big as its competition across the street, so more effort is made to make the rooms nice and comfortable. Overall, not a bad stay for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “about a 2 1/2 star”
Reviews.Author: 5thramone
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights with family after Christmas. Location very good, near Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Check in very slow, staff seemed overwhelmed. Didn't have cot in room, called three times, said they'd take care of it right away, took 3 hours. Booked two rooms but they were on different floors, not good for a family.Rooms were very small, bathrooms tired. Walls were all nicked up, shower/tub had an ill fitting vinyl liner. Rooms were very hot.Turned down temp to 60 but room stayed at 78 all night. Found out they turn A/C off in Winter, bellboy showed us how to open windows a crack and the room cooled down the second day. Pool fine for a 3 star hotel, temp about 74. Breakfast good staff friendly with kids. Only 4 slow elevators, can get very bottle-necked. Found a box of condoms in safe left by previous happy guest. Put in room _18. Don't let them book you in any room ending in 18, they're behind the elevator and crazy noisy

Reviews.Title: “Not a let down.”
Reviews.Author: Luke J
Reviews.Content: As long as you're getting a good deal you get exactly what you pay for. The hotel is in a great location, you can see Time Square from the front door of the hotel. The room was a pretty good size however the bathroom is kind of small. Just like every other review the hotel is dated but that didn't bother me at all. The only real negative is the hotel restaurant that only serves breakfast. I knew it was going to be expensive from previous reviews but we had just checked out and didn't want to walk anywhere because it was so cold outside. OJ, a waffle, french toast and bacon was $48. I was mad at myself when i walked out. Overall the hotel is exactly what you need for a trip to NYC however just don't pay too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bernie W
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of time square and near everything that we wanted to see, the Manhattan at Times Square was a great value. I stayed with my family and my young kids loved the pool, the room was very clean, the beds were comfortable. The front desk crew was very helpful, we arrived well before check in and they got our two adjoining rooms available asap, and they accepted our request for a high floors so my kids could get a great view of the city. The front desk gave us a room overlooking Times Square; the kids loved it and we didn't have to go up to Empire State Building for a great view. We requested a late checkout and the accompanied us. We were very impressed with the hotel; would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: klamartin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay here and loved it! First of all, you can't beat the location...six blocks south to theater district, six blocks north to Central Park, one long block to Radio City. We were in the city for 7 days and never rode the subway! We took a taxi to the 9/11 memorial, and that was our only taxi ride. Check in was great. Bellman was wonderful, and they remembered us each day when we returned. All the employees were very helpful. The room was clean and not as small as I had expected. The walls were a little thin, as we could hear people talking in the next room, but we slept with a noise machine, so it really didn't bother us. The only negative was the breakfast in the restaurant was extremely overpriced. they charged $25.50 for the breakfast buffet. If you ordered a la carte, you paid $5.50 for coffee and $16 - $17 for an entree. But after the first day we discovered that Applebee's around the corner offered breakfast for around $( per person with free coffee! We went thee every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good fitness center, great pool = fun stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights with friends. Room is definitely New York style, i.e. small. Anything more than two people makes it feel cramped, especially is you have luggage. Room is small but adequate for one person. Room was clean and the view on 7th avenue was nice. I must say the room was a little too hot, even though we tried to control the temperature. We ended up leaving the window open most of the time. Hotel lobby is spacious and offers free internet and printers (albeit those were not working a the time). I really enjoyed the fitness center (although it is rather small and more cardio-oriented) and the swimming pool which is very nicely landscaped (indoor) and of a good size for being in the center on Manhattan. All in all, a good location in a qonderful position.

Reviews.Title: “Very slow service”
Reviews.Author: Jaehee80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights and I was apalled with the service I was getting. I read the reviews and thought hey it's a Starwood property how bad can it be. It wasn't that bad until my last night. When I called for a wake up call I was waiting on the phone for a good three minutes and I guessed they were busy so hung up and tried again ten minutes later. When I called again I was greeted with a rude voice, when asking for a wake up call she rushed me and then hung up on me. When I come to new York I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ruddski1
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, was in the city to see a play. Room was a good size for Manhattan and you can't beat the location on 7th ave, a few blocks from Times Sq. Check in was a little slow but all the employees I encountered were courteous and helpful. The discription for parking says Valet, but its a standard parking garage located half a block away, which was fine. Also only $45.00 for overnight which is pretty good in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again without hestitating.”
Reviews.Author: Aims258
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to think given mixed reviews here, but we found the main desk and concierge staff friendly and helpful, the room quiet despite being next to the elevator (could hear elevator in bathroom but not out in the rest of the room so that was no problem at all for us), everything clean. Yes, the rooms show their age but are completely fine - we were only there to sleep anyway! Bed was comfortable and clean, plenty of pillows. Location could hardly be better. I requested a room on a higher floor before we arrived b/c of what I read here about street noise. When we arrived the clerk was aware of the request but couldn't accommodate it for that night. She said we could switch the next day to a higher floor if we'd like but we ended up staying put. Our room (7th floor) looked over the interior courtyard of the hotel, so that may be one reason it was quiet and city lights didn't bother us there.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lesia m
Reviews.Content: we love our stay we were treated great it was more than we expected, we plan to stay on our next visit, the pool was great, every thing was just great,thanks to the manhattan time square hotel it was a great exsperiene thanks again we look forward to our next stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chocgirl
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend to meet up with family. After a nightmare flight and 2 hours in immigration we arrived late afternoon. Check-in was quick and easy. We took our own bags to the room. The room was on 15th floor and had a queen bed. The small bathroom had a bath and shower over. Everything was clean and tidy, but the decor was dated and the electrical fittings / sockets / switches were like something from the 1950s. The room was serviced well each day (sometimes as late as 5pm) and toiletries were good quality and replenished. There was no noise problem, either from the street or neighbours - but we were completely shattered most of the time! Our family stayed in adjoining rooms on the 8th floor. Their rooms were a little larger but the same decor and standard. Perfectly adequate. Breakfast was in the diner area on the ground floor and was extremely expensive. There are pleanty of diners etc within spitting distance, so explore and get better value. The location really is in the thick of it and I guess that's why it's not cheap. It was convenient for us to meet up with family, go out with kids in the evening to eat not far away. Walk to central park, the Rockefeller centre (Christmas tree), the subway stop, shops etc. with kids in tow. It's a basic, decent, centrally located hotel and was fine for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly noisy”
Reviews.Author: Buck W
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night and could not go to sleep! They put me next to the service elevator room 2128... They should not rent this room, worse noise than NYC traffic all night! They sent up a tech. After complaining and he said "oh well" you can't help machinery noise. Thank god used price line,,,,,this hotel is a 1/2 star!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nothing else”
Reviews.Author: lwgaddes
Reviews.Content: The only thing I was satisfied with at this hotel was the location. Service and friendliness from the staff were non-existant. The room was below average in cleanliness and upkeep. We couldn't find an electrical plug to charge phones and cameras that wasn't near the floor. I finally had to pull the table away from the wall and rearrange things so we didn't have to put our stuff on the floor. The sound of the elevator was constant even though we were 3 rooms away from them. Again, the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Denise V
Reviews.Content: There was absolutely nothing to complain about. We went for the parade, and it could not have been a better experience. The staff was friendly and helpful; the beds were comfortable; the location was great--on the parade route! I will book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Total Dump for a Starwood Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: TomJinDC
Reviews.Content: This hotel previously Was the "Sheraton Manhattan" hotel and is directly accross the street and often confused with the "New York Sheraton" hotel. I have not stayed here since they were - de-Sheratoned. When I checked in the front desk person told me "just so you know we are not a branded hotel any more. We do not have any of the amenities or upgrades that brand name hotels have." This must include a decision to not replace dated, beat up furniture, replace old carpets or ofter wifi in rooms. Everything from the elevators to the bathrooms to the room decor is more akin to something you would find at a roadside motel than what one would expect at a New York business hotel. The price is high ($349 a night midweek for my stay) for a run down hotel. There is no bar or restaurant or even place to get a morning coffee (there is a coffee maker in the room with generic coffee). While there are hundreds of places to eat within blocks, this is a review of the hotel, not the neighborhood. I can see why the Sheraton name was removed from this hotel, they should also remove the Starwood brand from the hotel as this location falls well below their normal standards.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: harmona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and can say it was satisfactory and nice to relax in the pool after a busy day in the city. Hence we decided to stay again but then had a completely differenct experience. First bath tub was blocked and not draining, rooms felt dirty/dusty. We were fine in the city pollution all day but then were kept up coughing from the dusty room each night. When asking room service to clean rooms properly, little improvment was noticed, resulting in having to complain to the house keeping manager who agreed the room was not satisfactory but still not too bothered or apologetic. We decided to investigate the room further and found baking soda and a dirty spoon hidden under the mattress. We informed reception who assured us it would be dealt with when we returned from our day trip but this wasnt. Overall terrible service from management - would definately not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Could do with more facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Bigbobw617
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights end of Nov/early Dec. The location is superb. Right off Times Sq and 5 min walk to Rockefeller Centre. The rooms are comfortable and good size. We did get awoken by noisey guests in the early hours several nights. It's a shame there is no bar, restaurant or coffee area. There's a good Internet / computer access area, but the hotel really misses out on the non availability of food and drink. Surprisingly they do have a breakfast restaurant (pricey!) but this area is not available for other times. Overall, we did enjoy our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY STAFF & GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Maria Eiras
Reviews.Content: After i made my reservation for my last visit to New York, with the MANHATTAN AT TIMES SQUARE HOTEL, November 2011, I read in Trip Advisor, some discouriging reviews about this hotel. But after staying for 5 nights, I feel I must reverse those comments. My room was clean, Good bed and bathroom clean. Very nice room maid, simpÃ¡tica polish lady, Sophia. What I did not like at all, it was having in the lobby, people seated with trays, with food, drinks, as if they were in a restaurant or in the room. Never seen that attitude not even in a simple hostel or pensione. Overall my stay at the hotel and New York City, was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff, a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: bcerbelli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend 2011. The location is perfect for exploring the area. You are a 2-3 blocks from the craziness of Times Square and 5 -6 blocks from Central Park. There is so much to do in this area and the hotel is in the center of it all. The staff were all very friendly and helpful when needed. The hotel itself is in okay condition. I would say 3 out of 5 stars. The lobby is average and not too big. They have 5 computers for guest use where you can print your boarding passes or surf the net. A small shop with souveniers and munchies as well. There is a restaurant in the hotel but we did not eat there. The rooms themselves are ok. We had a king room on the 11th floor. Everything was a little worn and could use some refrshing. It did have a 40" flat screen TV, desk with wired internet included as well. The wireless was free too but at the time of our visit it was pretty slow. The bathroom was small but everything worked as it should. Our 2 biggest complaints were 1) the sheets. They are no cozy and make loud noises when you toss or turn. 2) The wall are pretty thin. We could here doors closing at all hours of the night, as well as horns being blown on the street below. So, I would suggest a higher room and maybe bring your own sheets if you can. All in all, the location made this hotel worth the stay, not to mention the prices arent bad at all, especially given the proximity to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location+Great Service= I Can Ignore the Other Problems”
Reviews.Author: 2SunSisters
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel. Though the first time was fine, this time was better. In general I was surprised at how different the property was from the Sheraton across the street. Itâ€™s a little unclear their relationship to the Sheraton, but I remember years ago they were under the same ownership. It seems as though there has been a change in ownership, but they are still a Starwood property. Service was definitely the most positive aspect to this hotel. The front desk staff was very pleasant as I recall from my previous stay. When I arrived, I was contemplating staying at another hotel in the area and the front desk person offered me free internet for the evening since she saw me with my laptop in hand and I planned to do some work. This helped me make my decision to stay. I was looking for food that evening and the concierge tried hard to help me find one. The lobby area is small but has a nice buzz and a few computers and a couple of couches and chairs. The location clearly is a plus as it is around the corner from Times Square and near several attractions and subway trains. The room was pleasant enough, not high end but not too shabby. The bathroom could have used a little updating, but it was clean and acceptable for the price.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND VALUE FOR THE CITY”
Reviews.Author: onemantwokids
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed here multiple times over multiple Thanksgivings and had the most amazing views of the Macy's Day Parade. I really don't understand some of the bad reviews on this site. Is this an old hotel? Yes, and actually most of the hotels are older. Also, most NYC hotel rooms are small so I fail to see the problem with the room sizes. If you want a big new hotel room then go somewhere else and pay $1000 per night. The rooms here are appointed just fine. Linens are very nice, mattresses are comfy and I have yet to see any bedbugs ever. Great view, flat screen TV and CLEAN bathroom. The carpeting appeared to be new also. I could care less that there is no restaurant in the building. Just step outside and go left or right any time of day or night for any kind of food you want. Cleaning staff are very nice and accommodating and brought us all the extra towels and supplies we asked for pomptly along with extra pillows and came up at midnight to exchange the non-working hi-speed modem. This hotel also has a heated indoor pool which is rare for the city and a gym on site. There is also at least a dozen computers free for anyone to use in the lobby. For the price and service, this hotel is a bargain in the best location of Manhattan. Four blocks to Times Square, 2 blocks to Rockefeller Plaza and 12 or so blocks to Central Park. Great staff that seems to be there every year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Molly B
