Reviews.Content: I don't what all the the complaints are about. Yes it's a bit dated but it's clean and the staff were great! There were three occaisions when I called the front desk for something. The firs time was becasue my safe was locked when we arrived, the second was because we decided we wanted a cot for the room. On both occasions they arrived at our door within five minutes. The third time I called was at 12:30 am and we wanted an extra blanket. Because of the hour, it took about 10 - 15 minutes for that request. The concierge was extremely helpful and everyone was friendly. There were computers in the lobby for hotel guests and we had no trouble getting one. Wifi in the lobby also. We didn't eat in the restaurant. I think they only serve breakfast. But that was okay because there was tons of places close by to eat or have a drink. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. I would go back in a second! In fact, my sister is planning a trip back next year and she plans to stray there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic amenities (eg no in-room Wi-fi, No room service). Wait till it has been properly "Sheratonised"”
Reviews.Author: ggypsy5
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to try this for a while, since it joined the Starwood Group. It is a great location, but expensive for a totally 'no-frills' hotel: basic, but adequate rooms (bigger than the neighbouring Sheraton and Towers), no charm or style, no room service, patchy Wi-fi only in the lobby, need t go round the corner for the Coffee Shop (the local Deli). Despite these negatives, after a busy work week, it started to grow on me - a bit of a facelift and a facility or two, and this has good potential.

Reviews.Title: “very sad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Memo M
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, but awful service, dirty and old rooms! Its a shame to be called a Starwood or SPG hotel...Badly needs renovation! Walls are way too thin and you can hear almost everything happening on the floor... If you put your DND sign, make sure you lock the door, as the cleaning woman might pop in.....

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Times Square area.”
Reviews.Author: metro2001
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on this hotel through Priceline. This was more than half price compared to the conference rate where my meeting was located 1 block away. Overall, I really had no complaints considering the discounted room. Nice basic hotel, clean. There is actually an indoor pool which is definitely a bonus in NYC. Fitness room is pretty basic. Free wifi in lobby only. Priceline gave it a 3 star and I think that is about right. If you want better in that area, I think you are going to pay a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel! That Starwood would lend it's name to this hotel is unconscionable”
Reviews.Author: notgonnahappen
Reviews.Content: This was literally THE worst hotel experience I have ever had. They were performing major renovations (much needed) throughout the hotel without shutting it down. The fumes in the lobby when I walked in the door were so noxious, I began coughing and gasping for air and my eyes began to water. When I commented to the front desk clerk, they actually tried spinning it into a positive by suggesting I could get a good high from inhaling. That should have been my first clue, but it only got worse. After checking in I proceeded directly to my room to hopefully escape the construction noise and horrible smell. When I opened the door, there were empty liquor bottles, newspapers, trash and stained sheets thrown around the room and it smelled worse than the lobby where the construction was going on. When I went downstairs to complain, they laughingly apologized that the room was not clean. They told me it was the last room in the hotel that they knew for sure was empty, because their computer system was down. They offered to have the room cleaned if I was willing to wait an hour for the housekeeping staff to return from their break - this was at 1:00AM in the morning. At that point, I refused to take anymore from this dump of a hotel and asked to be "walked" to another property. It is standard practice when you have a guaranteed reservation for a hotel to make other arrangements on your behalf if they do not have an available room upon your arrival, but here they refused to honor my request. I then asked to speak to a manager, only to be told there was not one on duty. After pressing the issue, they finally connected me to the manager of the â€œSheraton New Yorkâ€� sister property two blocks up the street. When I finally got him on the phone, he seemed understanding of my concerns and offered to help if he could. I asked if I could walk up to the Sheraton to meet him in person, because I could not stand the fumes in the lobby for even another minute. He agreed and I walked up the street in the rain to meet him. When I got to the Sheraton, the manager I had spoken to was nowhere to be found. I waited 45 minutes for someone to find him, but he was gone, instead, one of his assistants came out to talk to me. I again asked to be walked to another property. The assistant responded that the Sheraton was sold out. And he would not make accommodations at any other SPG property because all that was available that night anywhere in the city was over $500 a night, which was too expensive. I asked him to come back back down to the Manhattan Hotel with me so that he could see for himself how bad the situation was. He agreed and we walked back together, but even though he vigorously coughed when we walked into the lobby, he tried telling me it wasn't bad enough to merit walking me to another location. After 20 minutes of arguing, while he would not agree to walk me (make the arrangements and cover the costs) he agreed to at least cancel my reservation at the Manhattan and allow me to make my own arrangements at another location, which at that point I gladly accepted. Now here's the real kicker - after all that, it turns out that the Manhattan Hotel charged my credit card for the full price of the room anyway. How is that for service to a SPG Platinum member? All I can say is NEVER AGAIN will I frequent either the Manhattan Hotel or the Sheraton New York!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: LMAYN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from NYC after spending 4 nights with 18 friends at the Manhattan at Times Square Hotel...The locations is awesome and the hotel was great. We shared three to a room and had no problems. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We would not hesitiate to recommend this hotel to anyone and we plan to stay at this hotel when we return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: ndmVt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times before when it was still the poor younger brother of the Sheraton across the street. Has since had the new name change but is still a Starwood Property. Lobby looks nice and the entire staff are still quite nice, friendly and accommodating. Above the lobby, the entire property however, needs an overhaul -- rooms, halls, and fixtures. The property is just showing its age and hard use. The rooms are clean, and the beds, pillows and linens are fine, which is what really counts when you want a good night's sleep in comfort. Great location of course and the condition allows for a "reasonable" price for mid-town near Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great value”
Reviews.Author: Jerry B
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, within walking distance of all the theatres and restaurants. Clean and comfortable. Valet parking available. The hotel could use some refurbishment. Carpets, bathrooms looked worn. Friendly staff. A great value. When visiting to do the theatres or Time's Square we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs some upgrading”
Reviews.Author: RayMooreme
Reviews.Content: The good - There is no doubt that it's the perfect location. Central, close to subway, just close enough to Times Square but far enough to avoid the chaos of people there. Right on a bunch of Broadway Theatres. The reception staff were great, and helpful. On 7th avenue - Hop-on/off bus on same street, close to Rockerfller Centre, 7th Ave shops, Central Park etc. Overally we were very, very happy with location. We were very happy with bed size (king) and pillows (and we are quite fussy). Had no issues with cleaning staff who were very freindly. The not so good - Carpets, furnishings etc are very old and tired. It would be nice if there was a doorman to assist people arriving with the suitcases. Free access to PCs in the foyer area but always packed with other residents. TV channels were pathetic - no general news channels in a good hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Small room, tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: rickandjohn
Reviews.Content: Besides being given a room that backed up to the elevator bank so that we constantly heard the up & down of the cables, the room was small & bathroom was one of the smallest we've experienced in a hotel. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tbrek
Reviews.Content: Definately not what I expected for a Starwood property. Location is great but hotel is dated, expensive, and employees not very customer focused. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very very bad... never visit again”
Reviews.Author: Sanjay M
Reviews.Content: -- In the middle of night at 3:30 am they assign same room to somebody and they keep knocking my door... -- No body cleaned my bad/room during the day -- Next day night neighbour started parting after 2:00 am -- After 3 nights of stay I checked out and got bill next day they added another bill with 1 more day -- I called 4 times to settled my bill. Call startwood.... they are also bunch of jokers. they said talk to hotel in the business hours... basically it was useless. -- AC was very noisey So technically my two night was very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised - comfortable beds, spacious rooms and THE Best location!”
Reviews.Author: MarshaC
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews on tripadvisor I was a little apprehensive as had booked two rooms for a family birthday celebration, we were more then pleasently surprised! Upon arrival we entered a clean, large lobby and were greeted by friendly check in staff. We had two king rooms both on the 22nd floor and were very surprised at how large and spacious they were having stayed in other NY hotels where the rooms were much smaller. The Bathroom was also very wide and spacious with a large bath with shower, a big dressing table and mirror with some nice starwoods gels/shampoos/body creams etc. During our stay the room was kept asbolutely spotless, and it was a pleasure to come home to after a hard days touring in NYC, we also availed of the complimentary interenet in the lobby which was a great nice to have. The hotel was basic (missed having a hotel bar for nightcap! and the restaurant only does breakfast), but it was very clean, comfortable and spacious, and finally the biggest sell of all is LOCATION, LOCATION! The hotel is literally in the heart of time square and there is something very special when you leave the hotel lobbey and you are bang slap in the heart of one of worlds most famous and exciting places. We could walk to any of the theatres, rockafeller center, 5th Ave, Central Park in minutes - and there were lots of fun bars and some great restaurants of any cuisine you fancied within minutes too. We were in NYC for 3 nights for a special family birthday and the Manhatten at Times Squares comfrotable, clean and spacious rooms, and its truly fantastic location really added to our trip. Its not fancy but for a 3 star hotel, it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, needs a major renovation”
Reviews.Author: Nedblanders
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right outside of time square. The hotel staff was friendly and did their best to make my stay enjoyable in this outdated tired property. The rooms were clean, but all of the furnishings and finishes are old and outdated. Tiles in the bathroom were cracked, the vanity looked like something you'd find in a mid 1990's Holiday Inn, the carpet was worn, the bed was terrible, and the common areas were dull. The staff's service was what you would expect from a Starwood Property, which is good, but the building needs some serious work.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: jazzlo
Reviews.Content: I would put this more on par with other 3.5 star luxury hotels in the area. Really enjoyed the stay, style and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: StevenBSydney
Reviews.Content: It's not going to set your holiday a-light but the Manhattan is clean, the staff are good (mostly) and it's in a great location. Only two things annoyed me: 1, finding the cleaners gloves left behind in my room. 2. one staff member ignored the 'do not disturb' and kept knocking on door...I'd had a long trip and needed the rest...her excuse: "well it's past 12 O'clock"...what am I 6?!?!? I'll sleep whenever the hell I want!!! So, you'll need to be vigilant if you want an incident free stay. No minibar, odd??? But the room I got was spacious. It was a good place and better than many of the squalid tiny boxes you often get in NYC for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a bit 'tired' but great location.”
Reviews.Author: nuggies186638
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, 2 mins walk from Times Square, 10 mins walk to Central Park.....Rooms need up-dating, but were clean. NO sound proofing. A woman in the corridor at 3 am sounded like she was going to cough her lungs up and a man in a room either adjacent, or a floor above was having a really good time in a very noisy way!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location but not a lot else”
Reviews.Author: maryvictoria
Reviews.Content: We loved the location here near Moma and Lindys and theater. But this Starwood property has small rooms, no restaurant, no room service, no wi fi and few of the services one comes to expect from Starwood. The lobby is noisy and crowded , Most of the concierges dont seem to care a lot about helping you. However they do have a very nice pool and hot tub. If the price is right its probably worth it just for the great location. Supercritic

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, not much more”
Reviews.Author: CarolLeeAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The pros of this hotel are "location" and the quality of the bed and sadly that's about all the "pros" I can give this one! Cons.... rooms are dated, small and just need an update. They look sad. Hotel windows are not really double paned to reduce sound and hotel is in a noisy area. There is no room service, no resturant (except for breakfast) and no lobby bar. The staff at the front desk seems to think smiling and being nice is beneath them. Hotel seems to make it's living off of tour groups so I guess they don't feel the need to upgrade but this hotel is really beneath the standard I expected for the Starwood Hotel group. We stayed here for Marathon weekend and wound up here because we waited too late to book. With better planning we could have gotten a nicer hotel for the same amount.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Hotel - preferred place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BigDoba
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay at the Manhattan Hotel when in mid-town. It's consistent in the checkin, check out and room experience. And it's quieter than other hotels I've stayed at in mid-town. My room was available when I arrived and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel about a year ago and I did not think it was that bad. However I just stayed there this past Halloween weekend of 2011 and I found the hotel to be really gloomy. The lobby is nice. But once you get off the elevator on your room floor the lighting is bad, the walls are dirty. I found the room to be dirty as well. I was looking for my camera and I had to pull the beds apart. The lineans were not clean. The curtins were not even clean. I was not impressed when I last stayed here. I really would prefer not to stay here again! I am not sure if the housekeeping management has changed but I did not have the same experience I had when I stayed in this hotel a year ago. I was actually afraid to sleep under the covers.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan K
Reviews.Content: While in New York I lost my credit card. The hotel worked with me for payment during my stay. They allowed me to pay my bill daily with cash.

Reviews.Title: “Good NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: denmarcjm
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms for New York and helpful staff. Location is good also. Would definitely use again when next in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, Rooms fine, Rest of hotel rubbish”
Reviews.Author: RFD51
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in NYC. What a place. Although you spend very little time in the hotel as you are out eating/shopping/drinking for what you pay the hotel is not good. Rude staff, run down and overpriced. The location is amazing though. Central Park, fifth ave, Rockefeller, Times Sq, Broadway all within a short walk. The worst part about the hotel is by far the staff and lack of facilities. There is no Bar and nowhere to get a drink in the building. There were many times when we would arrive (stumble) back after a late night out and we couldnâ€™t have a night cap. The staff are not interested in you at all which is strange for a hotel in the US. The door man Theo is one of the few members of staff who was helpful. The rest of them make you feel like you are disturbing their day dreaming session. My girlfriend and I will definitely be going back to NYC soon and no way would we stay here. If you are young couples looking to go to NY try the Meatpacking district/soho/western village for a hotel. Lots of really nice boutiques for the same price as this but its where all the cool rooftop bars/night spots are. If you are a family with kids under the drinking age of 21 I would recommend this area but not this hotel. Make sure you do head down to Meatpacking/soho/western village for shopping and really nice restaurants. There not cheap but well worth it. Rap up because it is really cold at the moment. Have a ball just not at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant experience!”
Reviews.Author: Alba-Andy
Reviews.Content: First time in New York and the hotel was tremendous! Situated on 7th avenue, it's location was perfect. Reception area is big, clean and the staff were extremely helpful and always smiling. Room was big and spacious, couldn't hear any noise from outside which meant we could sleep easily, bed was comfy too! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: FredNapa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a Sheraton, and is still a part of The Starwood chain, but don't go near it! Starwood should be absolutely ashamed of themselves to still list it as their property. We were even told by the bellman that it was no up to even the Sheraton's standards. After checking in and getting to the room, which was on a noisy corner that you could hear and feel the subway in our 7th floor room, we switched hotels to the Sheraton Hotel and Towers across the street, and were much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Medicore, Average, Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: CandymanOfOldForge
Reviews.Content: The Good Points: Checking in was easy, and the gentleman at the front desk was very pleasant. This hotel is convenient to Times Square, shopping, dining and attractions. It is easy to get a cab with the help of the doorman. There is good security and the concierge was helpful in recommending a restaurant. High speed internet is free in the lobby. The Bad: The doors to all hotel rooms are like 8 feet tall,(I'm not exagerating) making a resounding "SLAM" Each & Every time anyone closes a door near you in the hallway. We did not get much sleep, needless to say as people were coming and going all night long. Also,the walls are pretty thin too, not much privacy. You would think with the prices they charge for the rooms, internet would be included, but that is an extra charge(I believe 9.95 per night) There are no refrigerators in the room, so don't get any food wrapped in any of the restaurants. Bath tub and sink had cracks in them, although housekeeping does a good job with what they have to work with. The bed was not very comfortable, too firm for our tastes. I mentioned to the lady at the front desk how displeased we were, and she told me they had no vacancy tonight and I could move the following night. I told her that it would not be worth moving all of our stuff and switching rooms just for 1 night as we were checking out the following morning. The on premise restaurant has very good breakfast, but is WAY over priced (what else is new?) I mean 13.95 for 2 eggs and toast?? To top it off coffee is not even included for that price!!! Next trip to NYC, we will definately look else where for accomodations. I have a good mind to complain to SPG, if it would do any good!.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: JM2887
Reviews.Content: Great location and clean. The rooms seem a little outdated but that did not take away from a great stay at this hotel! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Ed P
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New York with my girlfriend for a purely sight-seeing trip and must admit I booked the hotel based on price and a fair amount of trepidation based on other reviews. Firstly the location is ideal for exploring the city, less than 1 minute walk from times square. The room itself was great, large bed large TV and adequate space (compared to what my expectations of New York were). The hotel in places was dated for example worn carpets and the health centre changing rooms but this had no effect on my enjoyment of our time in New York. We arrived at noon, so before our check-in time, and were advised that although rooms were available quieter ones on the higher floors would become available in the next few hours, we were given the option, left our bags and returned 2 hours later to be given a room on the 21st floor where the noises from Broadway below could barely be heard. In my opinion this was a great bit of service as the receptionist had noticed we were staying for a week. The only negative comment I have is the pushy abruptness of the theatre sales woman, although I am not sure if she was the direct responsibility of the hotel. All in all I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting New York as a tourist, I can speack for bussiness travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy M
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by Thomas Cook Signature as part of their rail tour holidays. Having come from a stunning Boston hotel, was met with a very crampt and shabby room on the 21st floor. Desk was very scratched and unstable and the room was not clean....even found an earwig crawling in a drawer! Spoke to manager who moved me the following morning to a much more suitable room which was spacious and in good decorative order. Location is ideal, although a few block walk to the centre of times square. Good leisure facilities, but the hotel could do with smartening up and thinking more carefully about their image.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Times Square-Starwood should be ashamed”
Reviews.Author: Ken A
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this "Starwood" property. Typically I really like them. This place was a disaster from the start. I had to call down 3 times to get feather pillows. Each time they brought up foam. My room was hot and I asked them to have engineering check it out. I never heard from them and I roasted all night. In the morning I asked to speak to a supervisor. She promised me that it would all be taken care of and that she would call me to let me know the outcome. Guess what, no response. I tried to have the "concierge" (they only have a bellperson to do this) make a dinner reservation. He called me to let me know that he could not reach them. I asked him to please keep trying. Guess what, no response. The shower head pulled out from the wall when I tried to move it. Upon check out I addressed my concerns again. All to no avail. They did insult me by offering me a small amount of points for my inconvenience. Inconvenience, how about no sleep due to a hot room!! When my complaint made it through the channels, the same person called me that I had spoken to. She told me that she left me a voice mail. Hmm, I guess their phone system does not work either. This property is a disgrace to Starwood!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vlmontero
Reviews.Content: great location, didn't even have to take the subway

Reviews.Title: “Great location - ideal for a short visit”
Reviews.Author: visual
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 1 night - the location is ideal for midtown business or tourists. Its billed as a 3-star, so I didn't have high expectations, but was pleasantly surprised by the room and the staff. The main reason its a 3* is the lack of restaurants etc, but in NYC who eats at their own hotel? I found a great Cuban place about a block away, and will probably try to stay again at this place if I have business in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Manhattan...”
Reviews.Author: JoyM1966
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to NY for a weekend away of shopping. This hotel has a great location, the rooms are very clean which was extremely important to us, staff are friendly and the hotel manager very helpful. The rooms have been renovated with new beds and carpets. I would not hesitate to recommend this non-branded hotel. It met my standards and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: moneill04
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel based on location for a weekend visit with friends and decided to try The Manhattan. IT was classy and AMAZING! The staff was friendly and welcoming and as tourists we appreciated all the vast information available from the concierge at the front desk. Not being familiar with the area they guided us to the best sites/restaurants/stores/bars. Ellen's Stardust Diner is right across the street where there are live performers while you are enjoying a delicious meal. It is blocks away from central park and times square. It's right where all of the action is! I could not have picked a better weekend vacation spot. The trip was memorable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other people looking for a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Three Generations”
Reviews.Author: Brooke S
Reviews.Content: My mom, my daughter, and myself were typical tourists in NY. The Manhattan at Times Square met all of our expectations and then some! We had a fantastic time. The hotel was beautiful, well maintained, great location and the staff was extremely helpful. It was within walking distance of everything which made it really nice. We will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Location Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: bobby51075
Reviews.Content: This hotel was older but kept up very well. Location is perfect for any where you want to get. Pool closed early on week ends and we did not get to use it but it looked very inviting and the deck outside was terrific ! Staff very knowledgable and very helpful as well. Rooms were clean and efficient with comfortable beds. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AngelaG
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be ideally situated for Times Square, Central Park and the hop on hop off buses which gave excellent tours of the city as well as providing transport to places of interest. Restaurants serving breakfast, lunches and dinners were close by. The staff were very pleasant, the bedrooms a decent size and we weren't disappointed in the cleanliness overall. The only thing I would suggest to the hotel, is to please place more seating in the lobby. Lots of people seemed to gather here and most had to stand.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and ........location”
Reviews.Author: gonzalo46
Reviews.Content: We've been there last October 2011; this hotel was hired by online way, pre-paid mode. We didnâ€™t any issue about it; my reservation and charges in my credit card were ok. When you arrive, the hotel building that you'll see is marvelous, pleasant, and terrific. Surprisingly the lobby was small for this great hotel, with few chairs, a little room where mostly were located PC for public and passengers use. In the counter there are 2 or 3 employees, none of them were Spanish speaker (may be, there are other employees who speaks Spanish, but they weren't at those moment). Mohammad (sorry if is not well written) was very kind, so patient with us; in general other employees in this hotel were kind and corrects. You know, hotels in NYC are old buildings, this is not the exception. But they are trying to renovate the structure. One important thing, it was CLEAN. The room was correct, not too small not to big, in standard one, with a king bed, you can walk around freely, the furniture were in good state, the carpet was clean, under the bed were not trash.Bathroom and the "affairs du toillette" (renovated everydays) were good, clean. Regarding to daily cleaning, is just the necessary, but, we verified that vacuum was never used. Gym and pool were perfect, these extra was absolutely valued. The location, 7th av at 51st is superb, you know, in a few blocks you have Broadway, with all theater around, restaurants, bars, etc. In summary, If you want to spend your time mostly hours in the city? this place will fill your expectations. Sure, it is expensive for this categorie, but, perhaps, cheap for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not for business travel”
Reviews.Author: RefreshinglyFrank
Reviews.Content: This hotel struck me more as an upscale hostel than a Starwood hotel. Limited service in the restaurant (breakfast only), no room service, no bar, no mini-bar or in room snacks etc, no wireless in the rooms, $15 a day for wired access. Lobby full of tour bus luggage racks. If I was spending a weekend in Manhattan to shop and sitesee etc, it would be fine, but for business travel, it just didn't have the amenities I like to have.

Reviews.Title: “Former Sheraton Manhattan is Good Value”
Reviews.Author: kevinbernardi
Reviews.Content: The hotel formerly known as the Sheraton Manhattan is still one of our favorites because of its excellent Midtown location. It's still in the Starwood Hotels group and therefore maintains a consisent product. The lobby offers a complimentary computer lounge with 7 desktops for guest use. When you can find a good rate here, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Its right where you want to be!”
Reviews.Author: ali360
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasure staying here. Great location. Can get anywhere in times sq easy.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, no services, absent staff, location OK”
Reviews.Author: BrazilBilly
Reviews.Content: If you are familiar with Starwood hotels, you will be very surprised to learn that this is a Starwood property. We stayed 5 nights and we were very disappointed in the experience and think the price was outrageous given the condition of the hotel and the staff. Our first room was so dirty that we moved rooms the following night. When we told the front desk the room was filthy and that the shower was backing up, they didn't even care. The location is in Times Square, but the hotel is pretty awful. In no particular order, here are my complaints: the front staff is disinterested and usually absent, the bell staff are simply ignorant about New York (didn't know how to get to airport except taxi, didn't know any restaurant in walking distance, gave us ridiculous recommendations, etc), the rooms and bathrooms were dirty (see photos), the walls were so thin we could hear everything, there was no heat and no AC, the internet did not work in the room (only lobby), the beds were not comfortable, there was no refrigerator, the TV didn't work most of the time, the TV only has about 12 channels when it does work, the only open outlet to charge computers/cell phones was in the bathroom (unless you want to unplug a light), there are no overhead lights, so it's very dark, our first room smelled old and like mildew, and the drapes in our second room didn't fully close (gap of about 2 feet). The previous guest in our second room had tried to tape the drapes closed with electrical tape. The maid who cleaned had left all the tape stuck to the drapes which gave the room a kind of Halloween/horror decor. If you are a traveler who needs to use the lobby for meetings or as a work space, you should stay elsewhere. The lobby here is like a luxury hostel - it has a little bit of marble tile, but a hostel-like atmosphere and very little seating. Lastly, the free newspaper is USA Today. What?? This is NYC - why not the NY Times? Or at least give a choice. In summary, expect very little and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: naitS
Reviews.Content: It seems this this establishment sparks either pure praise or harsh remarks from the reviewers. An 'either or' hotel. Well, I'm definitely either. I was sceptical after reading sour tales on TripAdvisor. After spending 5 nights there, my prejudices had turned into contentment. There has been little doubt regarding the hotel's perfect location; it really sits smack in the middle of it. The room I had on the 17th floor was large for a European. Not new, not very fancy, but it most certainly did the trick. The staff were very helpful and serviceminded and I enjoyed my daily chats with the cleaning lady in the mornings. All in all a place in a city I will definitely come back to.

Reviews.Title: “good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniel O
Reviews.Content: You do not get alot for what you pay for however i hear that is New York hotels in general. Smallish rooms but great location. We could hear the rooms next door, so the walls must be quite thin. Small bathroom and no mini bar in the room. The concierge was a little rude it seemed as if our request for a few restaurant suggestions was too hard for him - maybe the typical new yorker? however in the end we did manage to have him reserve a table at a very nice restaurant for us. On the plus side this is a great location within walking distance to all the action of Times Square. There is free internet in the lobby and a pool on the 5th floor which i didnt use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Maid Service”
Reviews.Author: Starsea L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when visiting New York on a College Trip with my fellow Fashion Merchandising majors. We stayed in room 809 and had Ayee Ramdeo as our cleaning lady. She was amazing, an absolute sweetheart! She was just very kind and eager to please, getting us extra towels, shampoo, conditioner, lotions, and coffee cups, as well as offering over and over to do anything else we needed. She was a pleasure to have around and seriously went above and beyond what anyone else in that position has done, from my experience. I would go back to New York just to stay in The Manhattan At Time Square Hotel just to have Ayee Ramdeo as our "house keeper" again! Thank you Ayee!! You're the best!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, no extras”
Reviews.Author: kkaseb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night at a discount rate--would have been really annoyed if I'd paid full price. It may be the best location in the city, between Times Square and Central Park. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, and shower was good. But don't expect any extras--the TV remote didn't work, the thermostat didn't operate, and the cold water knob was partially broken. Fortunately, you don't spend much time in the room when you're in NYC. Wish I'd had some street noise to drown out whoever seemed to be bowling over my head until 1am.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Location Only... Otherwise, dumpy!”
Reviews.Author: Flyairhost
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan at Times Square is conveniently located in 7th Avenue and 52nd street in New York. This is a Starwood property. This hotel used to be called The Manhattan Sheraton but they dropped the Sheraton part. Read the review to find out why. Location: This hotel is located in the middle of everything! Just steps away from the subway, Times Square, Radio City, and everything the typical tourist wants to see while in New York. Lobby: I noticed tons of people in the lobby when I arrived wondering why as it was late. I did notice a line of people waiting and I thought it was for the concierge desk or something. It was for the free internet/computers in the middle of the lobby. The front desk is to the side and a bar/restaurant to the other. Small lobby seems to always be very crowded with people waiting to use the computers. Amenities: As mentioned above, the internet in the lobby is free. However, a charge of $14.95 is added to your bill if you use the internet in your room. Luckily, I was able to get free wireless from who knows where in my computer and did not have to pay for the connection. I've always say it is an oxymoron to charge for the internet connection in the room when it is free in the lobby. I guess it is a convenience fee... we went out and after a late arrival (past midnight) there were tons of people still waiting for computers and seating on the floor in their pajamas with their laptops. Pathetic... Rooms: Very cold feel to them. Everything old is the name of the game!!! Hotel does not offer room service or any other type of amenities that is offered by other Starwood properties or Sheraton hotel. Not even a minibar in the room. In-room coffee machine is available. At least a big flat screen television that worked only during my first two days and went out on my last day for a long time, until my departure. Room size is typical of a New York hotel, not much more bigger than any other one. Plenty of hangers and two luggage racks (which could be a luxury for most hotels) were in the closet. The in-room safe worked fine as well. The bed was very hard and old. I lifted the comforter up and against the light and you could see old "stains". It looked like it was washed but I took it off the bed right away.... yuk! Disgusting! On my last day, I went to take a shower and the hot water was out! Seriously, the hot water was just a drip and it was very difficult to take a cold shower. Bathroom: Moldy, smelly, old pink tiles, bad paint job and the kicker, the bathtub seems that they added a tub lining (like those from bath fitters) and they did such a bad job that there was a huge air bubble trapped under it. When I took a shower and moved, I felt this bubble under my feet all the time moving from one side of the tub to the other or up and down. The drain stopper was off the drain and it look very disgusting. Wake-up call: Worked fine and came every day right on time. Service: I barely had any interaction with anyone except with the housekeeper. A nice lady that was talking on her cellphone all the time. She was cleaning the room next to mine. I could hear her in my room and I thought it was the guest or two housekeepers working together. When I went out, I look over and she had one of those headphone style things and she was talking all the time while she was cleaning. This went on every single day.... who needs to speak to anyone that much??? But she did leave extra coffee and condiments and clean the room as requested. Overall Experience: This place only gets an extra star because of the location. Otherwise, Sheraton/Starwood should be ashamed of offering a hotel in such a horrible state. But the price ($179/night) for this location is unbeatable. Needs major remodeling, new beds, new baths, amenities and bring it up to the Starwood standards... otherwise, it does feel more like a run-down hotel in the middle of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Rooms, Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: TKHAL33
Reviews.Content: For US Business Travelers: Please stay away from this hotel. The rooms may be spacious, but the hotel is filthy. The bathrooms have mildew in between the tiles. The carpet is old and worn out. The furniture is from the 70's. There is dust and cobwebs on lamp shades. The televisions are flat screens, but the signal is very blurry. Also THIS IS NO LONGER A STARWOOD OWNED HOTEL. You may get the points, but this hotel is owned under a private company now. The service is terrible, the internet connection is unreliable. They gym has nice equipment, but stay out of the bathroom by the fitness center. Don't say you weren't warned.

Reviews.Title: “do not trust them with your visa card! !”
Reviews.Author: mary w
Reviews.Content: Went to NY as part of a choir to join in the 9/11 commemoration and stayed on in this wonderfully located hotel. Our room was pre-paid by my daughter. They took my visa details and when we left presented me with a payment receipt for some food we had had. Unbeknown to me and unreceipted they had also removed more than Â£1100 from my account which I did not discover until I returned to the UK and checked my bank statement. Since then I have been trying in vain to get my money back. A member of the Accounts Department acknowledged the double charging and said he would remedy it, but didn't. I was then given an e-mail address for Starwood Hotels and sent a lengthy e-mail setting out the situation. This was not acknowledged. Today I have phoned the MTS and was told that they would get back to me in 10-15 minutes...you can guess the rest. When I eventually phoned back there was an answerphone. This affair has been very expensive in terms of time and money and most disillusioning. I strongly advise anyone staying in this hotel who has given credit/debit card details to keep a close check on their bank statements if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: kristenstedman
Reviews.Content: Hotel was Average, the ice machine on floor was broken, so was the soda machine...the room itself was small but comfortable. No room in bathroom for toiletries or to do makeup and hair...no minifridge. the location was BEST, we were able to walk to all the locations we planned to do...times sqaure, today show (top of the Rock), shopping, 5th Ave, even central park was only about 2 blocks away...this made up for the Average quality of the room

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: egpyt
Reviews.Content: Close to the Theater District. Good restaurants. Close to Times Square.Hotel is being up dated.Staff polite gave Excellent directions to any place we wanted to go. Bottom line Location,LOCATION Location. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything to do in Manhattan New York.”
Reviews.Author: KulewaKL
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to all the main attractions. Walking distance to Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Time Square, Broadway Theater District, The Metropolitan Musuem, and The American Musuem of Natural History. Easy access to transportation to all other New York tourist destinations. Had a spacious room with all the comforts of home. Friendly hotel staff through out the hotel!! Would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Why would this be a starwood Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katie S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many starwood properties a lot being in the city. This is by far the worst one. I will never go back. It is so out dated. There is horrible smell of mold in our room and elevator. The AC was not working well at all. Looked like it was from the 70's along with the rest of our room. The products in the shower were very cheap compared to what a normal starwood hotel has to offer. Only stayed one night and that was plenty. They are in desperate need of a renovation. Don't let the lobby fool you. No wi-fi in the rooms. Cable went out on us. If you want be near Time Square there are plenty other hotels with very similar prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SisterNeenah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in the theater district and a few blocks from Times Square. Many wonderful restaurants within ten blocks. Three doors down is a deli open 21 hrs. a day with fresly cooked food and anything you could want to eat or drink. We took a bus tour from outside the hotel and did uptown, downtown (which was hop on hop off at any of the major wites) and also toured Brooklyn. The staff was courtoues and helpful. Five computers in the lobby for free useage and a free USA TODAY newspaper every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: Frank7750
Reviews.Content: I am in this hotel now (Sept 24, 2011). The location is great -- easy walks to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, St Patrick's Cathedral, and all the Broadway shows. Empire State Bldg is about 8 blocks away (according to my teenagers). The subway is nearby (a $2.25 one way ticket), and we rode it to Chinatown, Little Italy, the Wall Street area, etc. It can be ridden to the Bronx and Queens. Many restaurants, 2 movie theaters, and a bowling alley are just blocks away. The area feels completely safe. We're on the 14th Floor in a room with 2 queen beds. It's small, but adequate. There's a small work desk, a large flat screen tv, and a small bathroom. The furniture and furnishings are a little dated, but everything works and it's clean. I can't say anything about the service or the amenities here, because we didn't use them. We were mainly looking for a place to clean up and sleep in after long days seeing the sights of NYC -- and this hotel met our expectations for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: William T
Reviews.Content: Location is number one wherever I travel. Here one can walk to the theatres, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Columbus Circle, Central Park, Lincoln Center, many restaurants, Fifth Avenue, and the subway is one block away. Need more be said?

Reviews.Title: “Skip this if you have other options”
Reviews.Author: k_bee1010
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for business the week of the of the 9/11 anniversary and Fashion Week. Tough time to be traveling, everything was overpriced and room availability was limited all over the city. I ended up at this Sheraton property assuming it would be fine. I was wrong. TERRIBLY overpriced and the rooms are in desperate need of renovation. No wi-fi in rooms, forgot my wake up call, confused my reservation and then... double-charged me after I had pre-paid for this nightmare. No bed bugs, so I guess that's something. And the restaurant was decent. As I said, if you have other options - avoid this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Basic necessities hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MB_Cine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend to enjoy Times Square. It's conveniently located and is a great hotel if you are looking for basic necessities! There is an attached restaurant, however, there are also quite a few within walking distance. The hotel is a bit older, has some wear and tear shown on signs, doors, locks, and walls. The room was spacious, all things were in working condition. The bed was comfortable, though the carpets could have used some cleaning. The Internet access in the rooms could only be connected through a cable with a fee, but the hotel did offer free WiFi in the lobby. I appreciated the friendliness of the staff, they were genuinely helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: jdii
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't have been better for us. A short walk to either Central Park or times square. The room itself was a little small, but I'm led to believe that's the norm in NYC. The beds and the room seemed pretty clean although we did find one live cockroach in our room the first night, but nothing after that. No indication of bedbugs which was good. The pool in the hotel was excellent for our needs and was warm which is a switch from most hotel pools I've experienced. The gym/health center was a little small, but we didn't have a problem using it in the evenings. Our only complaint with the hotel staff would have been that when we wanted to extend our stay by one night we were actually told that it would be cheaper to go online and find a room that way than try and do it through the front desk. I guess this is just how things work these days though. Oh, and even though we were something like 15 stories up, the noise of the main drag traffic, especially the honking, took some getting used to. Parking was also a small issue, but an expected one in NYC. $45 a day to not even use my car. At least it was close (with a door directly into the hotel itself). Overall a completely satisfactory stay for a reasonable price in a great location. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for exploring NYC”
Reviews.Author: Annie_Elfman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my first ever trip to NYC - and then came back a few months later! I would definitely use this hotel for future trips to New York. The location is excellent - right on Times Square, obviously, so great for that area & 5th Avenue (where we spent most of time), and great transport links for going further up/down town anyway. A great base to explore NYC from. The room was clean & spacious, bed comfortable, and had everything we needed. It was also great value for money. I would have expected a hotel in that location to be really big budget, but for the location and the quality of the hotel I thought the price was really good.

Reviews.Title: “So close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: icehockey_mom
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely excellent place to stay. Just a short walk to Times Square. Short walk to Central Park. Not to far from Macy's. Had a little walk to get to the bus tour, but dropped us off closer to the hotel. Clean place. Big rooms. Comfortable beds. Nice and cool, cause it was really hot when we were there this past July 2011. Breakfast was good but a little pricey in the restaurant hotel. The consierge downstairs got us a couple of cabs to take us to the Brooklyn cruise ship terminal, couldn't get one big car??!! Can't say enough about it - FANTASTIC!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs A Reno Job”
Reviews.Author: capistrano99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, using my points for the stay. Expect to find a clean place but instead found the room very tired, walls falling apart, and cracks in the bathroom shower area. Not what I expected from a Sheraton. Perhaps they gave me this room on the 17th floor because I was not a paying customer in that I used my SPG points for the room. Either way, I wouldn't stay again. Staff were friendly, tho, close to Times Square, parking located on site at $45/per day.

Reviews.Title: “I will Never Return Here. Don't go.”
Reviews.Author: dcjay64
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel room in NYC is always hard. I wanted a Starwood property in Manhattan that was somewhat near my corporate negotiated rate. I got a rate of $339/night. Not cheap but one of the cheaper corporate rates I could find. The hotel is a dump. The phone in the room does not work. The TV has not worked for the eentire stay so far - two days. I am told by their engineering staff and management that none of the TVs in the hotel work when it rains. Seriously. Rain causes their TVs to stop working. They have DirectTV - satellite TV. It is not like there is a lot to do in a small hotel room - except the TV - so if that doesnt work there is a big problem. The elevators also have not worked. There are 5 or 6 elevators servicing more than 20 floors and on at least one day of my stay only two of them were working. There was a line out into the lobby of people queuing to get into an elevator. Craziness. I won't even bother to go into just how filthy and old the rooms are. I have one more day of business here and then I get out of this rathole.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Property”
Reviews.Author: WeatherShipTD
Reviews.Content: Dollar for dollar this is undoubdedly the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I can tolerate dirty rooms, slow elevators, unhelpful staff, cold water and TV service that does not work at a $60/night Motel Six. For a $300 per night Starwood hotel (even if it is NYC) this is just unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for (in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Let's face it. You're looking at this hotel because you're on a budget. So before I dive in, let's just establish one thing. You can't pay a budget price and have world class accommodations. It just doesn't work that way. The rooms, though outdated, are big by NYC standards (we specifically booked a handicap accessible room). We stayed at a Marriott in Boston a few nights before, and paid the same rate per night for a smaller room. So that should tell you something. Room size is not an issue here. The lobby is immaculate and they are doing more work on it. It's very classy and updated. The quality of the room is another story. There's outdated wallpaper, light fixtures, and decor. So don't expect a Hilton. Again, you're paying a budget price. This didn't bother us because we knew from reading reviews that this would be the case. We stayed relatively close to the elevators and ice machine. If you can help it, try to avoid this. Every time someone used the ice machine it was pretty loud. Our bathroom was a great size. Just know if you do choose do book an accessible room like we did, the shower head is on a hose and sits lower in the shower than is comfortable for anyone over 5 feet tall. However, you can remove the shower head from the wall and use it accordingly. The bathrooms are so-so. A few rust stains in the sink, a loose toilet seat, and some tile work that could probably be fixed. This is probably where most people would get a bad taste in their mouth. No one likes a dirty-feeling or looking bathroom. Ours did have that feeling, but it wasn't so bad that we were entirely grossed out. It just needed to be updated. The staff was amazing. We didn't have any problems during our stay, other than DirecTV cutting out while it was raining in the middle of the night. The channel selection was okay when it wasn't raining, but we didn't go to NYC to watch TV. So we didn't care. The location is great. Step outside the hotel and look to the right, and you can see where the ball drops in Times Square. There are several subway stops within a 1 to 2 block radius of this hotel that will get you just about anywhere you need to go. Also, you are one block away from Broadway, and just a few blocks from Rockefeller Plaza. We didn't use the pool (ironically, because that's why we booked this hotel). It looked nice though. The bottom line is this: if location and room size are important to you, stay here. If immaculate accommodations are important to you, stay somewhere else. I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic getaway. But for first time visitors that want to be in the middle of the action, this is the prefect place to stay. You won't be in your room much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travelbwj
Reviews.Content: You know...this hotel really wasn't all that bad. You can't really be sure what you'll find in Manhattan, but I can say that I was pleasantly surprised. First off, I did not know this was a Starwood Property (and they are pretty consistent in their brands), so one point to the hotel for that one. The room was nice, fairly large for NYC, and clean (I work in the hotel business, so I do an inspection that would make the guy from Full Metal Jacket raise an eyebrow), and all turned out OK. However, I'm still wondering why, in the ever evolving world of 3G, that hotels still charge for internet? Minus that point I awarded them earlier. Finally...their "business center" looked somewhat along the lines of where Dell computers go to die. Cause none of them worked. Though...it served it's purpose, every staff member I ever encountered had a smile and a friendly attitude, it was clean, and it survived the earthquake. I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: “WPFG 2011”
Reviews.Author: mig d
Reviews.Content: Although a bit expencive, and 2 of 5 computers in lobby out of order, we had a pleasent stay. The cleaning crew was very nice and helpfull, and coorperately to our specific needs (eg extra towels, becourse of many sports events, air frensners, present all day, allways with a smile) Great central location, helpfull piccolos, kind and helpfull receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “World Police & Fire Games”
Reviews.Author: irishgreen343
Reviews.Content: First of all, we were traveling in New York during Hurricane Irene so the city had a lot on their plate. The hotel was great at keeping us up to date with info regarding the storm and what we should be doing to stay safe. We never felt like we were in any danger and the city handled the situation very well. My sister was also in town for the games and was in the same hotel. We all know the stories of Bed Bugs in New York and my wife and i and my sister took all the precautions we could to not have any problems. I was on the 22nd floor in room 2204 and had no bites or bed bug sightings. My sister was in room 1001 on the 10th floor and sadly to their horror, found one a day later. I know that the bugs are a real reality in this day and age and are a problem everywhere, not only the Big Apple so i don`t fault the hotel for perhaps having the odd bug issue. What i`m interested in is how they handle the problem and The Manhattan handled it very professionally in my opinion and the were given a new room right away. In regards to some of the other things i have read about this hotel, i would agree with most of it. The hotel is old and it shows. The dust and what not around the room is there,but not a huge deal. The restaurant only seemed to be open for breakfast and there was no room service. The beds are good and the rooms are nice.For a middle of the road hotel, i was happy even tho middle of the road in New York is still expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience !”
Reviews.Author: Gigiwoz81
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is perfect, behind it were the theatres.. And a walking distnace to the shops and all the attractions in times square, clean rooms but a bit tiny but thats normal for nyc hotels:) the staff were very friendly , their business center wity free internet access is a smart move it was very useful .. Id definetly come back!

Reviews.Title: “SMALL ROOM AND DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: maree n
Reviews.Content: I was there on august 26-28 with a couple of friends, before we booked the hotel we looked at the pictures and thought WOW how nice the pictures looked! so we went ahead to book the rooms.... when we got there what an disappointment to all of us!!!! the room was small, dirty looking and its not like what we saw on the pictures!!!!! very disappointed! will not recommend staying here! it is in the middle of everything, very convenience but we didn't enjoy our room very much!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: AmericanTourista889
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Manhattan Times Square two weekends ago on a girls getaway weekend with my Mom and Sister. The location was excellent. Just a block from The Gershwin (we came to see Wicked) and a less than 6 blocks from the heart of Times Square I really enjoyed having The Manhattan as our homebase. Many of the activities we planned were around the Times Square area including a couple shows, the Harry Potter Discovery Exhibit and dinner at Sardis. Other than the location this hotel does not have too much going for it. The lobby leaves much to be desired and their gift shop is 100% overpriced even for a bottle of water-- there was a street vendor 50ft from the entrance- if you find yourself thirsty at night visit him before tucking in! They do provide courtesy Internet and computer access in the lobby which was really nice. The rooms could also use an update particularly the bathrooms which looked like they had been last redone in the 80s. All in all this was not a bad stay in the least and I would definitely consider The Manhattan again as a hotel option for future visits to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of the action!”
Reviews.Author: thewhitesmanchester
Reviews.Content: You couldn't be closer to the action than this! Luckily we were 17 floors up so it was quiet at night but i reckon if you are near the ground floor you will be in the city that never sleeps! The staff were helpful and friendly especially Thomas the concierge for reccomending good restaurants. The swimming pool was great in the morning a good size to burn off some calories!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. We walked to the empire state building, rockerfeller, central park, times square and 5th avenue. There are also several subway and bus stops nearby. The room was clean and comfortable and cleaned every day except Sunday. The bed sheets were crisp and clean and we had 2 pillows each and adjustable air con. We even bought a giant pizza in one evening and not a word was said. We would definitly stay here again. Did not speak to the staff that much but when we did they were helpful enough. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Service and for Families”
Reviews.Author: GlobalRE007
Reviews.Content: First, let me preface that I am a Platinum member at Starwood and have stay at many hotels around the world. This hotel, by far, is probably one of the best hotels I stayed. Here are some simple reasons: 1. Greeted by EVERY staff member. They used the Ritz Carlton approach to say "good morning" or "good evening" if within 10 feet of me. Nice touch. Staff interested in always helping me out. 2. Pool. One of the only indoor pools WITH an outside deck to view the city. This alone is great after a day in NYC. 3. Room. Very clean and modern. Great amenities from soap to shampoo. 4. LOCATION. I think the video on their website said it best. They are the 10 minute hotel. 10 minute walk from almost everything in NYC you need to see. To give you some additional information, I came here with my family on business and they felt very comfortable. I travel to NYC from Boston about once every two weeks to stay for the last 5 years so I know NYC pretty well and would recommend this for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: slwNewcastle_UK
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel on a tour of cities in Eastern USA. The hotel was very clean with efficient service at reception. The rooms were a good size and were very quiet, despite us looking straight onto 7th Avenue. The hotel is an excellent location within 2 minutes from Times Square (you can see Times Square clearly from outside the front of the hotel), and near to Rockfeller Plaza and the Empire State Building is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and best location.”
Reviews.Author: Goldigsgirl
Reviews.Content: Great pool with a sun deck. This was great to cool off in on a hot summer day and then go right back out to see things in the area or go eat. Quality bedding with four pillows per bed. We loved that. Best location close to everything. Don't be fooled, you can take the bus or subway everywhere form there,too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer1907
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect if you are visiting NY as a tourist and love the theatre, nightlife and buzz of manhattan. However, it's a very busy locaton for more timid tourists! The hotel itself is very basic but functional. Ben linen clean, no mini bar or room service. The rooms and public areas are very dated and there were a number of tour groups when I visited but its fine for a couple of nights stay. The rooms are quite spactious for NY and the staff are pleasant enough - the service is very typically big city and quite brash. Wouldn't rush back but no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sus_gal
Reviews.Content: The location is the big seller here, straight out the door and bang, you are in Times square, short walk to Radio city music hall, the grey line bus tours start outside, everything is there for you on the doorstep. The check in was a bit slow and we were first brought to an occupied room by mistake, but otherwise all went great. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: Deavster
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is not really up-to-par with The Sheraton up the street and has older fixtures and has a dated feel in the rooms. It definitely needs some updating. I imagine, if the hotel gets updated the price will in turn reflect that. Nonetheless, the room was clean and the stay was uneventful. It was very crowded and there was lots of hustle and bustle with little personal attention shown. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerAnj
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Manhattan coz our hotel, The Manhattan at Times Square Hotel's location is very good. It was so easy to go around Manhattan. Their facilities are good and clean, the staff quite accomodating and the rates fare.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel at a very good price”
Reviews.Author: LMS39
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights at the end of July, 2011. The rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious. I have previously stayed at a few big-name more expensive hotels in Manhattan and can honestly say that The Manhattan at Times Square Hotel provides bigger rooms of equal quality at a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. Wish I could go back.”
Reviews.Author: sharocee
Reviews.Content: Friendly, pleasant, helpful and honest staff. Doorman refused my husband's tip because he thought I had already tipped him, I couldn't find him later to tell him I had not but this smiling, welcoming man deserved a tip. I still feel awful about that. The rooms were spacious, clean, quiet and the beds extremely comfortable. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Tylersmommy
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed here. The location is excellent. It is walking distance to the theaters. The price is good for the location and what you get. The room was updated, including a flat screen TV. The room and bathroom are clean, with fresh linens (much more luxurious than I expected for what we paid) and towels. The air conditioner worked well (temps while we visited was high 80's to 90 degrees and humid) so we stayed cool in our room. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Housekeeping did a wonderful job cleaning our room daily. If you're looking for luxury then this is not for you but if you want a comfortable, clean place to stay in a great location at a great price then the Manhattan Hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain and Location”
Reviews.Author: cassidy219
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel overnight for a 2 day trip and had booked on priceline. It was a great location. Check in was easy, friendly, even with a small exception of a mistake for the type of bed but that was easily fixed despite the fact they were very busy. We got 2 double beds with no problem as requested. The room and bathroom was clean, well supplied with soaps and shampoos, conditioner, lotions, hairdryer, iron, coffee/tea maker, and the beds and pillows were also clean, comfortable and supportive. The concierge was helpful and polite, and told us were we could go eat to find some good "whole in the walls" on 9th. We did. Hummus in Hell's Kitchen. Super friendly, good service and food, quaint and very "New York". Back at the room on the 22nd floor (top floor) it was quiet, but the ice machine did not work so I went down to the next floor down and got ice there. No problem. This hotel was a great bargain for the location and a clean comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Caution:Bed Bug Alert!”
Reviews.Author: JosephExplosive
Reviews.Content: We woke up after our first night with 40+ bites mainly on our legs after a night on the 17th floor. I cannot fault the response of the manager dealing with us, who arranged a room change and a 'sterilisation' of our 4 bags free of charge. Sadly, their refusal to admit our discomfort was due to a bed bug infestation (instead claiming it was Mosquitos) left us feeling very disappointed with the hotel. No compensation offered other than a free film, which ironically could not be watched because the in-room entertainment system was not working. Unless this hotel take a more honest approach with customers over this issue I suggest you avoid it!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel..great location”
Reviews.Author: pingading
Reviews.Content: really liked this hotel. its in a great location thats so handy to times square and all of manhattans attractions.The beds are the most comfortable i have ever slept on..like sleeping on a cloud. The only problem I had was constently being asked by the doorman to see my room key. I understand this is for security reasons but even after telling him I would be there for a week he still asked me everytime..very disapointing and this will stop me coming there again. if you ever get new door man message me and I might change my mind!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just the right spot in NYC”
Reviews.Author: 2ourest
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in between Times Square (3 blocks) and Central park. The rooms are a bit on the small side but that common for New York. It is an older property but clean and well maintained. The staff are efficient and friendly. A security guard is posted in the lobby and a bellman is outside during the days. There is wired internet in the rooms for $14.95 per 24 hours but it is free in the lobby that is always full! The show tickets are not a good deal from the lobby being considerably higher than at the venues. This is a busy hotel with often lines for the elevators. All in all, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: rysslynn3
Reviews.Content: this was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at, the televisions don't work, I called three times and eventually had to go to the front desk where I still WAS NOT HELPED. Besides the location there is nothing good about this place, the elevators are VERY slow there apparently are no stairs, and the rooms don't have anything useful in them. My boyfriend spent alot of money for our stay and we could not enjoy ourselves because of how horrible the hotel was. I'm shocked people actually stay here.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, okay stay”
Reviews.Author: reportingmom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Manhattan at Times Square a couple times previously on business but most recently the first of August. This was the first time I had ever had a wait to check in, but it was only about 10 minutes max. Must have just happened to be very busy right then, as I didn't see a line at any other time to speak of. The elevators were quite slow this visit, although they hadn't been in the past. It's the height of tourist season, though, in NYC so it was just generally a very busy place. My rooms have always been clean and very adequate, clean bedding, nice sized desk, large flat screen tv and plenty of channels to choose from. The bathrooms are clean, standard size, and great water pressure in the shower. There is a restaurant on site, but it seems like it's just open sometimes, and I've never eaten there. So many other good places very nearby. I've never had a problem with noisiness on any of my visits, there are plenty of pillows and the beds are comfortable but not outstanding. Am heading back to NYC on the train as I write this, had tried to get the same rate I had two days ago and they wouldn't oblige. I'm guessing they don't have to compromise since it's so busy right now, but that would have been nice for a loyal customer. Trying a new place, though, which is always interesting. All in all, incredible location, pleasant service and clean rooms. So given a good rate, I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situation, comfort and service for its price.”
Reviews.Author: marienergica
Reviews.Content: Very good situation for turists, between Central Park and Times Square, close to all the Broadway theaters and to the MoMA, a nice short walk to the 5th Ave., beside several subway stations... Good comfort (extremely comfortable beds) and good service too, although too crowded at the lobby (end of July!). Anyway, outstanding quality for its price.

Reviews.Title: “the only positive about this hotel is the location and the beds”
Reviews.Author: 613forlife
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've been in NYC. It doesn't deserve to be part of the SPG family. At least they have the sweet sleepers bed and it's on 7th Ave but for the rest expect this: - slow WiFi in the Lobby (that's if you get in) - constant flow of people coming in and out (small lobby) - it smells funny - slow elevators - small rooms Also don't expect much from the morning buffet as our table was crowed of plates and nobody pick them up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fast & friendly service”
Reviews.Author: JS92003
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Manhattan at Times Square the last weekend in July. We booked the hotel on Priceline.com and got a pretty decent price considering the location of the hotel and the fact that it was peak tourist season. We got a room on the 18th floor and had a great view of the city. Room was very clean and bed was super comfy. Staff was quick and friendly. It seemed like a very family-friendly hotel. It had a great pool and outside deck. We wanted a hotel that was in walking distance to everything and this place was it! 5 minute walk to the middle of Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall. 15 minute walk to 5th Ave. and Central Park. 20 minute walk to Madison Square Garden and the Empire State Building. (might even be shorter walk then that, we got turned around a few times). If you park at the hotel, make sure to print a parking coupon! We got one for $30.00 bucks a day, if you don't have the coupon it's $45.00 a day. Hotel charges a steep $14.00 for wifi but you can use the computers in the biz center for free. There are no refrigerators in the rooms or microwaves in the hotel so don't plan on saving leftovers! Overall, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “WOW the front desk, service...clean & functioning in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: LaunatkPortRoyal
Reviews.Content: Wow..the front desk and bell staff were attentive, helpful, and positive. Although the hotel is yesterday's furniture (signs of wear)...it was clean, working, and meet my needs. Great rate for being downtown...next to EVERYTHING we wanted to do -- 3 Broadway Shows, restaurants, shops, and the heart of the city. Gift shop was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much more than somewhere to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: LilyLila
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was OK, checked in and literally all we got was our keys; no map of the city, no welcome to New York, no explanation about hotel facilities, breakfast, pool etc. Just told what your room number is and where the lift is. The room is ok, fairly spacious bedroom, comfortable and clean bed, bathroom is small and relatively clean (bit of mildew on the bath rim). Walls are a bit thin so you can hear whats going on in other rooms. The lifts are a joke, there are 3 lifts servicing every floor in the hotel and if you need to use it at peak times you could be waiting in a queue for 10 minutes. We stayed on the 8th floor so could easily take the stairs...only you aren't allowed use the stairs from ground to the 5th floor only in emergencies. Its a bit ridiculous in a hotel where lifts are soooo slow and the queue is soooo big. Free WiFi in reception area, but to use internet in the room it costs 15 dollars a day, in this day and age I think its a bit cheeky charging for internet when you can eat in McDonalds and get free WiFi for free! WiFi wouldn't work for us, we asked at reception and they said it should work and that was about as helpful as they were. The hotel seems to be run by people who are winging it, rather than being masters of the service industry. There is a pool which is fine, but is full of kids alot of the times. There are no locks on the lockers so you have to bring your stuff into the pool area to keep an eye on it yourself. There are a few PC's in reception area for guest use (45 minutes at a time), it can be quite hard to get computers as there are kids using them all of the time! All in all this has the bones of a good hotel but it seems like the Sheraton sold it on to a group who are a bit amateurish and are just in the game to take your money and nothing more. It lacks the finer details and service of a good hotel, but for a place to rest your head a night its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: jetersgrl21
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the hotel, I was told the hotel was over booked and sent down the street to Park central (I made reservations 6 months in advance) even though they paid the bill for the night I was upset. The next day I checked in and they took my information and my credit card. I get a call at 6:00am the next day saying payment did not go through and they wanted another card. I contacted my credit card which they said a $538 hold was already put on the card, so there was no way I was giving them another card to rack up. The pool was dirty and cloudy and prob hasn't been cleaned in a while, the fitness center was nice. When I checked out of course there was a prob with the charges, they tried to give me a rate higher than my reservation (thank goodness I had my email confirmation) PLEASE KEEP ALL YOUR PAPERWORK! even after you have left. It took me 4 days AFTER my check out to talk to a manager who could actually get my charges right, it was a horrible experience. My advice, stay at the other 50 hotels in times square you will have a much better experience

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jumpinjack3
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel at 11:30 am AND our room was waiting!!!! Wow! The desk clerk was very warm, friendly and helpful. My sister and her husband arrived about 20 min later and were amazed at how quick we accessed our rooms. As the headline states, this is an older hotel. The lobby is dated but does have a nice computer center for free. The room was clean and spacious for NYC. This hotel has an indoor poo and although we didn't use it we did look in and saw that it was pretty good size. There were a few families using the facility and looked like they were having fun. The location of this hotel is great! close to subways and theater district. We used Priceline and got a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Great value especially with SPG Points.”
Reviews.Author: bonjourSGC
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Walking distance to Times Square, but not too close so it's quieter and less crowded on the street. Very good service at the desk and concierge. Had breakfast here daily and waiters/waitresses could not have been nicer. Easy walk to the best pizza in Times Square at John's. Also liked Junior's and the Cake Boss Cafe (same place as the Harry Potter exhibit, which I highly recommend if you're a fan). Great place if you want to see theatre while you are in town.
