TKTS and all the theatres are very close. Taxi from museum row very reasonable (~$10). Taxi from LaGuardia good too (~$30). One tip: Taxi drivers didn't know the hotel name, but they knew the Sheraton at Times Square which is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price, don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: todds4040
Reviews.Content: We chose the Manhattan at Times Square for two reasons. Primarily, it was a theatre weekend, and it was very easy to pop back to our room to freshen up and drop things off between shows; secondly because we were able to use Starwood points for a free night. The hotel is the former Sheraton City Squire and currently has no company affiliation. Unfortunately, it shows; the property is rather run-down, though the rather small lobby has been spruced up. If you arrive at the same time as a foreign tourist group, there is a waiting and crowding issue. Towels, mattresses, and bed linens were all a bit beat, and we seriously avoided sitting on the comforter. Still, the room was an adequate size (bathroom quite small, though), and basically comfortable. A decent value for New York and great location if you do not intend to see daylight; only stagelight. There is an indoor pool, which we normally like, but with 5 shows in 2 1/2 days, never got around to seeing.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: I_like_2_travel008
Reviews.Content: Considering the prices of hotel rooms in New York and the size of the rooms this hotel was pretty ok in price and size of room. Its a basic no frills hotel, in a good location if you're a tourist, in a bad location if you want more than tourist trap restaurants and shops etc. I did not spend much time at the hotel as I was busy working everyday so for what I needed it for it was ok. The only problem I saw was the fact that there are an enormous amount of tours using this hotel, both groups with children (school children) and others so it was sometimes a little noisy and on occassion almost impossible to enter the hotel due to the shear volume of people amassing in the lobby area. The on site restaurant is an absolute rip off and they charge around $25 for breakfast!!! I obviously did not eat there but come on!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: GraceBaila
Reviews.Content: Place was clean and staff friendly. Walking distance to subway and time square. Not the cheapest hotel but definitely value for money. This hotel is under the starwood group of hotels. So compare prices on expedia and starwood. If both the same, book thru starwood for the reward points.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: vacationinmymind
Reviews.Content: We read several reviews that talked about the cleanliness and noise factor at this hotel. We found neither to be a problem. Our air conditioning was not working in our room; we requested a new room instead of waiting for maintenance and were given a new room immediately. There were lots of highschool groups in the hotel, but noise was never a factor at any time of day. The pool was large and nice, but the locker rooms were not updated and not especially clean. The equipment in the fitness area was fine but there weren't any towels or headphones for the treadmills. Overall the location can't be beat especially for the price. Our family would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Value and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: SisterFunMandM
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, close to Central Park, Broadway, Rockefeller Centre, Time Square, and some really great restaurants. The hotel itself was lacking on updates and the rooms were small not 100% clean....... but truly, we stored our cloth and slept there. The beds were clean and comfortable and the service was really friendly. One of the three elevators broke down temporarily but staff was quick to open and shuttle us in the service elevator. The main lobby is nice, the gym is small but nice and the pool looked good (we didn't have time to swim) not sure what the water was like. All in all it's good value for your money. I'd recommend staying here and saving hotel fees for dining out theatre or shopping which is also very close! If you are a Westin Castle kind of person don't stay here but if you're a budget hotel person such as The Comfort Inn, Best Western, Holiday Inn etc....this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Totally not expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: ionahpiinkee
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for a hotel in NYC times square, we had no idea what to expect...we read the reviews of this hotel and although some were not that good, they gave us a good rate, so we thought, "Why Not?" The only room they had left for our last minute booking was a King Room. There were three of us! We were a bit hesitant, but when we arrived, everything was Uphill from there out! We were greeted by "Guirerra" (may have mis-spelt) but he is phenuomenal! He told us he would change our room to 2 beds, but we would have to wait, which was obviously no problem, and he even offered to hold our bags and give us access to the pool, while we waited. The wait was 3 hours shorter than expected for the room, which was a perk, and we were in our room, which regardless of other reviews was Great!!! Agreed the hotel is a bit outdated, but with 22 Floors, I am glad they are only renovating one floor at a time! Which they are!!! The staff were extremely polite, fun and hospitable. The Location is amazing and if we ever returned, we wouldn't need to look very far for a hotel! The only thing I could comment on, is the TV loses signal a lot, and DO NOT use your phone in your room!!! We got charged $27.51 for a 4 minute call to Canada. HOWEVER 75% of our phone call charges were reimbursed. Which was so appreciated. Thank you for a great stay! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “five star service in a three star room!”
Reviews.Author: floyd4444
Reviews.Content: Great location, two minute walk to wicket, five minute walk to time Square and the Lion king. Staff was excellent, a safe and friendly place to bring family. Room was clean and good value for the money based on location, when in NY location is everything. Will stay again. Floyd Morrissey, CANADA

Reviews.Title: “First Choice for a Mid-town business traveler”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelers_8
Reviews.Content: I've read all the reviews of the Manattan and while it does need renovation in some areas, it still boasts a great pool, the most wonderful staff in Manhattan, good workout facility and rooms that are above average for the price. I stay there over and over again and love the location, the welcoming staff, and the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: aquagirl101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several times in 2002 and loved it back then. I know that's a long time ago - sadly, I think that was the last time anything was renovated at this hotel. The location is still great near Times Square, but the place needs serious upgrades. I still love their pool though, but the rest of the hotel does not make me want to go back. Staff was really nice - not their fault about the setting.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: ajitbhanot
Reviews.Content: I was not looking forward to this hotel after reading the recent reviews but was pleasantly surprised. we reached the hotel at 11:30 (way before the scheduled check in time), and were given our rooms (we had asked for 2 rooms) right away by the helpful person at the reception, the rooms were spacious and clean, the location is great, a couple of blocks from Times Square, walking distance from Rockerfeller center, great places to eat all around open quite late. All in all we had just one day at NY and I am happy that we stayed at the hotel. Thank you for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and Location was superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: richyboyy
Reviews.Content: What more could you ask for than a perfect hotel right bang in the middle of Times Sq. Perfect location for every trip we done and tube stations right round the corner. Room we had was very clean and cleaned every morning!! If like us you plan on spending not much on a hotel look no further as for the price we paid it was spot on. Reading other peoples reviews doesnt do this hotel justice and i think they may have been expecting a celeb place to stay but come on its in TIMES SQ and room had everything you needed especially if you plan on spending alot of time out of the Hotel sight seeing etc. Room had a great 42inch tv with air con and nice little shower room. Even had a smart coffee machine : 0 ) which was also filled up every morning. Maybe the bad reviews given were from posh people but if your a normal couple looking for a decent price stay in NEW YORK!! this is perfect We had a great weeks holiday and would go back tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable Base for NY Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Bxy1990
Reviews.Content: There are a multitude of reviews on here which don't rate the hotel; however I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel and the very cheap rate for a room so close to Times Square. The hotel is clean and well presented. I would agree and say that some of the decor is aged but reminiscent of the many american hotel chains (Holiday Inn/Best Western) and wasn't too shabby. The room we got (no.1747) was brilliant - we had a double vista of Broadway and the start of Times Square. I did not experience any noise from other rooms and we were lucky enough to get a room away from the lift so couldn't comment on noise from that. The room was clean and tidy and was what you expect from a 3* hotel - it wasn't luxury but when you're in NY - you just need somewhere to sleep. Bathroom was small but contained everything that is needed and the shower was more than adequate despite being a more old-fashioned suite. Maid service was as to be expected and to be honest there wasn't any complaints. Overall its a very reasonable hotel for a reasonable price in an amazing location. If your after luxury, this isn't the hotel - but if your after a clean hotel to act as a base for a busy holiday - this is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Such a grand hotel, i expected better!”
Reviews.Author: arry2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, i thought i would be pleasantly surprised as the pictures on the net look great and the hotel looks so grand from outside. When entering the lobby which aint too bad, really big, clean and shiney strong floral aromas, maybe abit too strong but hey you get used it it. The lifts look dirty needs a good srub and polish. The hallway seems cold and dim just like the rooms. The rooms do not look as good the pics on the site. They are really dim you have got to turn each lamp individually on 5 lights in total, no bed side master switch! The bed is nice and big and VERY comfortable and clean the tv is very big but with not a great selection of channels i expected MTV or E but its just mainly american news channels. The rooms just seem dated that requires new furnishings but atleast its clean. The bathroom is also clean smallish but clean. The coffee machine is great once you learn how to use it, as im used having a kettle in the rooms in england. Also when they say free WIFi its only free in the lobby not in the rooms! Very disappointing as most people have i-phones! Fantastic location though!!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, location was what made it!”
Reviews.Author: JK12311
Reviews.Content: I usually find that negative reviews of places are overly critical and I usually end up being pleasantly surprised once I get to a place, but..I will say in this case, the reviews are pretty accurate. I knew a NYC hotel would likely have small rooms and this place definitely did along with a bathroom the size of closet. But, on top of that, the room walls are so thin just as many reviews said..we literally could hear word for word convservations that our neighbors would have and it woke me up early each morning. In addition, the rooms really do need a serious update..1980's for sure. The front desk staff were not very friendly..acted as if we were a bother to them because they were always so busy and maybe because we were priceline customers (which I don't think should matter, should still be treated with equal respect). We had requested a room with two beds, but there was not one ready when we checked in so the clerk said he would send a rollaway bed up right away, well guess what, we get back from an entire day's excursions at 11:00pm at night and no rollaway bed. And what made my review jump from average to poor, is that I just checked my credit card statement and there is a charge from the hotel that I did not authorize. Even though we were priceline, you still have to give your credit card for incidentals when you check in, well we charged nothing at all to our room! We were only in the hotel long enough to sleep and get ready each day and when we checked out, there were no charges, but now there is charge for something. I called the customer service and of course, I don't get connected to a real person, but had to leave a msg and wait for someone to call me back within 24 hrs, so we'll see how that goes. But, the the only staff that were friendly were the bell captains so that we appreciate! And the room was pretty clean (not spotless though, always hate when I find other people's hair in the bathroom) and the location could not have been better..really right in the heart of the theater district and times square! We never had time to even make it to the pool or fitness center so can't comment on that. Overall, if you get a really good deal on this place, then it might be worth booking only for the location, otherwise, it is just very average to poor with nothing memorable other than the location. If they would do some updating and make you feel more important there, then I would probably think differently, but we'll see because I am really interested to see how they will handle this mysterious charge and why the heck it is on my credit card, grrr!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...not much else going for it”
Reviews.Author: HunterTravellor
Reviews.Content: OK, I stayed for 4 night. Good bits. Great location, nice big bed Bad bits. Outdated deco, geneally quite a dirty room, mold on the ceiling in the bathroom. That was bedroom number one. Staff didnt seem to care too much about changing the room, "we are full", and yet managed to find me a room. Bedroom number two, again, not overly clean. Dust everywhere. Wallpaper hanging off the walls. Bathroom is SOOO outdated it is untrue. I got bit several times on my legs, and the staff didnt even ask if I had a good time when I left. Overall. I asked if they could phone the transfer company for me, to re-check the taxi back to JFK. No, use a pay phone was the answer. The girl behind the reception was sullen, and they wanted $180 for theatre tickets that cost $90 down the road. No bar that I could find and restuarant was closed. HUGELY disapointed by this hotel, so much promise but a big let down. Find somewhere else when in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “good location for 1st NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: conver2sations
Reviews.Content: biz travelers will be disappointed by sub-standard decor and outdated rooms, tourists won't care because they're exhausted from their days of exploring the city Pros: - Location: walking distance to Times Square, Broadway shows, Top of the Rock, 5th Ave shopping, Central Park, etc proximity to 3 subway lines - price: since most agree the hotel's rooms and decor is outdated, one should have paid less than other comparably located hotels Cons: - no major complaints, did not spend much time in the hotel - this should go without saying, but don't eat anywhere near the hotel (unless it's from a food cart or pizza by the slice), you're overpaying for crap tourist food

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location and large well appointed rooms for NYC”
Reviews.Author: skywaker9
Reviews.Content: This Sheration is located nearly directly across the street from another far newer and more expensive Sheraton. For my money, however, this is the far better value. Recently renovated, this hotel is big but manages to feel personal. The beds are very nice and the rooms, although small for any city other than New York, are nicely sized and don't feel cramped like many NYC hotel rooms. The location right on 7th avenue is handy for many things but is far enough away from the center of the tourist area that it is quiet at night. One tip, we booked the room rate that included complimentary breakfast (a buffet). Although not the greatest in the world, it is nonetheless a good value as well (it cost us $8 for 2 for us) relative to what you'd pay elsewhere in NYC. We'd certainly do this again and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe this is a Starwood brand hotel”
Reviews.Author: irieisle
Reviews.Content: I'm a Starwood junkie and this hotel was F-A-R from the experience of a Starwood property. My room on the 19th floor was supposedly far enough from the elevator where I couldn't hear it but each night I could hear it moving up and down. The hinge on the top of the door was broken, the shower was lined with plastic instead of it being ceramic. As I moved in the shower, I could feel where the plastic was worn away and lifting from the original adhesive. Plus, my bathroom sink would fill with water if I left it running as I washed my face. I did ask to change my room but they had none other avail because it was filled to capacity. And that's probably because their rates are cheaper than other hotels in the area - so that's its only strong suit. They said they could move me the next day into another room, but I didn't think the rooms could get any better and didn't want the hassle of having to repack all my items. Bottom line: don't be lulled by the name...it is not even close to being anything luxurious. Even my 2 co-workers who also stayed here agreed they would not come again (and we come to NY often for work and normally stay at the Westin Times Square but the rates were too exorbitant for our stay). We just wanted to get the Starwood points (I know, maybe a little selfish), but we won't make that mistake again. We agreed we should have stayed at a Marriott this last time.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: 1businessandpleasure
Reviews.Content: The Starwood chain is nuts to rank this as a 4 star hotel. The room was visibly dirty - a large water stain on the ceiling, mold in the bathroom, and the mattress was visibly concave. I would NEVER stay here or suggest it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Veronika49
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in prime location and just a few steps away from Times Square however rooms are dated and dirty. It is quiet noisy during the night. The whole bathroom was flooded and water was running onto the carpet in the room when we took a shower. The sheets seems clean and were changed along with the towels everyday. The worth thing is that they have bed bugs. After the third night I wake up covered in bed bugs bites and I even found one sitting on my pillow. I reported it to maid who cleaned the room ut no action was taken. I am sure there a better hotels in the area

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, comfortable room lots of services nearby.”
Reviews.Author: 1helpfultraveler
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, close to the theatre, Times Square, midtown shopping, Central Park and Rockefeller Center. There are lots of restaurants, many are very reasonable & family-friendly. Subway is a block away, although we were close to Times Square with our room on the 20th floor facing 7th Ave we weren't bother by street noise. Room was comfortable and in good condition, the carpet in the hallways was a little worn in places, but we were too busy sightseeing to spend much time in the hotel. The pool area, although we didn't use it was very nice, they have an outdoor deck with chaises and tables and umbrellas, a nice surprise in the City. Staff was friendly and helpful, our room was available for early check-in, bell desk was able to hold luggage for late afternoon departure. They have computers and printers in the lobby for guest use as well. We saw many foreign visitors and US tourists, I would definitely consider staying again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: katiedt
Reviews.Content: Wow - so hard to know where to start. The hotel is grungy and worn down. Carpets stained everywhere, walls dinged up, tile in bathrooms has grit, everything is just pretty gross. I missed the fine print in the reservation where the hotel no longer provides any sort of room service, nor do they have wifi in the rooms. There is a small cruddy little cable you can plug into your computer but then you have to sit at the small desk in the corner. The crowning jewel was that despite me requesting not one, but TWO wake up calls, the hotel failed to deliver EITHER of them. The manager was "perplexed and concerned" but offered no other remedy or anything else. Couldn't wait to get the heck out of there. NEVER again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mm6460
Reviews.Content: First time to New York - hotel staff were polite and welcoming. Rooms were more than adequate - huge rooms with a Starbucks coffee machine, large Televisions, free Ice and stationary. Free Internet in the Lobby. Overall, great hotel. Definitely would stay here again as was in PRIME location as Times Square is LITERALLY on it's door steps! Our room had a view of Times Square! And the beds are INCREDIBLE! We bought the pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ivytrav
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and we were still impressed with the cleanliness of the room and rest of the hotel. The bathroom was absolutely spotless, even in the corners under the sink. With all of the bedbug hype we always thoroughly inspect our rooms! Just as the last stay here, the rest of the room was extremely clean. Our room was just outside of the elevators and was still quiet. I look forward to staying here again for our next trip to NYC. Lastly, the location can not be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Steps from Central Park/Lovey Pool overlooking the Ave too!”
Reviews.Author: LMC62
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group at the Manhattan Times Square and were thrilled with the size of the room, the convenience of the on-site breakfast/bar/lounge, how close we were to Rockafeller Center (2 blocks!), plus the TODAY show taping area nearby was easy to run over to earlyAM before the crowds,,,as well there was a gorgeous pool on the 5th floor overlooking 57th St, the billboards all around the large sliding doors of the pool area made you feel like you were in a swimming pool in the middle of Times Square! The staff, concierge, bellmen and all treated us like royalty. Mother treated us to what would be our last meal at the Tavern on the Green, although we didn't know it at that time. What a time-piece that restaurant is - lovely chandeliers were everywhere, my daughter loved the mirrored hallways. We will be back in NYC this year for another Excellent NYC Shopping Wk-end, and of course, staying at the Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent excellent excellent”
Reviews.Author: davinder5
Reviews.Content: Everything was the way it should be.. perfect. Excellent location and comfort. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate location”
Reviews.Author: lovettecorrea
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fantastic service. Staff friendly and helpful. The ultimate location. Restaurant with a great ambience. Rooms are clean. If lucky get a room looking over Times square - Awesome view at night.

Reviews.Title: “disgustingly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Brondie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights June 2011, plumbing wastewater took ages to recede, air conditoner unit full of unknowns, ended up with a virus that I'm still suffering from back in OZ. We paid $744.00 Australian to stay here, extremely dissappointed. Do not stay in Room 1740. Be Warned, it has nasties.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotels attract bad people”
Reviews.Author: Rayandbobo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location... it is a little worn but really clean. Since this was a budget priced hotel, a bunch of groups stay here and create havoc on regular guests. Last weekend, we had the honor of sharing the hotel with a 4-H club from Nebraska. While the chaperones were out at Flashdancers all night, the kids were running rampant doing all sorts of nasty things carnal and all in the stairwells. This place also attracts people with babies for some strange reason. Add that with paper thin walls and you have a disaster. This place is a short walk to Times Square and Tim Horton's... GREAT LOCATION!!! I am not a fan of times square and after a day of walking, my elbows hurt from body checking tourists in the crowd. It is a sport. If you have a choice, spend a little more and stay at a more expensive hotel, it will thin out the possibilities of being stuck with a bunch of midwest yokels and babies.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was Great !”
Reviews.Author: Prath
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Manahatten. Location was great , could get early check-in , so everything was just perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel = 2 Stars, Staff = 4+”
Reviews.Author: thefly
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives... Very friendly/helpful staff Good location (if you want to be near Times Sq) The negatives... The hotel sent me on a time warp back to the mid-80s...with flat screen TVs. Very dated--the wear and tear is showing. In serious need of an update. Overall a quite mediocre hotel. It wasn't terrible but you could probably do better.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Dated Tourist Hotel with Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sync-In-Progress
Reviews.Content: For an SPG property this hotel is in pretty sad shape and in need of investment. Installing a flat panel TV in the room and renovating the lobby doesn't magically bring the whole place up to spec. The location is great for tourism. The staff are good competent people. The facility is rather poor, but clean (mostly).

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL WAS AWESOME AND LOCATION SECOND TO NONE”
Reviews.Author: Icequeen101
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what people are complaining about this hotel for. We recently stayed here for our 30th Anniversary and were completely satisfied, from check-in to check-out. We stayed in room #1747. Corner room, king size bed and plenty of room to move around. We had an in room safe and our view was of Times Square. The hotel staff was nothing but friendly, helpful and most courteous. It always amazes me when people pay 3 star price and expect 5 star accomodations!! They had computers in the lobby and we were always able to check emails, etc without having to wait very long. I had been reading reviews for about 2 months prior to going to New York and I was a little skeptic about this hotel. I can guarantee you our stay was nothing but EXCELLENT and would recommend staying here again. You could not ask for a better location to be close to Time Square and all buses, subways etc.

Reviews.Title: “4 star lobby, 2 star rooms. Would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: 14Roger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of May 2011. I stayed here because of the proximity to my business travel meeting locations and that this hotel is part of the starwood chain (which I often use for travelling) and I therefore had more faith in this hotel as a result. My first impression upon arriving at the hotel with staff outside to greet you, assist with bags, and walking into the lobby is that this looks like a nice hotel after all. The lobby looks like a 4 star hotel and they offer free computer terminals with internet and printing in the lobby area as well as free wifi. After checking in and taking the elevator up to my floor, the shock when the elevator doors opened was ridiculous. When you step out of the elevator into the hall it's like a time warp going back to the early 80s which is when it appears the rest of the hotel (other than the lobby) were last remodelled. Everything was old and the room was even worse. I knew it was going to be small (12' x 14' perhaps) but I was fine with that as a single traveller. The room had a queen size bed and from just about every outside wall in the room (including from the door to the hall) you could just about touch the bed. The biggest issue I had was that it was not very clean. The sheets were white but the carpet wasn't well vacuumed, there were hairs on the bathroom floor, in the tub, walls surrounding the tub, etc. Due to cleaniless alone I would not dare bring my family to this hotel nor would I stay here again for business. The other issue I had was that the toilet didn't flush nor did the shower drain. I did call down and they did come up and fix it promptly. I found that the shower didn't train and I noticed the plug didn't look like it was sitting in the centre of the drain. I therefore lifted it up and it actually came out of the drain hole. What came up with it was enough hair stuck it to in a big ball to fill the palm of your hand. Disgusting. No wonder it didn't drain. Bed bugs - there were NONE. I checked every day and lost sleep over it the first night as I kept on waking up to check. I checked when I got there by pulling the bed off the wall, lifting the mattress, looking for any sign of them and I found no evidence nor was I bitten, etc. That is one good thing going for this hotel plus the free wifi in the lobby. Location - fantastic for a tourist. Close to time square, theatres, central park, subway, etc.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: YaldaM
Reviews.Content: This hote is fantastically located in Times square and close to subway station. we moved from Park Central hotel which was couple of blocks away from this hotel and supposedly a 4 stars hotel. We were vry happy with our move and enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice about staying at this aweful hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laceycat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met another couple for a long weekend in New York. When we arrived the weather was in the 80s. when we got our room all seemed good until we discovered the air conditioning didn't work. They sent up a maintenance man who said he would have it fixed while we were out. When we arrived back late night it was not fixed. By 4:00am it was so hot in the room we had to ask to switch to another room. They gave us a much smalled room with a smaller bed. And guess what....NO AIR CONDITIONING!!!! We were told it would be turned on and all we got was the run around. Needless to say we stayed in a hot box. The air in our friends room worked great. Oh and this hotel does not have room service either! I would think twice about staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average for price”
Reviews.Author: JessHowell
Reviews.Content: After staying at motels I was excited to be staying in an expensive hotel but felt the cheaper motels were much better. The staff were not very friendly, the room was so small we had to pack the suit cases away so we could actually move in the room and there was no mini fridge to store anything. There was also no free wifi in the rooms, we had to go down stairs and use the hotel's computers (for a maximum of 45 minutes) or take our laptop down and sit on the floor to access the free wifi for a maximum of 30 minutes. However, the hotel's location was excellent. Close walking distance to the centre of Times Square and also close to many different subway stations. My favourite part about the hotel was the bed - literally the most comfortable bed and pillow I have ever slept on!

Reviews.Title: “New York's the best”
Reviews.Author: harlequinsmad_11
Reviews.Content: Booked a trip through Opodo for our twins sons 21st Birthday, when booking with Opodo I specified 2 rooms both with twin beds, on arrival this was not the case and we just had 2 rooms booked, the guy at the front desk, went out of his way to ensure we had a larger room to keep the boys in different and this did not detract from the break we had in New York, on the next block up is a Rosie O'Donnels for food, but our favourite was 2 streets down towards Times Square a great deli you could sit in and eat and freshly cooked breakfast or take a deli sandwich away at night. The Manhattan is in a great location, for Times Square, Central Park and the subway, great stay, great staff, great pool all in all a great weekend was had by one and all.

Reviews.Title: “11 pm check- In”
Reviews.Author: waltdrew
Reviews.Content: not off to a promising start. Stuck in the lobby for two hours waiting for our room to be ready.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in All Aspects”
Reviews.Author: TeresaMeena
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Manhattan at Times Square was Superb in every aspect! Overall, our experience was very positive. My cousin and I were two women, traveling alone to New York City. We knew we wanted to stay in a place that was centrally located and secure. This hotel scored points on both accounts. The Manhattan Hotel is located just a few blocks away from Times Square, the Theatre District, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. Because we arrived early, we thought we didn't have a prayer for early check-in (11:00am); however, the front desk staff said there was no problem. What a great start to our NYC trip! Our room was outstanding, generous size, with two, comfortable beds, and very clean. The maids, the concierge, the security guards, and doormen, were all courteous, helpful and friendly. We loved the pool and exercise room too; the deck overlooks Times Square. Overall, we had a fabulous stay in NYC, mostly due to our wonderful experience at The Manhattan at Times Square. We recommend this hotel to anyone looking for big, clean, quiet rooms and helpful staff! Thanx to all staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: HockeyMomCathyE
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and the staff was wonderful. Convenient location. Would definitely stay there on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but property is Old!!”
Reviews.Author: BrandonJ88
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel partly because it was close to my client's office and also from the pictures on their website the place looked nice. The place does not look anything like the pictures. Because of my status with SPG I was given one of the 'best' rooms, which had an adjoining door to another room. The room was small and gloomy with old furniture and decor. The tiny workstation was occupied with coffee maker, tourist pamphlets, and a lamp. The bed sheet that covered the thin mattress was wrinkled as if it was just pulled out of the hamper. The place has an odd smell of old carpet being masked by inexpensive air freshener. I booked for 6 nights but moved to another hotel after two nights. The hotel should lower their rates or fix up the property to match what they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the Best Location”
Reviews.Author: James_Galway
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying 4 nights in this hotel, was a bit nervous going by some of the reviews but we found this hotel brillant. We stayed on the 12th floor and the rooms were quiet large with good views - beds were lovely and changed daily and everything was spotless. The location of this hotel is as good as you can get in Times Square with everything in walking distance. Good internet access in lobby but can get busy at times, also printing available for flight check in's.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location...Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Evilgypsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night, (in the city to see a show) the location could not be beat, steps away (ok, more like a few blocks) from everything! When we pulled up (once we found it, look for a huge M on the building!) the doorman was very helpful and patient. The fact that you can park at the hotel (outside company) was a real plus. Mohammed checked us in, warm, friendly, engaging and answered all our concerns upfront, a real gem, ask fo him by name. I read the other reviews and wasn't expecting much but...we had a corner room (2 windows!) no noise from the street, the room furniture had some wear but there was a huge flat screen, new carpet and the bed was comfy! The bathroom, although on the tiny side, was clean! and come on people, you dont go to NYC to sit in the room! We decided to have breakfast at the hotel restaurant, Russo's despite the reviews about price...and we are glad we did...the room was very pleasant and not to busy, we had a table by the window so we enjoyed watching all the bustle outside, the food was fresh and tasty, but the the real star was our server Dasalya (forgive me if I spelled that wrong) she was friendly, caring, efficient and a joy to get to know! Ask for her by name too! If I had to say one negative? it is a busy hotel (location afterall) so the lobby is always a buzz!

Reviews.Title: “It is a very conveniently- located hotel to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DavidPSingapore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the centre of Times Square, where all the shopping and theatres are. It is very convenient if you want to catch any of the plays/musicals. The room my wife & I stayed in was quite comfortable, big and clean. Room service was provided daily. Coffee and tea were provided although there was no fridge. The concierge service was very good and the staff extremely helpful. As my wife & I were on a free & easy tour, we find the subways and buses very convenient. The only drawback is the noise which sounds like train running on our last nite (earlier nites were quite quiet) although we were told that it's the noise from the boiler as we were staying at the top (22nd storey).

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: SoreLegs
Reviews.Content: The noise in this place was terrible - NY is the city that never sleeps - neither do you if you stay here. To be fair, the room was tidy. And you know that if you book near Times Square you're not going to get a big room - I expected all of that. But for a city that never sleeps, you would expect better sound proofing in the room - noise from other people in the hotel AND noise from outside. They should have double glazing & better sound dampening in the walls. Service - This place by far is the worst I have ever encountered. The front desk, the concierge & unfortunately even someone from housekeeping were absolutely shocking. The front desk - nothing is more important than themselves - and they made you aware of that. The concierge - if there was nothing in it for them (ie commission) - they didn't care - I did make an effort to tip where advice was useful. Housekeeping - extra towel... seriously how hard is it to just say "of course" or "okay" rather than make you feel you had just asked them for their first born. But a big rap to the floor cleaner guy in the Lobby - his smile made you feel like he was your grandfather - wish I got his name! This place is in a great location for the Times Square experience - if you need to visit Times Square, sure, stay close for a night or two (but not here) - but if here for a few more nights for a whole of NY experience - quickly move down to Soho, Village areas etc - better value and the subway is so easy to get around. Another upside - free Internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location with pool”
Reviews.Author: holidayqueen95
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New York and we had the most amazing time. The hotel was 5 minutes walk from Times Square and 10 minutes to Central Park. The staff were always polite and helpful, and the room was clean and comfortable. I would not hesitate in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in the Dog House”
Reviews.Author: TunaSlayer
Reviews.Content: This place was horrid. The room was filthily, furniture old, scuffed and barely standing. The beds were narrow and uncomfortable. Management was cool and unreceptive. The street noise was loud and distracting. The weight room claustrophobic. Other than that it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: jcann
Reviews.Content: You can forgive this hotel many things because of its location. You look out of the window to views of the Theatres of Broadway. You are two minutes walk to Times Square, five from Central Park, Ten from the Rockerfeller centre and Fifteen from the Empire State. Everything you require to see on a short stop, close at hand. The rooms are small to medium inside but well kept and comfortable enough. Coffee making and irons available but no fridge. Do remember to close your window fully or you don't get the sound insulation and the street noise would be deafening. Friendly and helpfull staff. Free broadband One word of warning. Breakfast in the hotel is $25.50 +Tax + Gratuity. Go out of the front door, turn left, left again at the first corner. When you turn you will see the Sushi Deli across the road, far corner of the block. $20 buys an excellent breakfast for two. Don't worry, they serve eegs, bacon etc, not raw fish.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back because of the friendly employees.”
Reviews.Author: RWGARLOCK
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Manhattan at Times Square Hotel for the past five years. We stay several times a year. We are most impressed with the employees that take care of us each trip. We make our reservations with Muhammad Abdullah that does his job perfectly. When we arrive, we are welcomed by the doorman, Jack Baptiste that always has a happy smile. Our last trip, we had two personal problems arise and were quickly taken care of by Service Agent Paolo Era, and Engineer, Kwasi Abeyie. In the dining room, we are always welcomed by Geraldo and our new waiter this time was Mohammed Chowdhury that did a outstanding job making us welcome. We look forward to our next stay in September. Richard Garlock

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Sarmy13
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to everything in walking distance. Hotel not the nicest but really who cares you are in New York. You are not in your room alot. All u need is a bed and a restroom. I would come back for sure!!!! Sign up for Gray Line. Bus takes you around New York. Very easy transportation

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BraveCougar
Reviews.Content: Ok, the hotel has probably seen it's best days in terms of decor but it still offers nice amenities with very affordable price. Our room was ok sized with a great view to Broadway. There was a nice flat screen tv in the room and a coffee maker. No fridge but there's an ice machine in every floor. Staff was extremely helpful all the way. Fitness center and pool were also nice (although Sauna was merely warm, not hot).

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but facilities on the dated side”
Reviews.Author: Cheemar
Reviews.Content: So if your cab driver looks blankly at you when you say the hotel name, say the "Old Sheraton" on 7th Ave because the new one is just a block up the same street. The telephones in the rooms still have old Sheraton branding on them, and you do often find yourself pining at your window the the new hotel, as the rooms at the Manhattan at Times Sq hotel are dated. They are very spacious, but the decor is old, there is no fridge (ice buckets have to suffice - though this is common in US hotels) and the bathroom is very basic. There are no bells and whistles here. What we did enjoy was the staff - they were courteous without being sycophantic, informative without being pushy and accomodating without chasing you down the hallway for a tip (this has happened to me). One thing to know for this hotel - it's very popular with the group booking set. So expect lots of US students from other states to be in the foyer (and I guess, if you are unfortunate enough, on your floor...though this does depend on the quality of adult supervision for the kids) with regular turnover. This didn't affect our stay too much as there was a minder who sat in the hallway on our floor all night to ensure no hijinks / shenanigans from the kids, but if that wasn't the case, it might have been a different story. Oh, one more thing, rooms have paper thin walls. I'd like to say this is because the rampaging carnal activity in my room drew complaints, but actually it was because I had a jet-lagged 18-month old toddler to keep entertained between the hours of 2am-7am each night and clearly my neighbours could hear because I could hear them coughing, getting up to get water, eye-rolling (ok, so not the last one). Thankfully the internet terminals in the foyer are 24 hours - this helped take care of some of the time I needed to kill.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby. Friendly”
Reviews.Author: chatelaua
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tired and the rooms need fresh carpet and drapes . The hotel elevators broke down several times. There is no milk for coffee, no room service and Internet in the room is average. Free wifi is in the foyer with a bank of computers but very limited seating which is a problem with the busloads of guests arriving and leaving. Central to times square

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Bro1240
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I really like the location of the Hotel . It was really close to Time square. The staff was friendly and helpful. At check in they upgraded our room from a Queen to a King .The Room was good except it did not have a fridge. We stayed one night but we would return.

Reviews.Title: “best experience ever”
Reviews.Author: darren_webber
Reviews.Content: i just got back from New York. and i don't have a bad thing to say. the hotel was brill. rooms cleaned everyday, coffee in morning, if you read some reviews there are problems with bed bugs in neighbouring hotels NOT THE MANHATTAN AT TIMES SQUARE it was clean and very hygienic. the staff were really helpful bell boys always on hand the Theatre rep has enormous knowledge. the location is perfect Times Square outside you would not even know it as you cant hear it in your room, rockefeller 2 blocks. empire state building 10ish blocks and the best was Central Park just outside. i will be definitely using this hotel again and if anyone was to ask this hotel would be the first and only recommendation. also they have a check in flight facility in the lobby. the theatres are just round the other side of the hotel (mama mia best ). email me i will tell you more tc07saw@yahoo.co.uk

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: RLDCWD
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Manhattan from a long flight from Canada and were met by the greatest bell boy, can't remember his name (sorry) he immediately offered to take a photo of us with the times square tower in the background. Check in was smooth and easy and we were escorted to our room by another faboulous bell boy who was so good to us, offering different advise about restaurants etc. The room was fantastic had a view over times square - could not complain. I had read reviews on here and was concerned that perhaps the hotel needed renovations but not our room! The highlight of our trip was the gray line hop on hop off tour. This really made our stay, the worst part was after 3 days we had to go home it wasn't long enough. One night we asked our initial bell boy to recommend a restaurant he did so which was a little underground place called Joe G's. It was superb. Our best meal from LA, Vegas Canada and New York. And only 10 minutes walk to the beautiful central park Would definitely stay here again and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE New York & Stay at Manhattan @ Time Square was Great!”
Reviews.Author: JChaseSeattle
Reviews.Content: Location - Great Comfort - Good (room was a bit warm) Cleanliness - Great Space in Room - Great Front Desk Staff - Great Security - Great Service - Good Doorman Staff - Excellent and Helpful Heart of Manhattan - within in walking distance of everything I wanted to see & close to subways Desk had room for laptop and outlets that were accesible!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bandaUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Our room was next to the elevator which was very noisy throughout the night. The room was a decent size, it was a bit dusty & the bathroom looked a bit tired, but to be honest we were hardly in the room. The location of this hotel was fantastic and most sights were within walking distance or a short taxi ride! I would consider staying at this hotel again if I returned to New York as it was a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff with an outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: EFontoura
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the hotel did not appeared that great in shape, but when I was checked in by a GSA called Guillermo, I immediately knew that my trip would be good. He is so friendly and concerned about your needs. I was given a room served by a Lady called Estha Benjamin, who was always there with a big smile and prompt to serve. Waking up and heading for the restaurant was great everyday!!! At the door , Geraldo the restaurant manager, would welcome with a big smile and ensuring that I was directed to Dalisay (waitresses) who is full of energy and happiness. She would serve that delicious breakfast with a touch of joy and care. overall, I must say that I am counting to get back and meet those people who made my trip the best and the most relaxing one.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing is location!!”
Reviews.Author: michelle42195
Reviews.Content: In all fairness I must say, this was my first trip to N.Y., and I had a couple of days of culture shock... I realize in many large cities, that things are more expensive and smaller, but this hotel was not at all what I expected by looking at their web-site. The Manhattan Hotle in NY Times Square, has nothing to offer, other than a good location. I hear its one of the cheapest for the area, but I would have rather spent some extra money to maybe have one emenity. I stayed at the hotel for 6-nights, and wanted to leave early... They have no room service, no fridge in room, no coffee, or simple foods on site to buy. The internet accsess did not work in room, and beds are fullsize, and room is very cramped. The gift shop that is supposed to stay open late, almost always had a closed sign on it in the evening, and after I inquired about this; I was told its privately owned... the girl was in there, but would not work- she was eating, and on telephone. This happnened every evening- as hard as this is to believe. The hotel has one restraunt, but it looks very fancy/expensive. The hotel doesnt even offer a free bottle of water, everything you will purchase from stores blocks away, or their vending machines, or gift shop when open, and pay a high price. The pool area is shared by residents, or other patrons from other hotels- I was surprised by this, and each person is greeted by a YMCA type of mentality- who will only want to give you one towel per person, and you are not allowed to leave with their towels to go back to your room- so bring a cover up. I have had better service at a Holiday Inn, and I am not joking. The hotel is packed with teenagers coming in large groups, and this may be due to price. The computers that have free internet are in main lobby, but there are only 6 for hundreds of people- so good luck using one. The only thing good about this hotel is the location, but after 2-days of seeing advertisements, this gets old. There are other hotels around, and next time- I will pay extra and get a more relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere in Manhattan! despite its great location, this hotel is terrible”
Reviews.Author: Sydney82
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, clogged up toilets and basins, furniture literally falling apart, unfriendly and uncaring staff. The list goes and on... Probaly one of the worst places I have stayed at in the recent years. The location (in the heart of Times Square and therefore very convenient) will never make up for the shape this hotel is in. The Starwood Group is definitely not living up to ist name with this hotel. I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Sticky, loud, and falling apart.”
Reviews.Author: ceml
Reviews.Content: With the volume of guests they get here, which includes frequent busloads of students and airline crews, I'm sure it's difficult to keep up with the maintenance, but it seems like they've given up even trying. The front desk staff is indifferent and seem untrained. Gum on the carpet. Hair (not mine) in the bed. Clogged sink and tub. Peeling paint and wallpaper. Had to move the nightstand to retrieve my glasses and i won't even mention what i saw back there. Bachelor party in the room next door, which began at 3:00 in the morning. It's priced low for the area, but everything is sticky. It's worth it to spend a little more to go across the street to the Sheraton. P.S. Their "high-speed" internet is dreadfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “SLEEPLESS IN NEW YORK!!!”
Reviews.Author: andria1973
Reviews.Content: CITY BREAK FOR A WEEK WITH MY HUSBAND FOR HIS 40TH BIRTHDAY PROS Central to all in NEW YORK CONS Terrible!! we had room 1043! we got next to no sleep in this hotel due to doors slamming at at all hours. YOU HEAR WHAT THE NEXT ROOM IS UP TO!! COUGHING ETC!! NOT GOOD!! Room was alright but not worth the cash we paid. We found THE watch of the previous resident so this shows how much the cleaners "CLEAN" DRUGS- Reported 3 times!!!( Different nights) strong smell of Cannabis as soon as you left the lift at level 10 the smell was that strong it was comming into our room, hotel staff did nothing as they said that they couldnt locate it. CLEANERS cleaning past 10.30pm why I have no idea since you have to check out by 12 and cannot check in until 3pm. (they too slammed about why??.. No idea!!) STATIC BUILD UP Hugh amount of static build up in this hotel staff said it was worse in winter than Summer you got a shock every time you touched something not good! Godness knows what this would do to someone with a heart problem! OVERALL DONT STAY HERE GOOD IF YOU WANT TO WASTE YOUR MONEY

Reviews.Title: “OK BUT COULD HAVE BEEN BETTER”
Reviews.Author: artvan1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and appearance good also liked location just a few blocks from times square, however the ammenities could be improved , had to call to try to get a hair dryer and took to long. also no room service, no fridge. Overall i would rate average but the doorman especially theo i believe his name was was very nice and helpful and always had a smile. I still recommend hotel but be aware of what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “SPG Platinum worst stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: jgib1967
Reviews.Content: As an SPG Platinum member I receive generally good service across the board, and there are many SPG properties from which to choose in Manhattan. Do not waste any time or points on this property. It is only affiliated with Starwood - these franchise owners have not a clue about how to support SPG Platinum guests. My room had dirty carpeting, a hole in the wall. It was not an "upgrade." After the front desk refused to listen, I spent an hour on the phone with SPG Platinum concierge to move across the street to the Sheraton Towers - at first they refused since I had already checked in. I told them I would be taking pictures of the room condition and sending them to SPG Platinum, for a full refund of the night's points, unless they facilitated the move. Finally they did and I was in an acceptable business room at the Sheraton Towers. The Manhattan was like something out of a 70s horror film. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location would not hesitate in returning.”
Reviews.Author: sandraoneill63
Reviews.Content: It was our 1st trip to New York. We could not have picked a better hotel. Its location was great right in the heart of everything. it was clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only fault I would have is that the bed was a bit small for a double, it would have been nice to have had a king size one. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice! They dont have refrigerator in rooms”
Reviews.Author: flaviabloc
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. Friendly staff ! Very close of time square!

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable stay ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Darlene12439
Reviews.Content: The staff was the best. The room was very comfortable and clean. I absolutely loved the comfortable bed. Slept like a baby. The hotel manager was very accommodating. I can not wait to come back to NYC for our next visit and stay at your awesome hotel. Darlene Stutts

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting! Dirty linens when we checked in.”
Reviews.Author: Tuffy9
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that we have stayed in several Sheratons all over the world and I am pretty flexible when it comes to accommodations. This was by far the worst we have ever stayed in. After we checked in, I was lying on our bed and I noticed a stray black hair or two (I am a blonde). After looking closely, I realized the bed was covered in hundreds of little black hairs. The bed had been made, but with the same linens. We called down to the front desk to have the linens changed. After two hours of waiting, we found a housekeeper in the hallway. She said our room wasn't in her area, but she would get us new linens. No one ever checked on the situation. The rest of the room was below average. The bathtub was rusty and falling apart. I would have been OK with that, but the dirty linens really grossed me out. The location of the hotel is great, but the service and cleanliness were unacceptable. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expecting a 3 star hotel don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: daisy1126
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an amazing location but other than that this place was a dump. We booked to rooms and they put us 10 floors apart! Both rooms had torn wallpaper dirty end tables and was in need of a good vacuum and scrub. We asked for a recommendation for dinner and the concierge was rude! I would never stay here again we got a group rate at 205 a night and I have stayed in cleaner rooms for much less!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: SeverineSerizy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfect for a leisure trip- just minutes walk from Times Square, clean, comfortable, pretty good service.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Rooms Near the Elevators”
Reviews.Author: brees3
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers nice rooms and a large open lobby. There is free internet available to guests in the lobby and although they offer many terminals, it is often a busy space and you can find yourself waiting for a computer to use. The location is great, just minutes from Times Square! We stayed in this hotel either side of a one week cruise out of New York. The first stay was 5 days and no real complaints, the second stay was one night. When we returned for our one night stay we were put in a room right next to the elevators, they were very noisy, it felt as though there were cables running through our ceiling and walls as you could hear them continually day and night, I dont usually find it hard to sleep, however I did find it hard to sleep that night with the noise, I would have asked to move if I was staying for longer. The only other thing was that the in room safe in one of the rooms didnt work, we called the lobby to have it looked at but unfortunately no one came!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but pricey”
Reviews.Author: PaulArts
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent, literally just a few steps from Times Square. We stayed on the 19th floor which was nice and quite. The rooms have a good size and are clean. Bathroom is a bit outdated and small though. The services staff is friendly and there's free internet access in the lobby, also wireless! In the room you pay $14 per day. The shop is expensive though, if you want to buy a drink, do so from the vending machine, they are about half price! All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bazin
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel (just a few blocks from Times Square). Room was as described and very clean. Staff very helpful. Very good shower. Security safe complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Times Square location makes up for noisy surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Wanderlust78
Reviews.Content: Slightly dated hotel, was rife with noisy tourists and had questionable amenities but the location was outstanding - right near Times Square. Was disappointed in lack of serviceable Internet (wireless unavailable and wired connection was spotty at best) and no room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: MWCheshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fantastic spot and my family found it ideal for our needs. I would echo what people say about the staff - they were top notch, especially Eddie and Josephine on the Reception Desk. Some of the decor is getting ready for a repaint, but it is nothing to worry about. The beds are very clean and comfortable and we all slept beautifully. The swimming pool was the icing on the cake - it is just like the picture on the hotel website. Don't believe the doubters - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cally94
Reviews.Content: just back from a four day trip staying in the manhattan didnt know what we were going to as write up wasnt great but nothing to worry about great hotel lovley staff doorman is a hoot ask ant of the staff for directions or places to eat and they will help you all they can.....things are busy and noisy during the daybut come night time you dont here a thing in the room so you get a good nights sleep ready for whatever the next day,,,you must vist ellens stardust diner singing from eight in the morning there fab its sooooo crazy going back next year.......

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: travelinphilly
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, I expected a lot more from this hotel. The location is perfect, but the hotel rooms are dingy, lack any type of decor, and the bathrooms are disgusting. In addition, the noisy heating/air conditioning unit rattle all night and they are full of dust and possible mold. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. If you want another Starwood property, try the Sheraton across the street at 52nd and 7th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: debclark
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, clean, location is excellent.Staff so pleasant and helpful. You can walk to most places or the subway is just around the corner. When i read reviews before booking i was concerned by the negative ones BUT DO NOT be put off, this hotel is WONDERFUL i will be staying again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: THFitz
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for convenience if looking to be right in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Kiziltay
Reviews.Content: the location is very good. we had stayed in this hotel in 2003 when it was Sheraton Manhattan and were slightly worried if things changed negatively after the name change. Actually, I found the hotel better this time! it was a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a one night stop-over”
Reviews.Author: Hethb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for one night. The key thing about this hotel is that it is very busy, and very large so does not offer an incredibly personal service. However, all of the staff with whom I spoke were professional, friendly and helpful - especially Phil at the concierge desk who booked my shuttle to the airport. I didn't spend a great deal of time in the hotel since I was working but the room was comfortable and the most important thing to me - the bed - was also comfortable and warm (too many covers) so I slept well. The bathroom was tiny but I've been told that's usual for New York and it was sufficient for one person - however I wouldn't want to spend more than one night here and probably not on a leisure trip. The only real negative aspects were a) the heater which as someone else has mentioned is old and dusty and very noisy - I wore earplugs so it wasn't a problem and b) whilst there are a few PC's in reception which are free for up to 45 mins there is no privacy - the screens are quite large and I actually had a woman stood over my shoulder waiting to use it so I couldn't do any work on there. The internet connection was also extremely slow.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and value.”
Reviews.Author: Frank449
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for location and value. A bit dated but very clean and well maintained, this hotel provides a quieter and more intimate alternative to the larger Sheraton New York across the street. The staff is friendly, helpful and attentive to your needs. The restaurant is now only open for breakfast, which is a shame given its interesting sidewalk level location. This hotel also has a well maintained pool that while fully enclosed and also dated, provides a relaxing excercise alternative and seems very popular with the kids. Free wi-fi and terminals in the lobby. Times Square, Broadway theatre's and Central Park are all short walks from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of New York!”
Reviews.Author: Nirajkool
Reviews.Content: There could be no better location if you want to feel the pulse of new York,right on Times Square with its blazing lights and towering billboards. We were there on a long weekend on 30th may ,31st being Memorial day and at night it was crazy.We thanked our stars we chose this hotel to stay.You could not believe the crowd on the streets and atmosphere in Times square. For the price, rooms were comfortable and reasonable size,considering we were in New York and Times square at that! Staff was very helpful as they helped me assemble a newly bought stroller for my special child,in the middle of the night. It was a clean and comfortable hotel and we really enjoyed Times Square by night as also the other attractions which were closeby,Madame Tussauds,The Empire State Building and the names of the financial powerhouses right in front of us. We had an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's not easy picking up after High School Students on their first trip to NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: Peter14236
Reviews.Content: As a tour escort for School Tours of America I am often amazed at how much work the house keepers have to do and how quickly they clean up these rooms. This past week I had a school group from Houston, TX and Khadijah Barko was my house keeper. I told her she didn't have to worry about me because I knew she had so many other clients to take care of on the 12th Floor, which I was on. EVERY DAY she'd come by and check on me, even though I told her she didn't have to do anything. She kept offering me coffee, towels, soap, shampoo and conditioner and constantly offered to make my bed and fix up my room. I told her I really didn't need her because I pretty much take care of myself. She was always so friendly when I turned her away but still, I appreciated the attention. Thank you Khadijah! I REALLY did appreciate it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value / Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: tkts0000
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel: 1) Corner room with King size bed was spacious enough to fit two comfortable cots for our 7 y.o. and 3 y.o. / Everyone got a great night sleep after an active day of walking and sight-seeing. 2) Pool provided afternoon respite for tired children who were too excited to nap. Provided enough of a refresher to enjoy the late afternoon and early evening activities. 3) Service was excellent. The cots were brought up in a timely manner. We received a follow up call regarding a lost hat that we had inquired about at the front desk. Staff was very helpful in explaining minimeters (i.e., can leave your car in same spot as long as you keep updating the meter). 4) Location was fantastic. Room was quiet. NYC has strict anti-honking laws that have drastically reduced street/traffic noises. 5) Rooms were clean (enough). Although hotel could use updating -- I'd gladly sacrifice fresh paint, wallpaper, and pictures for such an affordable hotel room. Will definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: halloweenmom
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled with a group, ages 10-18 (excluding adults). Upon arrival our rooms were not ready and we sat in the halls waiting for the hotel staff to prepare them. Not only were we tired after traveling a long way, we were forced to listen to the staff argue with each other. The rooms are dated, mold and mildew were on the walls of the shower and the air did not work. The rooms were hot and stuffy and we were told to "open your windows". Being on the upper floors, the windows only opened 6 inches. I listened to the elevator mechanisms ALL NIGHT. There is a small "gift shop" whose hours were inconsistent, to say the least. No one addressed our problems and no apologies were made. STAY IN ANOTHER HOTEL, THE EXTRA MONEY YOU SPEND WILL BE WELL WORTH IT. If the above review appeals to you and you enjoy staying in a hotel with other groups then this is your spot. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE. EVER.

Reviews.Title: “A swimming pool with a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Resende99
Reviews.Content: There are three reasons to stay at this hotel. Price, location and the swimming pool. If one or two of those are your priority you can consider it otherwise go somewhere else. The staff is badly trained, not only coughing at you but also not knowing what to do when there is a problem. I had a problem with the telephone and internet in the room and the engineer was completely lost, after trying different solutions he suggested me to change room without knowing if there was another room available. The operator was even worse he or she told several people that I was not in the hotel while I was waiting for them in the room, without even trying to contact me. The worse for me was the quality (or lack of quality) of the bed and the cleanliness (or lack of cleanliness) of the heating. I believe they have never changed the filters and the mattresses for many years. But the swimming pool is good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: vbandrea83
Reviews.Content: When I first checked into the hotel, the woman who checked me in proceeded to wipe her nose and cough into her hands while holding onto my license and credit card. She then told me that the rest of my party hadn't checked in yet, when they had arrived the night before. When I got to my room, my bathtub and sink had dirt in it. This is because the drains were clogged. Whenever I took a shower, I was standing in shin deep water and more dirt would come up from the drains. The heater was on full blast making the room very dry and uncomfortable. When I went to adjust the temperature, there wasn't a knob on the existing unit. I had to call the front desk for them to have someone come fix it. Needless to say, I ended up getting really sick on my last day. I will attribute this to the dirty hotel and the woman who checked me in while hacking and wiping her snotty nose on my ID and credit card. EW!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for Money in NY”
Reviews.Author: Mulls007
Reviews.Content: You cant go wrong for what you pay. Best location. Everything is walking distance. Nice staff, helpful. Internet and computer in the lobby were pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “This place has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: purockstar
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel, as the Sheraton Manhattan, probably 6 or 7 times for work. Very affordable and a great location. Nothing fancy, but reliable. However, during my recent stay, after the name change to "The Manhattan," it seems to have gone downhill. No longer any in-room food service. No booklet of hotel info in the room. Wireless internet was painfully slow, so I went with an ethernet plug -- which wasn't much better. The TV, although a flat screen, was a bit fuzzy. There was a giant hair on the toilet. The drain wasn't very clean. It seems that the whole room was a bit dusty. Very strange -- I'm not a picky guy at all, but it was a bit discouraging. The bright points -- the location is still superb, the treadmills in the gym are quite nice, and I always forget -- they have a pool. I've never used, but it's tempting.

Reviews.Title: “great size room and loved the coffee maker”
Reviews.Author: symwatcher
Reviews.Content: I stay in Manhattan frequently on business and loved this hotel for the price. The room was a great size I did not feel claustrophobic which has occurred at other hotels. I stayed at a high room with no traffic noise. Everything was within walking distance and easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times Square Location, Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: VAgirl505
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a couple times and recently stayed here for 2 nights during Martin Luther Kind weekend. For a nyc hotel, I think it is a very good value and would call it a 3 star hotel, but certainly not a luxury hotel. I've visited multiple times for a few reasons. First, I can use cash + points with my Starwood membership, and it costs very little compared to other nyc hotels. Also, I enjoy visiting nyc to see broadway shows, and the location of this hotel is right in the middle of the Times Square action. Lastly, it is one of the very few nyc hotels to have an indoor pool, which I very much enjoy when I travel. The hotel and the rooms, themselves, are not anything special and the decor is a bit tired in my opinion. However, the beds are comfortable, there are nice sized flat screen tvs in the rooms, and everything is clean, which is more important to me than the decor. The rooms and bathrooms are small, but not compared to other nyc hotels. I think the amenities at this hotel are great for the price. I used the gym, which is not huge, but has a decent selection of new equipment with individual TVs on the machines, which I like. I love the indoor pool, which is large and overlooking the city with big windows. It would be great if there were lounge chairs around the pool, rather than just the few tables and chairs, but overall, the pool is a great feature that makes the hotel appealing to me. The only issue we had while staying at this hotel last weekend was we were woken up both mornings by noise in the hallways. But it's hard to say if we were just unlucky by staying on the same floor as some very loud guests. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to others for location and comfort if you would like to be in the middle of Times Square. If you want a luxury experience, this is probably not the hotel for you. But I usually find it to be the best option for a Times Square hotel in the price range of 3 star hotels due to its amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service From Reservations”
Reviews.Author: datwood75002
Reviews.Content: Not often you become a fan of a hotel because of someone in reservations. Sharon Gilesnan was the reservation clerk who saved me. I'd cancelled my reservation thinking that would be a good way to change my reservation on-line. Turns out that was the absolute worst thing to do with a pre-paid reservation. She saved me hundreds of dollars. All I wanted to do was extend my stay a day (my screw up was cancelling the reservation) and by cancelling it, I was still on the hook for over $700 with nothing to show for it. Sharon refunded my money and then got me the reservation I wanted with the original rate.

Reviews.Title: “good value for a step above typical tourist class”
Reviews.Author: TonyNov
Reviews.Content: The room sizes and quality are nice enough to avoid complaints from family members more accustomed to staying at resort hotels outside of the city, yet still affordable compared to luxury hotels in NYC. The kids enjoyed a dip in the pool at the end of the day; an unusual accomodation in the city hotels. Breakfast buffet is overpriced. Bell staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Any reference to the Sheraton is misleading”
Reviews.Author: SONPAT
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as was told was 4and half star accommodation and of course on hearing Sheraton at times square by travel agent immediately thought of quality! The Sheraton it is NOT. Very limited restaurant services only breakfast which my elderly parents unfortunatley decided to have one morning and it cost $60!!. No bar/lounge in which to unwind from lots of walking and shopping, you have to leave to have a drink. Concierge staff very helpful, reception staff not really that interested in complaints. Our room was the worst for wear, curtain rail broken and curtain nets hanging down, reported it after arrival and got "of course madam I have it seen to right away" 4 days later leaving still the same. Location good but thats all I would recommend this hotel for.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan in the heart of NYC!”
Reviews.Author: esotericsilhouette
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan at Time Square Hotel provided my family and I with memorable outstanding service, and a clean friendly environment. Specifically, Paolo who worked at the front desk was very helpful when he checked us in and told us about Times Square. All of the porters were very helpful and friendly as well. All around, we left the hotel with satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “great location ... good hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel4fun2011
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the Manhattan ... right on 7th Ave with a view of Times Sq from the front door. The hotel itself is a quality product with good clean rooms, beds, and LCD TVs. Great indoor heated pool. Wish it had free internet though.

Reviews.Title: “I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Tarz0001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September for 6 nights, at first we were off to a bad start when we arrived to the hotel at about midnight and instead of having a twin room we ended up with a King bed, however the lady at the counter ensured us that we would have our twin room for the remaining 5 nights and gave us complimentary buffet breakfast for the week. The room was clean a little noisy...but it is NY afterall! The staff were excellant very helpful and friendly especially John Williams in the the buffet restaurant, he bent of backwards to make sure we had everything we need! I would definitely stay here again, the location was fantastic! The free internet in the foyer is a massive bonus, except for all the young teenagers hogging it with facebook!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KippBarker
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on TripAdvisor, I decided to stay at The Manhattan - using my Starwood Preferred points. This was a great decision. The hotel room was very nice - nothing really fancy - just a good quality place. The hotel location can't be beat! Blocks from Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, the theatres, Rockefeller Center and the south end of Central Park. I will definitely be staying here again next time I am in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and environment for a pleasureable stay.”
Reviews.Author: xxxxx_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with 4 women in one room....spacious enough to handle that without a problem. Bathroom especially was roomy.
