Staff were friendly and very helpful with subway directions; location is great for eating, shows, subways south and walking north or to shop. Lobby has computers for a quick e-mail check if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good staff.”
Reviews.Author: alanferris
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan at Times Square is a nice hotel in an excellent location. The staff were particularly helpful including a welcome room call on the first night and the recovery of a lost mastercard from the lobby. A late (4pm) checkout was no problem and they were on hand to assist quickly when a fuse needed changed in the room. Expected street noise given location. Ideal location and very close to subway. Stayed in room 1141 - very comfortable king size bed and large plasma tv. Room was rather small and the 3/4 length bath meant the adequate shower was the only option. Bathroom was clean but tired with some visible cracks and flaking in parts. Overall a nice hotel between 3 and 4 star. Would probably choose another hotel next time but would not be too bothered if I ended up here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for this location”
Reviews.Author: HungryBackpacker
Reviews.Content: So cheap for something thats on times square! We had a wonderful time... for a 120$ room, we got to stay so close to broadway, central park and in the heart of manhattan... which is what our itinerary was. So we never needed a cab! And could hang out late and not worry about safety etc. Definitely recommended if you want to stay in time square but are not willing to shell too much for the extra frills. This is a plain decor, basic essentials kind of place. But well maintained and with good service.

Reviews.Title: “the manhatten hotel.”
Reviews.Author: clairee53
Reviews.Content: we went to new york on the 21st of december till the 28th in which we stayed at this manhatten hotel. Considering it's not one of the tallest hotel's in new york, i would certainly recomend it. The rooms were spot on, size wise. They were always clean and the staff were just great, they were all so polite and welcoming, also very willing to help you with any problems. so great service. The swimming pool was such a nice add to the hotel, seen as through the first few days you tend to do most of the sight seeing and towards the end you run out of things to do, so the pool was a lovely activity. and the sauna was a plus. so all in all the hotel was fantastic. The location is perfect, even though you are right next to time square which is one of the busy area's in manhatten, when sleeping you could'nt here anything from outside. there were loads of shops, restuants, bars and deffenatly entertainment. So if you are interested in coming to this hotel, deffenatly do. it was spot on. thank you ever so much for a lovely and unforgetable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location punctuated by paper thin walls, dirty linens, and a worn appearance”
Reviews.Author: magic168
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-worn -- everything looks decent at first blush, but look just a little bit closer and you see that everything is old and ratty, the bed linens are (blood?) stained, the mattress squeaks when you move like you see in a bad motel, the bathtub's plastic lining has a giant bubble that you can feel when standing in it to shower. The rooms have paper thin walls -- I could hear the next door room's conversation clearly, especially unpleasant when you're trying to sleep and they come in at 2-3am. You can hear doors slamming at all hours as people come and go, and you get woken up by them because the walls are paper thin. Even the TV looked nice, but again was only a nice facade. The remote barely worked and the reception was wavy and fuzzy. The only saving grace (and this is a big saving grace) is that it is in a great location -- close to Times Square and the subway. I guess it really depends on when you need to stay in NYC and how much you have to pay for these rooms.

Reviews.Title: “It's like family.”
Reviews.Author: alstam
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 9 days with my wife. We left our kids back home so, it was like our second honeymoon. We never missed home because of the employees. Dolores, Mohammad, John, William from russo's are very friendly. Everyday i felt like i was having breakfast with my family. We had 3 nights booking at first, hotel is not in good shape, airconditiner was noisy, room was not that clean. But Mohammad at the front office made us stay 6 more nights at the hotel. He is very professional, very friendly, he moved us to a diffrent room. Everyday he checked with us, gave us tour information. I think just for the employees we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just spoke w/ Sharon - wow!"”
Reviews.Author: lifesabeachct46
Reviews.Content: I just called the hotel with a simple question and ended up speaking to Sharon Silseam. All I can say is, if this hotel is half as nice as the employee, we are in for a delightful trip! I am looking forward to our upcoming stay and will let you all know if it meets our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: DFGP56
Reviews.Content: Nice weekend in NYC, enjoyed the stay at the hotel, especially because of the friendly service provided by Ms Louise Rechlis. Thank you very much for everything!

Reviews.Title: “The Manhattan at Times Square Hotel is fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: MeneDani
Reviews.Content: It has a fantastic location, near a metro station. It has an impeccable room service, we feel safe, as throughout the city as well. Broadway is just around the corner. Easy to catch a taxi. The Manhattan at Times Square Hotel is fabulous. Congratulations Starwood Hotels and Resorts Staff

Reviews.Title: “There are definitely better hotel rooms, but the price is good.”
Reviews.Author: abinney
Reviews.Content: I have spent a lot of time in New York City hotels, ranging from $150-$700 per night for a room. The Manhattan is definitely not the nicest hotel, but it's not the worse either. My boyfriend and I were able to get a good rate ($225/night) the first weekend of December, and we went to do some holiday shopping. It is a great location for tourists and people who want to be in the heart of NYC. We were able to walk everywhere and easily get cabs. The service was good, the front desk people were very friendly as was the doorman who was always very gracious and opened the doors and hailed us cabs. The rooms are small and dated, but ours was always cleaned well. The lobby and fitness room were nice. We only spent time in our room at night to sleep, so the hotel and price served us well. The money we saved allowed us to eat at better restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect, perfect”
Reviews.Author: rmuse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! The location couldn't have been better . . . . walking distance to Central Park, theaters, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, shopping, shopping shopping! . . . and convenient subway stations. The rooms were nice size, bed was very very comfortable, nice bathroom and amenities. But most of all, the staff (front desk, concierge, security, door man, bell hop, cleaning crew) were the most friendly and courteous I've ever encountered. My daughter and I had dreamed about this trip for just the two of us for years . . . and The Manhattan at Times Square helped make it the perfect vacation. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided at all times !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: Need I say more that this was a Sheraton hotel....to be more exact: it is still owned by them but they elected to take the name off because its such a tragic hotel. Now lets be honest, Sheratons are never the best but this is even not worthy of carrying that name. Instead of Sheraton taking off the name they should rather invest money into this property and not just harvest it. The rooms are small and cleaning is virtually non-existent. There is no room service is this 4 star hotel. The only plus is the location. Breakfast is served in the adjoining place called Russo's. The prices are ridiculous. I would never ever come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: yonkersboy
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to New York, I've learned not to expect much from NYC hotels unless you are willing to pay top dollar ($500 and up). The rooms are inevitably cramped and you are likely to get a window facing an air shaft. Still, the Manhattan Times Square was a disappointment. For a recent business trip, I booked this hotel because of the central location (51st street and 7th avenue), and the fact that it was a "preferred" hotel by my company. The lobby is fine, and the reception staff was nice (for New York). I also thought the fitness center exceeded expectations -- good sized pool, and fairly new equipment. But the room was tired and begging for a renovation. The furniture was VERY worn, and there were even exposed screw-holes in the middle of the night table. The room was extremely cramped -- and not in a trendy, well-designed way, like the Philippe Stark hotels. Just cramped. As with many NY hotels, the walls had chipped paint and uneven plaster, and the tile work in the bathroom was dirty and uneven. And the window curtains were ratty. Although the hotel used to be a Sheraton, the bed did not feel like a Sweet Sleeper -- it just felt average. Worst of all was the poor cleaning job. I found stray hairs all around the room, and areas that were obviously not cleaned. This place definitely needs a major upgrade (after which the rooms will be way overpriced!).

Reviews.Title: “TIRED”
Reviews.Author: ianhatesidiots
Reviews.Content: What a let down, lobby looks fine. travelled with Kuoni and have always been looked after in the past. The 21st floor is a building site, drills hammering, banging, room very poor standard, evidence of leaking water marks on ceiling, just very tired and outdated. We only stayed from Sunday lunch to Wednesday morning, we could have complained and ask to be moved, but as with all US hotels they tend to give you the worse room available "WHY" I took the attitude that we will be out most the time, would be a shame to be too cosy, might not go out and sight see, Anyway the place is a dump be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: CWGators
Reviews.Content: A good value for NYC. Nice rooms. We got offered an upgrade. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LeoAb
Reviews.Content: My future wife and I had the best time in New York, but honestly what made it special was our stay the Manhattan Times Square Hotel. Great staff, awesome location and very confortable and spacious room. Mohamed was super nice. One other thing that surprised me was the business center in the Lobby. There were 5 Desktops( free use for the guest). Breakfast at Russo's was also very good. Overall, fantastic hotel and I am 100% sure I will be staying next year at the Manhattan Times Square Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and the room was good too!”
Reviews.Author: meadowlb
Reviews.Content: I rented two rooms for a family vacation and we were very happy with our stay. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We arrived at 8:30 in the morning expecting to check our baggage, but they had rooms available. Both rooms were spacious and had a balcony, but room 503 had an exceptional view of times square and it 's balcony was huge. The hotel lobby is very nice and the elevators were fast. The beds were very comfy! We checked for bed bugs and found none. The only negative I would offer is that the hotel is a little tired in places. I had a great rate which I found through travel zoo, so I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nanci66
Reviews.Content: We had a wondrerful view of the Thanksgiving Parade and the staff was super friendly! They had an indoor pool which my kids was thrilled about. The location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & excellent liocation”
Reviews.Author: PorscheMan65
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and the location of the hotel couldn't be better. The view from the 21th floor was spectacular. The room and bathroom were somewhat small, but overall we were very pleased with our stay at the Manhattan Times Square Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Found enough hair in shower drain to make a wig”
Reviews.Author: NCPETE
Reviews.Content: Booked a King, got a double. Toilet ran all night. One towel was not clean at all. And tub would not drain at all. Filled up and despite pulling a mile of hair from drain still would not drain. Disgusting. Nice manager gave me Sheraton points, but housekeeping there leaves a lot

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay Thanksgiving Day!”
Reviews.Author: maltar
Reviews.Content: Although I am a native New Yorker, I had never seen the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade in person. This year, my sister suggested that we stay a night at a hotel and take my children. We searched for a hotel that would be near or on the parade route and close to Rockerfeller Center. The Manhattan fit the bill. We had a BLAST! The hotel lobby was festive- with holiday decorations- very appealing to little ones and big ones alike! Check in was nice and easy- we did not experience any log waits. The staff greeted each person and upon check- in, gave each child a chocolate turkey- needless to say, the kids were thrilled from the moment we arrived! Our room was great! Spacious and VERY clean. We always check for bed bugs when we travel, so the first thing we did was inspect the mattresses, closet and drawers. They were pristine and we felt as if we could settle in and be comfortable. We were able to get a mini fridge to keep some snacks and drinks for the kids, which was a nice comfort. We had connecting rooms with my sister, which, if you are traveling with little ones is GREAT! ! We were able to put the kids to bed in one room, while the grown ups got to hang out together in the other. We left the door between the rooms ajar to keep an eye on the kids and we did not have to whisper and go to bed too! The staff were all friendly and helpful- we asked for suggestions of places to eat and places to get treats and they knew just where to send us! Their reccommendations were hits with us and the kids (carlos pizza and Magnolia bakery- all within walking distance)! We had no problems, but given the responses we got from helpful staff, I am certain that if we had, they would have addressed any problem graciously and quickly. The location is GREAT! You can easily walk to many, kid friendly places to eat as well as some of New York's most famous attractions. We arrived the night before Thanksgiving, had a great meal (thanks to staff recommendation), took the kids to swim in the pool (it is open until 9:45!) and got them all tired out. The kids really enjoyed the swim at night however, the BEST part, as far as the kids are concerned- is being able to see the parade right from our room! The windows opened and we were on a lower floor- putting the balloons at eye level! We could have chosen to go outside and secure a good spot, since we were right on the route, but there was nothing better than being able to enjoy it with the energy of the other spectators, but in the privacy of our own room(this was the best part as far as the parents are concerned:). We could hear and see everything and when we needed a break or wanted to warm up, we could close the windows and not hear a thing! The hotel provided exactly what we were looking for: a clean, comfortable place to stay with an attentive staff, a good nights sleep, the excitement of Manhattan at Holiday season and a birds- eye view of the parade without the crowd! We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Macy's Day Parade marchs in front of te Manhattan Time Square Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sunrayzsz
Reviews.Content: Other than a lengthy wait for check-in and and check-out, the hotel was tremendous. Security was tight, the staff knowledgable, available, and friendy, the pool was extravagant, and the rooms lovely. I would be delighted to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, perfectly functional, rather expensive”
Reviews.Author: Garyorient
Reviews.Content: Clean and very nice size room for Central NY. Check in speedy and polite, Concierge very pleasant and helpful. Position could not really have been bettered. Not much else to add. Recommended for a short stay, but anything longer than two or threee nights and you might want to cxonsider a hotel with more facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great time , amazing service!!”
Reviews.Author: jfeer324
Reviews.Content: Hotel provided great service and was exceptionally clean. The Front desk from the time I walked in was extremely helpful. Louise gave us great ideas and was amazingly helpful. Thank you. In the middle of times square . So much fun! I recomend this location to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Parade View Room for Thanksgiving Parade $$$$$$$$$$”
Reviews.Author: Momofonetwothree
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel previously for the Thanksgiving Day Parade view room. It is definately not cheap and had some issues this stay. First, checked for bed bugs in all the spots they would be and found none or any indication of any, which I was happy about. The bad thing was for the extemely high price that we paid for the parade view room our toilet ran alllllllll night long. We called and maintenance was sent right away and claimed to have fixed it until someone flushed and that was it. What was also bad was all ice machines on our floor had no ice, which was bad considering we didn't have a refrigerator and needed to keep medicine cold. BUT most of all I could not believe how nice, sincere and accomodating the manager that was on duty was that day. Not only was she dealing with her share of questions, complaints and just being bombarded with the Thanksgiving Day Parade rush she was just so nice, and listened and did everything to rectifiy the problem. The parking is annoying have to pay for it especially when paying so much and not having it included. I mean would I come again next year, more than likely yes, and that was due to how accomodating and sincere the manager was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice vacation.”
Reviews.Author: bdamodaran
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my family. Room was small specially bathroom was really small but beds are very comfortable. We found Mohammad at the reception, he was very friendly and helped us find new york attractions, restaurant and subway. It is shopping season now in new york, Mohammad even printed some online coupon to get better discount at macys. We had a great experience in new york.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Times Square. Accomodating Staff. Noisey and Outdated Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: IslandHopperDiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at The Manhattan at Times Square hotel. He was there for a conference and I decided to spend a couple days in the big apple to sightsee and visit family in the area. My husband and I travel a lot for work and have a considerable amount of hotel points with all of the major chains. Starwoods is no exception. We arrived late on Friday evening and were assured that we'd recieve an upgraded room. As we arrived to this room, we quickly discovered that it was OCCUPIED! The bell captain 'tried' to find a better location to make-up for their mistake. Unfortunately, the next best available room was next to the maid's station. Needless to say, we were awake the entire night! The next night, we recieved a much larger corner room and thought we'd be able to enjoy a quieter location. This was not the case. We could hear the guests next to us talking to one another the entire night. For leisure, it's extremely convenient to Broadway and Times Square (and the subways only a couple steps away if you're looking to go elsewhere in the city). Overall, the place was clean and the staff was extremely friendly, but if you are traveling for business, I do not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but hotel looks tired”
Reviews.Author: traveler9904
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviewers here, I found the front desk to be very helpful. There was a booking error in the reservation, and they straightened it out with no hassle. The location is fantastic - you are in the middle of the theater district and within reasonable distance of all the usual tourist stuff that one would want to do. The hotel, however, looks a bit tired. Our bed skirts were slightly stained, and the sheets didn't have that usual crisp white look I usually expect when I walk into a Starwood property. But there were no bedbugs as far as I could tell! Bathroom is small and needs updating. The room was a decent size, by Manhattan standards. My kids used the pool, which they found to be okay. We paid about $250/ night (AAA rate) and it was the Thanksgiving weekend. I wouldn't pay much more than this given the hotel's condition. And the location is the only reason that I would even pay $250.

Reviews.Title: “Could do with some TLC”
Reviews.Author: jjaffers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November. Staff at Reception were very nice and helpful.I had a Bedroom which was on the Corner so it was a Bit bigger. it was very clean ..the bathroom was small but it was adequate ..also very clean .Bed was comfortable ..NO BED BUGS... pure white sheets..everything was change every day...There was a Restaurant in the Hotel ..but it was open only for Breakfast... it would have been nice if it was open in the Evening time so if you did not want to go out ..you could have got a meal in the Hotel..Staff in the Restaurant were very nice especiall y Delores (I think that was here name) she was so helpful ..very polite and always friendly.. The only criticism I have it would have been nice to have a Bar and Lounge where perhaps you could have sat to read the Papers or where you could have a drink before hyou go out in the evening..Jill

Reviews.Title: “MOLD”
Reviews.Author: lakesidejimmy
Reviews.Content: The room had mold, contacted the GM and they did nothing, so I took photos, see below, don't stay at any cost.

Reviews.Title: “Do not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: albany_trav123
Reviews.Content: This place is far from 3 stars! Very run down and dated. The srevice at the front desk and baggage was not very customer focused. The parking garage is not affiliated with the hotel and is very expensive and difficult to work with. The bathroom was disgusting. for over $400/night (with parking) WHAT A RIP OFF!!! Do not make the same mistake that we did!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great beds”
Reviews.Author: AnaBap
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights and was perfect! Of course you can get better but not for that price. The beds were very, very comfortable and location.... 2min-walk from time square! Just in the middle of everything. We always felt safe walking around, even at night. And it has interior pool..we didnÂ´t use it... it was better to walk around the city. Just ask not to stay near the elevator, because it can disturb your sleep (my husband complained, I didnÂ´t hear a thing, slept like a rock!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: attravelsodus
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and just stayed at the Manhattan at Time Square for the 2nd time with a group. Both experiences were very positive and plan to continue using this property. The rooms are larger (for NY standards) and very clean. We checked for bed bugs and were pleased that we didn't find any. The hotel staff is friendly and very accommodating. This hotel is a good value for the location and quality of the hotel. Can't wait to return to the Manhattan at Time Square!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice view, but nothing fancy.”
Reviews.Author: Wsawyer
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel was nice. I had a corner room, so it was a bit bigger than the average room. Housekeeping wad nice. The room was clean and bed was comfy. Overall, the hotel wasn't new and trendy, but it wasn't bad either. It is right near Times Square, so for a tourist, the location is great, but you are paying for it! No wireless Internet and Internet access is $20 per day. Overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good experience to be at your hotel and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Schorndorf
Reviews.Content: Mr. John Cassidy and Mr. William ? at the hotel's restaurant were very informative and helpful in making us enjoy the typical American breakfast. The atmosphere was warm and we were happy to get not only good service but also some information about American Life (in short discussions off rush-hours). Elfriede and Tanja, Please convey our best regards to these gentlemen.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute last time I stay at The Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: lebowski76
Reviews.Content: Below is my current experience as a Platinum member of Starwood Properties, your results will probably be worse. I had booked both The Manhattan and Sheraton Towers across the street. Well, my last stay at The Manhattan was horrible (room falling apart, busted tv, lukewarm water) and go zero response to my email following up my stay. Since the Towers isn't participating in the 2x/3x points per stay, I decided to give Manhattan another chance for my current stay. Huge mistake. Upon check in, I asked about a Platinum upgrade - no suites, but "upgraded" to a higher floor King bed. (just to throw this in my buddy gets top floor and is gold). Get to the room - it's beside the maid room & service elevator. This is even worse than beside the elevator because every 5 minutes someone is dumping stuff in the room. So I call down to the front desk to switch - "come down and we'll change your room." What kind of customer service is that? Every time I've had to switch rooms (This would be the 3rd time: once for a busted AC, once for busted outlets) it's "oh, i'm so sorry sir, let me find a new room and send someone up with the keys." Fine, I've got 10 minutes to kill before I have a meeting so I go downstairs. SPG line? Nope, just one line to filter everyone, which it was 6 deep (and only 2 CSR's working). Get the new room (now double beds) on a lower floor. Well, I don't know what decade Manhattan was last updated, but my bathroom tile is pink. In all, the room isn't bad, except there are no outlets near the desk. Most have the outlets in the lamp which gives you one for computer and one for the phone. I have to pull the desk out, and start unplugging things to get my computer hooked up. Below you can see the vent in my bathroom - it's a solid 1/2 inch of dust/dirt balls all over, no way it has been cleaned this year. I've attached a picture. Is this place just a stepchild of SPG? Do they not care at all about customers, or loyal SPG customers at that? I want to cancel and go to the Sheraton or Westin TS but don't want to get hit with a cancellation fee. It is sad when I've been treated like royalty at the so called "lesser" SPG properties like four points or aloft. PS - they serve Maxwell House and have some off-brand bathroom soaps that look like stage props from Designing Women.

Reviews.Title: “Its not the Sheraton but would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: daisy304
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at The Manhattan at Times Square and although it no longer carries the Sheraton name it is still fine for the value. Great Location and the front desk was very pleasant and quick upon check in. Elevators are a bit tired and the first one we went in didn't work so we got out and went into another. We had a room with a king size bed which was very comfortable. Did the whole bed bug check just in case and didn't find any. The room was very clean and comfortable although the bathroom was small and could use updating. Hallways also old and in need of updating. Overall great location, comfortable bed and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: mllikestotravel
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Manhattan are top notch... always available to assist when needed... and Elliott and Louise went beyond the call of duty as was demonstated on my last business trip.... I have had the opportunity to stay at the Manhattan several time and the staff always make me feel like it is my home away from home with their friendship and high level of customer service..... Thanks also to Jack, Theo and the guys at the concierges desk Marguerite

Reviews.Title: “The best location to stay when exploring New York.”
Reviews.Author: awaygirl-10
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was brilliant. The staff were friendly and helpful especially Mohammad at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: roebean
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice. The hotel room is clean, there's free wi-fi in the lobby, and is close to restaurants. Margaret Asante was the associate on our floor and she was very sweet and courteous. I also accidentally left my bag in the lobby and the front desk was SO helpful and contacted me immediately. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly front desk, but hotel needs work”
Reviews.Author: EDS070
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m a regular visitor to NYC for business and a regular customer of this hotel. Out from the numerous hotels that Iâ€™ve stayed at in NYC for the past 5 years, this hotel has one of the most amicable staff. I want to especially commend Josephine Walker for her helpfulness and friendliness from the first time that she helped me in checking in. It is so comforting after a 6 hour flight to know that she will do what she can to make my 5 day stay a pleasant one. She, along with the rest of the smiling staff, is one of the primary reasons that I keep coming back. However, this property is rather run down and poorly maintained. I would say that 80% of my stays share the following issues: The fluorescent lights flicker from age (it is especially problematic because I have migraines, so I just minimize turning them on); The sinks and showers are plugged up; The heater and air conditioner works poorly. And to top it off, the gym has a bad smells. On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location and the rooms are surprisingly quiet given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Special Employees mean Special Service”
Reviews.Author: shinbal
Reviews.Content: I happened to arrive in the city much earlier than I expected. Trying to reach the front desk at this hotel during busy morning checkout proved futile. So, I asked to speak to a manager's office. The operator put me through to the GM's office, and her assistant, Lauren, answered the phone. When I explained my situation, Lauren went right to work on my behalf. Instead of saying, "sorry, you'll have to talk to the front desk", Lauren took my number and promised a call back with information. True to her word, she called me 10 minutes later with the news that she was able to accommodate my request. WOW! It was not her responsibility to do this. Not at all! But, she made me feel like an important customer by going an extra step for me. My check in was flawless and the hotel generously granted me a very early room assignment. This goes a long way with me after several days of exhausting business travel. When I got to the room, Lauren had placed a note there thanking me for my business, and asking me to call with any questions. I called her boss and left a message about her assistant's work. Hopefully this lady doesn't spend her career hidden from customers, who need exposure to people like this in the hotel industry. The hotel is undergoing a number of transitions. There's no room service, but to be truthful - if you're in the busiest section of one of the greatest, biggest cities on earth and you're ordering room service, GET A LIFE! There are plenty of options, even next door, to bring stuff back to your room,, but the hotel's location puts it smack in the middle of the theater district with restaurants aplenty. A quick subway ride will take you to non-touristy places to eat; and several lines of the subway are a couple minutes walk from the hotel. Carnegie Hall (and the Carnegie Deli!) are right up the street. Front desk personnel are multi-cultural and could be difficult to understand. Their message got through though, with a smile, and a THANK YOU for my business. It's so simple, but very rare these days. My room was a nice-sized King on a comfortable bed, with nice bath amenities. Wired internet (no in-room wireless!) was a downer, but worked fine. I don't normally like to stay in Times Square on business, but this hotel is so easy for me for everywhere I'm going. It's greatly improved in the last two years, and will be undergoing an even bigger renovation at some point. I applaud the management of this hotel for setting a tone of quality service and reasonable price for the area.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - this hotel is worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Koho26
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location near Times Square, decent rooms, and no bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: Docrtu
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days with three different friends. Louise at the Front Desk was extremely helpful. The rest of the staff was very helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: goldenpc
Reviews.Content: All of the staff at this hotel were Friendly and helpful, but xiomara in the room and Mohammad at the reception stood out in particular.Room was lovely, clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “ideal”
Reviews.Author: ayoussef
Reviews.Content: the hotel was a great stay... ideal location and ideal service. Enisa Radhci was a wonderful and helpful associate and it was a real joy dealing with her. would definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: steve100758
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice place to stay...location is great, pool is nice plus...staff is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but this is what your paying for”
Reviews.Author: ELVISROCKS
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is excellent, you just step out and turn right and your dazzled by Times Square, turn left and your at Central Park. The hotel rooms desperately need a revamp but i must say, the beds were extremely comfortable (I thinks they might be new) and a great sized wide screen tv. Overall, it didnt bother us as we were out most of the time and only used the room to get some sleep (also we won this trip so we didnt pay) The rooms have a coffee machine (not a kettle), hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner, body cream, etc and plenty of hot water. No fridge :( You are paying for the location of this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Always at the Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: khan77
Reviews.Content: Whenever i come to New York i always stay at this hotel. Good location, very clean room, rate is good for the location. And this time i came to new york after almost 2 years and i am really happy to see Mohammed at the reception, he always takes care of me. This is my only choice in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and relaxed, both the pool and the beakfast worked well, and the location is close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: mccourtbm
Reviews.Content: Server Mohammed Chowdhuny provided top srvice at your restaurant and enhanced our stay. All needs were handled quickly by a pleasant staff. The front desk, check in, the restaurant, the pool, the fitness area, all done with top service. We have visited this hotel about five different times and find great location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are just too small”
Reviews.Author: Razorgirl1970
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through priceline.com which stated that I would be in a double bed or single bed depending on the hotel. Once arriving to the hotel, the desk clerk said that PRICELINE put me in a single bed. Some one isnt truthful here. I didnt make a big stink because i was there for my daughters 20th birthday, we are the same sex, so no big deal. The size of the room is great for just two ppl. I did meet a mom on the elevator with two kids, and she said her room was just too small as well. If I had a choice of choosing my own hotel and not priceline choosing it for me, I would not recommend only because of the size of the rooms. The staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Typical small NYC hotel that needs a good refurbish but location is the best! (travel agent review)”
Reviews.Author: Jooolz1976
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Manhattan At Times Square Sept 15 -17th/2010 The location can't be beat! It's right in Times Square and near tons of theaters. It's only a block away from the Ed Sullivan Theater if you're a David Letterman fan! The service at this hotel was very good - especially the restaurant staff at breakfast ! Really nice and funny! The food was great too! Thanks again :) The concierge made dinner reservations for us which was really nice of him to do for us - and unexpected! Little service details like that go a long way! The hotel itself is your typical NYC one - small rooms and older. I knew before getting there that the rooms would be small and I was right - quite tiny actually. The bathroom was tiny too. However, the beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet for the most part except for some noisy chatty neighbors and we rarely heard street noise so that was good. The room was clean but definitely needs a refurbish , especially the paint and wallpaper. Scuffed edges, part of the drywall falling apart in the bathroom, etc. It didn't ruin our trip or anything. We still had a great time! I did get a chance to use their pool which was perfect! Nice sized clean swimming pool with a neat view of Times Square. The sauna was clean and comfortable too ! I highly recommend going in for a dip, especially after a long day of walking and sightseeing! If you aren't fussy with how luxurious a hotel has to be and you are all about location and good service then I recommend this hotel! If you have any questions you can ask me directly. Thank you for reading this :) Julienne

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it was last time... or the time before that...”
Reviews.Author: UcanGOyourownWay
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 3 out of the last 4 times I have been to NYC within the last 5 years. Great Location- within walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, Broadway, 5th Avenue, etc. Good price- if you call and talk to them about their latest promotions, etc., you are able to negotiate a better rate than that posted on the internet... The outside has gotten a face lift, the inside is in desperate need of one... the lobby is nice, free internet is a bonus, the restaurant that is in the hotel isn't open in the evenings... and the rooms need some TLC. When we arrived, the reception staff seemed disorganized and confused... told me my room was pre-paid, then said it wasn't and that we'd be able to split the rooms on a couple of credit cards per room (there was 8 of us in 2 rooms for 4 nights). When checking out was told it was pre-paid... Bottom line is, it didn't matter whether it was pre-paid or not, I just wanted to know. There is outside noise, taxi's honking their horns, traffic, etc... but you're in NY, it's almost part of the experience. Tip: Ask to be in a higher floor- with Sheraton Hotels, the higher the floor, the nicer the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: diamondsnowball
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room here because this hotel is now a Starwood property and I expected Starwood quality. Well, it is nothing like a Starwood hotel. Upon check-in, the first thing I noticed was the dingy, small lobby. It was crowded with a lot of children. It felt like a 2* instead of a 4* property and I began to wonder what the room would look like. The room was so bad that I immediately called Starwood and asked to be transferred to a different hotel. The bathroom was tiny and dirty with a leaky bathtub faucet. The furniture was dark and tattered and the beds were not even close to heavenly beds. I thought I was in a bad motel and knew that I would not be able to relax in this room. The good news is that the manager was quick to cancel my reservation and allow me to move to another starwood hotel. I had no problems with the service at this hotel. The location is also good if you're looking for a times square hotel, but the value is not good at all. When I booked, the room was close to $400 a night and I don't think it was worth a penny more than $200. I wouldn't even stay there for $100 a night. There are lots of hotels in NYC. Stay somewhere else!! There is no good reason to pick this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kjnlady
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in this hotel 10/5-10/10/10. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to New York, and would suggest this hotel to anyone visiting Manhattan. The location is perfect...within walking distance to everything. The hotel staff was very helpful too. The only problem we encountered was that the air conditioning in our room did not work properly. In fact, we were told upon arrival that the air chillers were turned off because of the cold weather, but they were turned back on during the week because the weather turned warmer. Our room never cooled off properly, but we opened the window and made the best of the situation. We would most likely stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: subchat
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as a part of a group during our visit to USA and Canada during June 2010. The Hotel was booked by our tour operator so no idea about the price. We were pleasantly surprised by the rooms which were fairly well appointed and small but adequate bathroom. Tea and Coffee making facilities in the room was a welcome bonus. The great thing about the hotel is the location. Walking distance from almost all major attractions in Manhattan. Central Park, Broadway, Times Square, Rockfeller Centre, Macy's(about 15 minutes). Shops and eating joints all within one or two blocks. There is one deli which is about 2 mins. walk (go out of the entrance,turn left and then again left and it is on the right corner of the next block) where we had wonderful breakfast buffet. I forget the name but it fab. breakfast at very reasonable prices.The hotel does not have a restaurant and bar but everything is available around the corner and hence not a problem. Stay in this place to witness the magnificence and pulse of Times Square and walk around to see all the landmarks of Manhattan without spending a dime. At night you can come back to a comfortable bed, Nothing fancy but adequate

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: NYflyer036
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty nice for the price. However, the staff was very attentive to our needs. In particular, one staff person, Josephina DeLuna was particulary helpful. Great hotel and I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could use an update”
Reviews.Author: sjrrmr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2010 and didn't have any real complaints about the place other than it could use some updated furnishings and some paint. The location is hard to beat but don't expect any good city views from your window.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel going downhill”
Reviews.Author: Travellingfools49
Reviews.Content: We have visited this hotel annually and always been pleased with the price/quality quotient. This year, at $420 (including services and taxes) a night (Columbus Day/Canadian Thanksgiving weekend) we are beginning to be disappointed. For starters, one of the top sheets had a six inch tear near the top. The chairs in the room were like garage day sale throw-offs. The bedding was comfortable and clean, but the bed wasn't super firm. The A/C fan could NOT be turned off. I ended up covering it with my daughter's water shoes and a towel, and I used it to dry their bathing suits as well. I took a bath and noticed mold at the joins of the shower wall/tub. Some of the fixtures, tub and bathroom sink were loose or broken off. The shower curtain was brand new. The TV was large and worked well. There was no book of services that we could find, and room service is no longer offered at this hotel. The toilet is very quiet when flushed. The curtains block the morning light really well, easy to sleep in! I like that in a hotel. We were located near the elevator but noise wasn't an issue. The maid service was excellent, the room was made up nicely every day and soaps and towels replenished daily. The safe was big enough to accommodate my 17" Laptop, I liked that a lot too. The check-in was courteous and prompt. The Bellhop was efficient and nice. The parking was $40/night, standard for NYC. The hotel is run down and needs to be renovated before we return!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable clean room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: patski42
Reviews.Content: Our room was a pleasant surprise upon arrival. A very nice, what looked to be a recently renovated, clean and comfortable room. Cleaned promptly every morning by Enisa. Loved the location. Our first trip to New York. A fabulous place to visit. We would stay at the Manhattan again.

Reviews.Title: “poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: bertieboy44
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 nights, 6 too long, booked 8 months in advance and had the perfect room facing a brick wall right next to the lift shaft, the lady in the next room was clearly enjoying her break as she was shouting at the top of her voice at 7 am every morning, would not recommend a quiet break at this hotel, had far better hotels for far less in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Total Package Was Great”
Reviews.Author: A_White_wi_Jaunty
Reviews.Content: Everything was handled smoothly and pleasantly during our stay. The rooms were well cleaned daily and the beds so comfortable. On the day we arrived back at our hotel while the staff was cleaning, Enisa Radoneic, our room attendant, very diplomatically checked that our key card matched the room. She was not about to let just anyone into the room without proper verification and that security and her good nature was much appreciated. (I was so impressed that I asked for her name, but may not have spelt it correctly.) The location on Times Square can't be beat. Being with a tour group the value was exceptional. I hope to return in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: ehc
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with the choice of this hotel. All of the employees went out of the way to make our stay successful. The room was clean and plenty big enough for 3. The beds were comfortable and the water was hot. There are stores and restaurants nearby and the hotel is close enough to walk to Central Park, Times Square and Rockefeller Center. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay again at the Manhatten At Times Square”
Reviews.Author: jerryhottawa
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent. Super service and great service people- Louise, Jack, John, Daliya (Dolly) and all the other people that work at the hotel.The restaurant for breakfast is excellent. Can't wait to stay there again. They make you feel so good. They are the best and the hotel is very good also. Can't say enough about our stay with them. Would recommend this to all. Thank you Louise. Marguerite and Jerry

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in New York City.”
Reviews.Author: RWGARLOCK
Reviews.Content: This has been our favorite hotel for several years. We found the staff at this hotel to be the most friendly and makes our visits a joy. We have become friends with many of the staff and they make us feel welcome. The rates are reasonable and the location is one of the best for the activities in the city. We highly recommend for people to try this hotel and feel they would be satisfied as we have been. From the doorman Jack, to the front desk people, in-particular Mohammad Abdullah and his colleagues, you will be made most welcome. My wife and I have never been disappointed. Richard Garlock

Reviews.Title: “If you will only be in your room to sleep, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Mom23inOR
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel with a fabulous location. We were only in our room to basically sleep and it was adequate for that. A thorough check for bedbugs showed many signs of recent treatment (including all new baseboards and lots of a light pinkish powder on the mattresses and box springs which looked very new and were NOT encased) but I saw no signs of active bedbugs, which has been a problem at this hotel (see bedbugregistry.com). We were on the 10th floor and street noise wasn't too bad, or maybe we were just so tired from walking all day we slept too hard to notice. The rooms are small and furnishings are outdated but we spent so little time there I didn't care. The linens were all white and looked very new (their bed bug contractor must be a good one) and the beds were comfortable. The lobby is nice but halls are dark and dated like the rooms. We did not use the pool or even see it. Staff was very slow at check in. It was about midnight when I checked in and despite several staff around, one was working at the desk. She took a long time with the one other person in the room and then was very slow to check me in. I had called earlier in the day to both let them know I'd be arriving very late and also that I would be checking for bedbugs upon arrival and to please place me and my children in a room that had been inspected and cleared, as I would be camping in their lobby at 3am if there was a problem. I was assured that they had not had any problems recently (not according to the registry!) but would make sure I was placed in an inspected room. Perhaps that is why it took so long to get me into a room? I am not sure. The girl checking me in stared at the computer for so long I thought for a few minutes they did not have a room for me or something. My only other interaction with staff was with a housekeeper upon arriving back at about 10pm. I had deferred housekeeping service but needed more towels and cups and requested them from her and she was pleasant and prompt. Overall, the best thing about this hotel is the location. It's a pretty affordable hotel for NYC and so many things are within walking distance that it makes it a great place to stay if you don't care if it's not posh and you do a thorough check for bed bugs--which you should do in ANY hotel, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally clean”
Reviews.Author: Ivytrav
Reviews.Content: I was wary of the bed bug reports that seem to be everywhere in NYC recently. So naturally I was lifting mattresses, checking every corner possible, etc. My room was very, very clean, even the bathroom. Absolutely spotless and I am very picky about hotel room cleanliness. Yes, it is a bit smaller but for the amount of time spent in the room, who cares. The location is perfect. I was able to go out and explore, yet come back to rest, clean up, etc.. as needed and head back out. Every staff member I came in contact with was very polite and helpful as well. The downfall, as mentioned in previous reviews, the noise level that transmits through the walls. I was around the corner from the elevators and could still hear them, although it wasn't too loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, bit dated”
Reviews.Author: AlixC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is generally pretty good. The location is excellent, about 2 minute walk to times square and very close to many of the main attractions e.g. Broadway, Empire State Building, Radio City etc. The room we had was a really good size although the bathroom was a little small. The hotel generally could do with being updated. Everything was clean, and the bed was really comfy, but it does look a bit tired. We didn't use the pool or the restaurant so can't comment on that. The staff were OK, check in staff friendly but found some others to be a little rude. I would definetly recommend this hotel to others, primarily due to location.

Reviews.Title: “The room had nasty carpet but the service in the restaurant was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mel30324
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location. They don't have room service, but they do have a restaurant on site for b'fast only. There are two servers, John Williams and Camilla that are Phenomenal!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They are the nicest, most professional folks with a great sense of urgency! They are true examples of "Five Star Treatment". My hotel room had dirty carpet (bunch of black smudges), walls were dirty, tub didn't drain well and had to ask twice to have it "unplugged", but sheets and towels were clean and tidy -

Reviews.Title: “Not very nice!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenluvsTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an AMAZING location! The rooms are super tiny and dark. The hallways are dark and gloomy also! Great location, and close to subways. The girls at the front desk are very sweet, but I would only stay here if you are traveling on a budget....not luxiourious in any way. VERY COMFY BEDS!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic vacation, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: arahman66
Reviews.Content: I found the great deal online and i found the bad reviews after i booked but we had very nice vacation. Clean room, comfortable bed , clean washroom, wonderful staff and the location. Mohammad Abdulla made our stay even better with 2 rooms together with nice view. We will come back to the Manhattan hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, Not too Bad!”
Reviews.Author: krzastrm
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel though Priceline "Name Your Own Price", and after reading some reviews, I was skeptical. Fortunately, my fears were unfounded. Yes, the hotel could use some upgrading and the rooms were a little dated and showed some wear and were small, but keep in mind, this is a 3* hotel Times Square so what else would you expect, Ifthose things bother you that much, the you spending way too much time in your hotel room. Go explore! This hotel served its purpose, the location is INCREDIBLE (we really enjoyed morning runs though central park), within walking distance to broadway shows, 5th ave shopping, central park, the rock and much more...Most imortantly, the rooms were clean. The staff was very helpful and accomodating, also of note, they do have a safe area to store your bags on your last day if you want to explore before heading to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket!!”
Reviews.Author: KateBulmer
Reviews.Content: Quite tired accom but clean and very comfy bed!!! Decor quite dated and bathroom a little on the small size. But bang in the centre for everything!!!! Would definitely go again xx

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: sk1996
Reviews.Content: First, I have to mention Louise at the front desk. After receiving a very small 1 queen room instead of a king (I arrived prior to check in and didn't know the 1 queen rooms are much smaller than the 1 king), I went back down to the front desk to see what else they had available. Louise was super helpful and gave me a beautiful room on the 10th floor. I had seen her name in the Trip Advisor reviews before arriving at the hotel...all the other travelers are right. She is amazing. She even called me 15 minutes later to see if I was happy with my room. The hotel itself isn't extravagant or brand new. But I've stayed there several times because the beds are super comfy, the room was clean, quiet and a very nice size and the location can't be beat. With their excellent service, I'll definitely keep coming back. The staff seems like they are happy to see you every time you need something or even just walk by them. I'd recommend Avenue Q if you haven't already seen it. The Fantastiks was okay, but was a very small production...it wasn't what I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “The service an attention to our group was wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: cross_crew
Reviews.Content: Louise was so helpful for our group. She went out of her way to get us in a room early because we arrived so early in the day. We had 4 rooms booked and we were able to get two rooms and leave luggage so we could go sightseeing!!! THANK YOU!!!! Everyone from the hotel was friendly and nice from the doorman when we arrived to the housekeeping staff to the front desk to the secuity. Thank you for making our trip one that we would like to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “very middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: captain_oats21
Reviews.Content: I wasnt sure what to expect about this hotel because lets face it some hotels in Manhattan can leave a lot to be desired. The location of this hotel is fantastic. You really are just 3 blocks away from times square and almost everything we went to was within walking distance. There were no problems at check in and we were very quickly shown up to our room. I think we were one of the lucky ones because we ended up with a balcony room which was a nice bonus. The room was very small could really only take the king size bed. I'd hate to think what it would have been like with 2 beds. The bathroom was average and clean which was really all we were looking for. The real downer from this stay though was the attitude of the concierge on leaving. As we left the building and the bellboy took the cases outside the concierge made some throw away comment to the girl at the reception about us. Something along the lines of "the pleasure was all yours". Not exactly the kind of lasting impression you want made on your guests as they leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Erin033
Reviews.Content: Cannot praise this hotel enough! Fabulous location, steps from shows and restaurants. Extremely comfortable beds, very clean room. Staff was amazing, especially Louise Rechlis at the front desk; she really went out of her way to ensure that we always had everything we needed. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the 'bad' reviews, this is a great hotel to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: pinksqb
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews but after booking this hotel again for next year and reading all these bad reviews on Tripadvisor I felt compelled to write one about the Manhattan at Times Square Hotel. I've stayed at this hotel several times and had a great experience every time, from the lovely rooms to the fantastic front desk staff. Helpful, friendly and always smiling. It goes without saying that the location is fantastic and definitely the place to stay. I even got a free room upgrade for asking nicely! I've stayed in 4 stars in NY that haven't been as nice as this hotel. For a 3 star the standard is excellent. Don't be put off by the negative reviews. This is a great place to stay, good value, nice clean rooms and a lovely swimming pool to relax in at the end of a long day trekking around Manhattan! As for the bed bugs, please! Bed bugs are everywhere and you've obviously been living under a rock if you haven't heard of the problem in NY at the moment. It even made the news in the UK! I've stayed at some fantastic hotels in the past that had apparently had 'bed bug' problems and I never had any issues whilst there. Think that might have been a stroke of bad luck wouldn't you say?!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only thing this hotel has going for it.”
Reviews.Author: Rombutan
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because I thought it would be convenient for our stay but when priceline said it was a 3 star hotel and it was $300 a night I thought it must be nice. I was wrong; it was dirty, it needed repairs, it was outdated, no one was at the counter to answer questions and when someone was there the recommendations they gave were way off. I was so disappointed in this hotel. I am sure they do a lot of business because of their location but I would recommend you pick something not in Time Square and get a nicer place to stay for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: cyrusg
Reviews.Content: Louise Rechlis has to be the best reservation agent ever. Always smiling and ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Vincent123123
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not live up to our expectations. The whole hotel has an 80's - style look and has not been renovated for quite a long time. As a result, the rooms are quite outdated and not clean (wallpaper coming off, mold in the bathroom). People were nice, except for the annoying concierge which made us call the taxi company ourselves. Any hotel which charges $300 a night should help its customers getting transport to the airport. The free WIFI in the lobby was nice but there are only 5 PC's for everyone. The biggest pro to this hotel is its location, in the middle of the Theatre District and in walking distance from Times Square, Rockefeller Center, the MOMA, and Central Park. Considering everything, I would however not recommend this hotel. Try to look for a hotel which offers better price/quality.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS - REALLY BAD BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: wcoyle5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and after the first night my wife had about 40 bites on her arm. I told the hotel and asked for the hotel doc who said to apply a cream and take benadryl. The next day, double the bites. We still didn't see the bugs, but her arm was so red & swollen and blistered over up and down that we insisted on the doc coming to give her a shot. We spent the 3rd morning searching and finally found about 20 bed bugs. We switched rooms. The doctor's treatment wasn't enough so we called our doc at home and started new prescriptions once home. Now we're home and I'm covered in bed bud bites. Just goes to show that even really expensive hotels can and do get infested.

Reviews.Title: “Not Clean”
Reviews.Author: pw9999
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good; just eight blocks from Times Square. The lobby is nice, but that's about it. The hallways and rooms are old and need cleaning and/or remodeling. Our room and bathroom were small. The room did not feel clean, and the bathroom wasn't clean (especially the sink and tub, which had mold). The TV had poor reception.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable and Friendly ; Central”
Reviews.Author: Dermot02
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and helpful. Special mention to John Williams who went out of his way to be of assistance.

Reviews.Title: “I m picky...Its not bad”
Reviews.Author: travel4free
Reviews.Content: The location is the best thing about the hotel. I also like the fact that they had a 24 hour concierge and free internet. The rooms are rather small and the lobby does not have a seating/waiting area. We purchased a 7 day metro card and took the subway everywhere. We went to the Carnagie Deli for breakfast and Becco for dinner. Both are within walking distance from the hotel. I found the bars expensive around Times Square so we went down to Becker St in Soho. Great energy. You can walk or subway right from this hotel. I wouldnt pay $300 for this room...$150 would be the max...if I could get it for thisrate I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome location to stay.....”
Reviews.Author: smurfy2010
Reviews.Content: First id like to say that the location of this hotel is awsome. I live in new york and invited my friends to come visit me. I booked the room through priceline because it was affordable. We were 4 in the room, it was a little tight but Mohamed at the front desk offered us an extra bed for free, which really helped us. We weren't expecting a pool so, that was good surprise. Overall we are really satisfied with the service and cleanliness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location & service”
Reviews.Author: luv t
Reviews.Content: I visited NYC and stayed at the Manhattan at Times Square. I have stayed here numerous times for business. This time I was visiting Manhattan for my girlfriend's 60th BD for 7 days. I always enjoy staying here because of the location but mainly because of the amazing service. Louise made our stay extremely enjoyable, taking good care of us. She recommended new places to visit that I would not have gone when on business. The staff were all very helpful & friendly. My girlfriend & I would recommend staying at your hotel because of the customer service. Thank you for making our stay worry free.

Reviews.Title: “Great People”
Reviews.Author: tballerdave
Reviews.Content: Do stay here it is a great hotel in a great location walking distance to Time Square and Central Park. Friendly Service and very good staff. The Resturant located in the lobby is a very good place for breakfast we travel with children and they enjoyed every minute of their stay the personal in the resturant are very knowegeable about the city we had two wonderful staff people a young man by the name of John Williams Bus Attendant and a lady which name i dont remember but she was a joy also thank you for making our stay a very enjoyable one for Me and my Family. Looking forward to the next time we vacation in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Small and dirty rooms, but great location. DO NOT pay full price.”
Reviews.Author: mgo_travel155019
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Manhattan at Times Square Hotel the past 4 days and walked away disappointed. Was very excited to stay there based on the professionalism and appearance of the website, but was upset when the hotel did not live up to expectations. I'm not normally a complainer however this experience changes that... The price per room can surpass $300 per night (with taxes), which is 80% due to location. â€¢ The room itself is among the top three smallest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in (quite the surprise as we walked in). â€¢ The bed offered subpar comfort. (For two nights of my stay ($600) they could afford to buy comfortable mattresses. Don't expect a soft and comfortable sleep) â€¢ The room's carpet was filthy (trampled with dirt) and there was an excessive amount of dirt, dust, and cobwebs behind the dresser (which was away from the wall about 5 to 6 inches. Now, I'm aware dirt/dust behind the dresser won't really affect me personally, but just the idea that no cleaning has taken place back there for a long time grosses me out, especially when you're paying $300+ a night) â€¢ There's free Wi-Fi in the lobby, but only 5 computers to service the entire hotel. There was ALWAYS a line of guests waiting. ALWAYS. If you have to check your mail, buy tickets, or find directions expect to wait! â€¢ The vending machine on our floor ate 4 to 5 dollars of our money of the four days â€¢ The customer service there was average, nothing to rave about or complain about Overall, the hotel is not worth paying full price. If you can get it on Priceline or another low cost booking site do so. Location is great, the hotel is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Bathrooms Dirty”
Reviews.Author: jmtm13
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at Starwood Hotels, so I made a point to find a hotel on their website. Made my reservation almost 2 months in advance after watching the rates climb higher & higher. A month before we left I checked my confirmation number and rates, only to find the going rate was over 100.00 less than what I paid. Called to inquire and I had made a â€œno cancel or changeâ€� reservation. Lesson learned! Swallowed the loss and decided to try to arrive late Friday night, instead of Sat. afternoon, as after looking on the internet I was sure I could get Friday night at the lower price. Using my confirmation number to add the extra day I was told there would be a fee to change, even to add. I could make a separate reservation, separate confirmation number but there would be a chance Iâ€™d have to change rooms and I was quoted over the phone 75.00 more than the internet price and Priceline price. As a matter of principal at this point, we decided to drive as far as New Jersey and drive into NY the next morning. Parking was right at the hotel. Lobby was nice. Check-in went smooth, desk clerk too commented on the high price of my original reservation. (Live & Learn). Location was great, very close to all Broadway theaters and action of Times Square. Sign stated to show room key at security to enter elevators. A man was sometimes sitting at what I assume was security desk, but never asked. I was naturally told I was getting a very nice room. It was a small corner room, with a side view, but still ok, as I was not there to stay in the room. Bed was comfortable & linens were nice, TV & remote worked but volume was not adjustable. Bathroom was dirty, wallpaper peeling, black mold under the caulking around the tub and no washcloths. We asked a housekeeper for washcloths, she said she didnâ€™t have any and would bring them to us later. When we returned that evening, we had received (1) washcloth, with a note asking us to call front desk if we needed more. All & all it was in a great location, bathrooms need overhauled, no excuse for the mold. I learned when booking in NYC the longer you can wait the better and try sites like Priceline and compare. Next time I will go someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the tourist”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: We stayed after getting this room from priceline at the last minute and i ended up being very happy. I must say the place was crowded and there were many checking in all at once. It used to be a Starwood property but it does not look like it is anymore. They did not have a starwood preferred guest room or hospitality suite. Checkin No problems and the front desk clerk was very friendly. Like i said it took a little while with a few people in from of me. Rooms They were small but I really didn't care after we got the room for like $100 a night which is unheard of in the Times Sq area. Also a bit dated decor but again if you can get a great rate who cares. Bed It was OK. I think it was a starwood sleeper but couldn't really tell. Bathroom No problems. Internet It wasnt free so i never logged on. I used my net connect card and the reception wasn't the best. The area is very good for the tourist. Right there very close to Times Sq. There are so many things close and pretty close to the subway also. Overall I was very happy with the rate we paid from priceline and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... that's it!”
Reviews.Author: prepaid999
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan is in a great location close to Times Square and the subway, but that's it. It's a tired hotel in need of a full renovation. The hallways are dark and the elevators take forever... plan for an extra 20 minutes each morning. The saying if these wall could talk rings true here, because I could hear every word that was spoken in the adjoining rooms. The bathrooms are disgusting and don't expect to find the great Starwood beds. Housekeeping is a mess as they left our latch open after making our room. We returned late in the evening only to find our door was left open for several hours. Security did stop by to see if everything was ok, but there was no follow-up from management. Starwood should really pull the flag off of this hotel, as they don't even come close to meeting brand standards. Please take my word, spent the extra $50 bucks and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PSSHAW
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with this hotel. The location was great-close to Times Square,Rockafeller Center and several subway lines for easy access to the rest of the city. Computer area quite congested -usually had to wait in line quite awhile to get a computer. Rooms were a good size and our room was very clean-no complaints! I know that the prices for this hotel can very greatly and I think that this is why there is a variety of reviews on this site. Great hotel for 250.00 not so much if you have to pay 479.00 !

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: va22306
Reviews.Content: Returned home from NYC after a one day stay with my cousin and her husband. I booked a room for a rather good price for a NYC Hotel... We arrived at the hotel and the customer service was great, the lobby was great, there were a number of computers for guests to use for free. Check into room and room was kind of small but no worries because we wouldn't be in the room much because there was so much we wanted to do. I was shocked and surprised this morning when I went to brush my teeth and the water in the sink would not drain, infact, it was backing up. AND then when I went to take a quick shower, I was utterly grossed out by the bath tub. I let the water run for a while and then laid 2 towels on the bottom of the tub to stand on while I took a shower and then just like the sink, the bathtub wouldn't drain. I advised the front desk and the apologized profusely but whatever happened to management oversight and the review of cleanlines of hotel rooms? This hotel would have gotten good reviews had it not been for the bathroom issues... Might I add that I'm also more disappointed to find out there are reviews that this hotel has bed bugs.... Step it up Manhattan at Times Square...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: OscarII
Reviews.Content: This hotel can not be in a better location, close to all points in Manhattan and easy access to public transportation. The service is superior to many hotels in New York City which are usually at a much higher rate. Considering the location, service and price, you will be hard pressed to find a better option in Manhattan. I stay at this hotel every time I travel to New York City and would highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a Congested Location”
Reviews.Author: acdhuber
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beginning to show a bit of wear and tear. My room, while a decent size for New York, was not particularly clean. The halls and common areas were not particularly clean, either. Given the traffic in this location, that is not surprising. The room was surprisingly quiet given the location, but it did seem a bit overpriced compared to similar hotel chains east of Madison or Park. It will do in a pinch, but I would prefer another location and a slightly higher quality, especially given the price. The location is quite convenient if you want to spend a lot of time in Times Square or have easy access to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, filthy, filthy!”
Reviews.Author: PQ1956
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and booked a room for myself (with a travel agent rate, so they knew this when I checked in) at the Manhattan Times Square for 2 nights to visit family. I asked to be moved after the first night as the room I was in was filthy -- torn and completely stained carpet, blood spatters on one of the duvets, slashed lampshades, broken lamps, I even had to clean the sink out before using it. The phone was caked with black grime. First they refused to move me, but relented and moved me to another room. It was less filthy, but even then I had the "pleasure" of washing out the bathtub full of someone else's grime and hair before I could take a shower. The air conditioning in both rooms was sub-par, never getting truly comfortable despite the thermostat being set at 65. There is no sound insulation to speak off, so whatever activity is going on on either side of you sounds like it's in the room with you. A foul and disgusting hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hospitality and helpful front desk agents. Now i love NYC”
Reviews.Author: AlChud
Reviews.Content: I'm from Europe and it was my first visit to NYC. My first impression about this city was good thank to this hotel and front desk adviser Larisa. Not only hotel was good but Larisa explained about the city, best ways to get around and places to visit. 5 star is a must!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location at an attractive price point.”
Reviews.Author: GarySIA
Reviews.Content: Nothing really to write home about; but then again, I've never really bought into the idea that hotels should attempt to offer "premium" or "exclusive" service. It's usually ersatz and forced anyway. This is a comfortable, convenient hotel offering genuine, friendly service and good value. Louise at the front counter deserves special mention for her unfussy, sincere and very efficient work.

Reviews.Title: “a really friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dorothy21
Reviews.Content: We had never been to new york before so it was areal treat to find that the sheraton manhattan times sq. was so central to everything, our room was nice and spacious and spotless clean with really comfy beds , the noise level from outside was very low and with a really big flatscreen tv in the room it kept our 10yr old son occupied while we were getting ready to go see all the wonderful attractions there is to see,we would definetly go back to this hotel and would recommend it to anybody and the pool was great especially for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, unhelpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous186402
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money, the rooms are very dated, noisy air-con, the cleaners forgot to give us new towels, the reception staff were very busy & so rushed that they were serving about 3 at once, the concierge were unhelpful & only answered direct questions. When i asked if there was a free shuttle service to JFK the answer was No!! When i went outside & saw an Airlink shuttle to JFK for $24 & not the standard taxi rate of $45, why didnt he offer me the service as he was the guy I had to book through to get the ticket. Again they were far too busy and we had to wait 15 mins for a bell man to take our cases, while we stood in a queue hanging around in the lobby to be made to feel in the way. The wifi in the lobby is free but inadequate for the amount of users, there are about 5 chairs, people were sitting around the lobby on the floor, & then the security man shouted at everyone to get off the floor, simple provide more chairs!! or make it free throughout hotel. Breakfast was not inc but it was available starting at $13 for pancakes. Plus points - the pool, the bed was comfortable, tea & coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: mingnsid
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 kids) went to Manhattan for a weekend trip. The weather was unfortunately 95 degrees and extremely humid. Fortunately, this hotel had an indoor heated swimming pool on the 5th floor. The hotel was extremely busy due to its size and great location and it was practically full. However, ROSE JEAN BULONG at the front desk took her time to find us a larger room to fit 2 cots for the kids. She was personable, helpful, and genuine. She even called us later while we were in our room to be sure we were satisfied. I would DEFINITELY stay here the next time we're in Manhattan. -Yee's from Boston

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: ccarn
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived early and were able to check-in without delay. We arrived at our assigned room to find that the bed situation was not as designated in our reservation. I returned to the desk and was assisted promptly by S. Eisenmann (who had also checked us in initially). We were assigned to a new room, as per our reservation. Eisenmann was again very helpful in giving sightseeing and transportation suggestions, ensuring we were happy with our second room, and extending our check-out. The location of this hotel is excellent for Midtown sights and there is a subway stop 1 block away. The room was spacious and clean; everything was in working order. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Run Far Away, Far Far Away”
