Reviews.Author: kevdani71
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel prior to arriving and was all excited only to face total disappointment. This hotel has seen better days. The rooms are horrible and the housekeeping is subpar. The bathtub was filled with mildew, mold growing on the ceiling and the AC in this hotel is non existent. I would run far away to another location. We had booked 4 nights at this hotel and ended up leaving and moved to the Sheraton which was not much better when it came to AC but at least the room was clean. I dont recommend this hotel to anyone. Starwood should be ashamed to have this hotel in their listings, what a dump. The staff at the desk were friendly and tried to be as helpful as they could without saying that no matter what room we got there was gonna be a problem. I wanted to speak with the manager and after nearly 15 minutes, I spoke with an African American gentlemen who seemed to just careless about me and the problems we had. I barely got an apology in regards to the quality of the hotel and the problems that we had in 3 different rooms. Starwood should be ashamed of this hotel and his attitude to not care. Never again at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called Manhatten at the Zoo”
Reviews.Author: ORCon
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Wed. in July. Our room was ready so they let us check in early. We were in room 1516. The room was a nice size with a king bed and desk but no chair. Bathroom was quite small. My cousin stayed on the 18th floor. Her room was nicer - had a chair and ottoman. The pool and work out room were nice with an outdoor patio. There was a restaurant only open for a very expensive breakfast. $16 for a waffle. Computers were free, but you could only get on one at 3:00 a.m. I have never seen so many large groups of high school age students. Getting on and off the elevator took a long time. When the elevator reached the lobby, many times 10 -12 students would start to pile in before you could even get off. The lobby had four total chairs to sit down on. Our room was cleaned daily, but sometimes they came late in the day. The bed was comfortable. The location was close to plays and a 20 minute walk to Central Park. I could not relax here due to the large crowds of people everywhere. Our room sounded like a tornado all night. The elevator shaft was behind our bed. I got used to it after a few nights. It was nice having a pool which is uncommon in many New York hotels, but the crowds offset that. I'd choose a quieter location next time.

Reviews.Title: “Like a glass of champagne”
Reviews.Author: brazil33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. It is near the best that new york has to offer. The best breakfast, it is very good. The rooms are very quiet and the bed is very comfortable. I had a very good experience with the front desk people, especially with Louise and Miho.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: sadie018
Reviews.Content: Courteous and extremely helpful personnel and special mention to Rose Jean Bulong, Guest Service Agent. Her assistance made our stay in New York most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home - Manhattan at Times Square”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelers_8
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is in need of a renovation, which is beginning, I can't say enough about the warm, thoughtful staff. Omar, the front desk manager, and Louise, my absolute favorite front desk person of all the many hotels I've stayed in for business, always make me feel that I have a home away from home in New York. Great location, good prices, warm, professional staff. Who could ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “BEST Hotel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: MiamiGoldie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Manhattan numerous times in the past 2 years.I love the location and the size of the rooms! The best part of this hotel is the staff! They are the nicest and most attentive staff. The management is professional and truly concerned with the comfort of your stay. I used to live in New York, so when Im in town now for business I like to "feel at home" and at The Manhattan I really do! this is the only place I stay for business or pleasure!!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience in Manhattan At Times Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gghosh
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in the Manhattan At Times Square Hotel in two spells in July-2010 and have very good experience of service provided by one and all of the hotel, specially of the front desk staffs. I dealt with Mr.Mohammed Abdullah of front desk who had been extremely courteous to provide all information and facilities regarding the hotel & around. I shall definitely select this hotel for my next stay in NY and strongly recommed friends to stay here in future.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Employee!”
Reviews.Author: Jo12333
Reviews.Content: I would like to congratulate Rose Jean Bulong, your Front Desk Agent. Recently my family and I spent a week at your hotel, and she was able to move two of us to an adjacent and interconnecting room next to the rest of the family. She kept after it until she found the info she needed to unblock the room. It made our visit much more pleasant to all be together.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Staythurstymyfriends
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great location for the price. But I thought it was a bit pricey for what you get, but people tell me it's NYC and your not going to get the same size (big) room like other cities. The floor (11th) that we were on was a bit run down and needs updating, it was very noisy late in to the night with kids running up and down the halls and slamming doors. Once I went over and confronted the parents things calmed down. The front desk never sent anyone up so I took care of it myself. The Concierge desk was manned by two grumpy old men, but at least they got the job done. The in room AC isn't great but it at least got the job done. It was also nice to have a free safe in the room. I'd stay here again but not for over $180 a night, NYC taxes the hell out of you. The night life is great it's only a 3 block walk to the heart of Times Square where the action is.

Reviews.Title: “It was a remarkable 24 hours with 5 star service.”
Reviews.Author: ddunyak
Reviews.Content: Had a great 24 hours... Mohammed at the front desk was on top of everything including having two rooms on hold adjoining for us. Sofia the housekeeper on floor 20 could not have been nicer. The one room was not ready when we checked in - no one could explain why, but she (and Mohammed) made certain it was taken care of very quickly. Also on Wednesday, we had a late check out. She offered extra towels, coffee, etc. Very very lovely stay and very good service. LOVED IT.

Reviews.Title: “Service is superior”
Reviews.Author: fishrcutb8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, well appointed, clean and small enough for the staff to provide personal service. Ray at the bellman's desk was fantactic and honorable mention goes to doorman, Gene Faulk, who gave us superior service when my daughter was sick. I have stayed in several hotels in the city and I will definitely be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its absolute best!”
Reviews.Author: mariano828
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on New Years Eve due to its prime location in the heart of Times Square. I have very high expectations when it comes to hotel visits, and the staff worked extremely hard to live up to my expectations. I even spoke with the hotel manager, Debbie Mahony prior to my arrival and she reassured that I would have an exceptional stay during my holiday weekend. Its been a while since my visit, but I noticed some negative reviews on this site and I wanted to make sure the hotel got the credit it deserved.

Reviews.Title: “good location and value”
Reviews.Author: martytoronto
Reviews.Content: my trip to nyc was mainly sightseeing and shopping my priorities were a clean room with a good bed in a good location and manhattan suites provided that for us. check in with guillermo and check out with ricardo good nice guys helpful at all times !! price was good and even provided a little fridge upon request. yes the hotel is old the bathrooms are old it does smell bad sometimes in the lobby but nyc smells bad but is wonderful ! room was great and beds very very comfortable. you are out all day in nyc and you need a quiet clean bed and we had that at a good price to be right price right at time square..starwood points go for it and ask for discounts !!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Samsung39
Reviews.Content: I fully recommend this Hotel. The location is Perfect. All the staff (really a lot) is kindly. The beds are very comfortable. It has a small swimming pool, and a newstand. The rooms are big. I will return to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE...GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: write4kids
Reviews.Content: I was uncertain about this hotel. I used my Sheraton points. I called the manager, Omar and told him my concerns. He said if there are any problems to let him know. The stay was great. There was some construction on my side of the hotel and they moved me to a great room, very quiet (except for NYC noise). The staff, every one of them, were fantastic. I'd stay there again in a New York minute! The location is superb. Clean room. Marshmallow beds!

Reviews.Title: “Not Starwood Quality”
Reviews.Author: Richaud
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in the rooms. They were tired, the furniture was broken and the air conditioner was so noisy it kept us up . We were surprised that this was a Starwood hotel as it is not of the caliber of most of their properties. The beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great and the staff is even better!”
Reviews.Author: lluv2travll
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Manhattan at Times Square with friends, for a weekend away. We weren't in the best mood when we first arrived at the hotel after sitting in traffic for what seemed like eternity, however i have to say that Mohammad at the front desk cheered us up right away. He truly made us feel comfortable and at home in New York City! The rooms may not be the best in town however the service and location is impeccable! I would definately come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NYC Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SITFan
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay in NYC! Centrally located to everything (Times Square, theatre district, Starbucks, 5th Avenue, subway lines). Clean, well-appointed rooms with comfortable beds, huge fluffy pillows, and large flat-screen TV. Refreshing swimming pool and work-out room. The only drawback was their Internet policy - $14.95/day in the room and wireless only in the lobby. Our laptop's Vista prevented us from accessing the wireless, and they graciously comp'd us for two nights of access, however, they should offer it free in all the rooms. Otherwise, we loved our stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location, Wonderful Peolple”
Reviews.Author: Peppy8
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan at Times Square is as stated, right at the doorstep of Times Square and a five minutes walk to Central Park and th Apple Store at Fifth Avenue. The hotel is clean with wonderful staff. Special mention must go to the front desk staff, Louise Rechlis. Quick, efficient, friendly and most importantly, always ready to help or offer a solution. Price, location, location, People, People, People. Friendly and efficient. What a great Hotel

Reviews.Title: “An amazing front desk experience upon check in....”
Reviews.Author: cjmm327
Reviews.Content: After an all nighter followed by a 5am flight to NYC I was greeting by the sweetest smile at The Manhattan - Time Square. Louse R. (as the front desk) made me forget how tired I was when she greeting me with her warm smile and offered to help me with all my NYC logistical questions and recommendations. She was a delight and assured me that I had chosen the right hotel for my NYC trip. She represents the "STAR"wood Brand well as she is a "STAR"! Many thanks again, Kindest regards, Carol from Michigan (Also - love the free internet in the hotel lobby!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location complemented by superb service by front office , Mohammad Abdullah”
Reviews.Author: nycnyc123
Reviews.Content: very good location for teh group. This is my 3rd trip in this hotel this season. really appreciate services by all teh members. I would like to hilight r Mohammad Abdullah's name who is always willing to take that extra step to make the guest feel at home and comfortable. He also helped me resolve an issue lying pending for nearly three weeks. Keep it up Mohammad. CHEERS !!!!! Purnima Gandhi Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dated but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barry_Jordan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in May. After reading the reviews on here, I was quite worried it was going to be really bad. The hotel has clearly seen better days, but it is still clean and tidy with good facilities. The room we had was very spacious, and the bathroom was a good size and clean but a little dated. The bed was very comfortable, and there was no noise from outside on the street. The breakfast was excellent, with loads of choice, but there are cheaper options close by to the hotel. The reviews on here are very mis-leading in my opinion, and I would definately stay here again. If you want a reasonable hotel, then this is a very good option. This hotel is comparable with any branded hotel in London at a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Solros15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Manhattan at Times Square for five days at the end of May with a friend. Some of the reviews here made me a bit worried and afterwards I am wondering, did they really stay at the same hotel as I did? It was perfect from the first minute. The room was available as we checked in at 11 am! Room perfect with comfortable beds, a huge flat screen TV, great view of 7th Avenue, plenty of space for luggage, clean bathroom and very nice staff! I have to say that this is one of the best hotels I've stayed at. The location is perfect too, feels like everything is just around the corner of the hotel! I am definitely going to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Its One of the best located hotel at Times square.”
Reviews.Author: SwetaJain
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Manhattan at Times square is the best solely because of its location. Its Located at main street of times square and the service provided by the hotel is very good. We can jst walk down the street and go around the times square. It has all ppossible best restuarent near by and food available is very good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and excellent courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: adildoctor
Reviews.Content: My name is adil doctor and i am a tour manager with thomas cook n i have stayed at this hotel for many days in the month of april and may along with my guest.The check in staff at the front desk are extremly helpful n corteous especially Mr Mohammad Abdullah who has not only helped me but dozens of my co managers on many occassions n helped us facilitate our smooth check in.Without his help and kind assistance our stay woudnt have been as great as it was.

Reviews.Title: “No problems..”
Reviews.Author: TedwardWest
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, clean big room, comfy bed, helpfull staff Well located for access to subway network Fine basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: angel1990
Reviews.Content: I was visiting New York with a couple of girlfriends from England and we stayed at the Sheraton on 7 ave. It was my first time in New York and I was both excited and nervous. The staff was helpful, but one in particular helped us with suggestions as to where to go. Louise was very nice and made our experience a lot better. I would highly reccommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ruby1pearl
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 6 nights in may,this hotel was very handy to all the theatres,we were able to walk to the shows we saw,we basically used our room for sleeping and it was very handy to drop any shopping back to,or take a break for five minutes and recharge.we felt safe,room tidied daily,pool available,free internet for guests in lobby-approx 6 computers,very handy and i only ever waited 5-10 mins to access a computer,hop on hop off bus very close,plenty of places to eat also,awesome pizza and stardust cafe to mention a couple.we were very happy and thought it was good value for money

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the sheraton at times square”
Reviews.Author: janicefromva
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at your hotel Went on the open bus tour and saw how fantastic new york was. Employee Louise at the friend desk was so helpful and friendly. Appreciated how welcome she made me feel Thanks for your service will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jesseharris
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in NYC..The location is great..The staff is extremely helpful, especially Mohammad Abdullah, Miho Hirata, and Front Desk Manager, Oumar Kane..They all strive to make your stay very special...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sjf123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at 7th Ave and 51st street. It took about 15-20 mins to walk north to central park, and Times Square was about 10 mins south. Great location for theatre and shopping. The hotel was nice - nothing special, but clean and comfortable. Hotel staff were helpful. Restaurant was only open for breakfast, and was very expensive - $40 for two. It was much cheaper to find something else close by. The internet cafe was in the lobby, and was very busy. Had to wait to use a terminal. There were lots of tour groups staying in the hotel, and the lobby always seemed to be busy with people checking in or checking out. I would stay in this hotel again - it's a great location, and the room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “sophisticated atmosphere with small town service and hospitality in best location in nyc”
Reviews.Author: citylover80
Reviews.Content: Great experience - the staff from the front desk to the concierge to the bell boys were just terrific. The rooms were clean, white linens on comfortable beds. It exceeded my expectations in every way and this is the hotel I will choose every time I am in nyc

Reviews.Title: “A great place for an anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: Frank5711
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our Golden Wedding Anniversary week-end at this hotel and we were very pleased with the hotel and the staff. We were particularly pleased with the complimentary breakfast offered to us by Louise Rechlis. The use of this hotel by TRAVAC Tours is most appropriate and we would recommend this hotel and this tour company to anyone. We were also delighted with how close the hotel is to Times Square, the Bar Americain where we ate our Anniversary Dinner and the August Wilson Theatre where we saw Jersey Boys. We were frustrated with the phone messaging system and the lack of in room instructions.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: M0m0fteenagers
Reviews.Content: I just travelled with my daughter and a friend and her daughter over Memorial Day weekend. We had a wonderful experience and I was tempted to keep my experience a secret for fear that this hotel will become so popular that I will have trouble getting in on my next trip. We worked with Mohammad at the front desk who was friendly, accomodating, remembered our names and ensured that we had the best possible stay - and he was always working!!! I don't think he took one day off when we were there! Typically beds at even the best hotels are either too soft, lumpy, hard...I believe I read somehwere that the Manhattan's beds are new. Regardless, the beds were amazing as were the pillows. The location was perfect, close to Time Square but away from the chaos. The security guard and house keeper were also very friendly. The only issue we experienced was the bathroom was small and we wish that there was a outlet by the mirror outside the bathroom (we were travelling with teenage girls!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: simfam2000
Reviews.Content: Rose was a great help at the front desk. We booked through priceline and she was able to give us double beds in all 3 rooms right next to each other. The hotel was in a great location and very clean! The pool was great for the little ones!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travellot3
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 days in New York City at the Manhatten in Times Square, the location is perfect we had everythimg at our fingertips. We could go to a show, a casual dinner, shopping, or just walk aroud and soak up Times Square just by walking out side the hotel. The room was spotlessly clean, the excersise facility had everything we needed and the staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this hotel for location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: chai4mom
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room and excellent service. Rooms aren't huge, but totally worked for two moms and two teenage girls. Beds were very comfy, sheets clean and soft, plenty of pillows. The location was great -- an easy walk to Times Square, Top of the Rock, even Central Park and Lincoln Center. We were on the 15th floor, so our room was plenty quiet, and we had a great view of 7th Ave. It was one of the only places I could find that would accomodate four in one room without paying a fortune. There are six computers in the lobby that guests can use, so I'm glad I didn't lug my laptop along. There is also a computer kiosk for printing out your boarding passes for the return trip. I didn't use it, but what a great idea. This hotel was totally top notch at a bargain price. Staff were consistently pleasant, responsive and efficient. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Karine_Daniel
Reviews.Content: It costs about $ 30 to get a taxi to the hotel starting from Laguardia Airport. This hotel is directly in Times Square. It is really impressive to go outside and see all the lights! It is also nice to be close to go and change shoes after a long day of walking! Rooms were clean and the beds comfortables! The restaurant in the bottom of the hotel is too expensive ... better go have lunch in one of many starbucks and keep your money for something else! You need to stay at least once in your life directly into Manhattan. It is a whole experience despite the price. But I will not pay this price at all times! A good hotel in Queens is just fine too! Having been some time in New York, my favorite period: Christmas. The decorations are worth the detour, it is magic and what about the Boxing day on the fifth avenue ... the dream of any girl!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, friendly personnel and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: devangelista777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early April with my boyfriend. When we approached the front desk we were met by a very friendly desk clerk whose name was Louise Rechlis. She was very courteous and helped in a very friendly and efficient manner. Her service was fantastic and she is a big asset to the hotel! She made our stay very enjoyable. Donna E

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jbookman
Reviews.Content: I don't usually have time to write reviews but felt I'd be remiss if I didn't mention the great staff at The Manhattan at Times Square Hotel. In particular, Mohammad on the front desk was extremely helpful with both directions and suggestions. Josephine went above and beyond as well. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Comfortable, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: touristmar
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay at this hotel again. The location was great, close to central park and times square.I felt safe and comfortable which was important to me as I was traveling alone. Mohammad at the front desk was particularly helpful. He gave me suggestions of where to eat, how to get around, and informed me of the hotels ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Help from Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: speechman_10
Reviews.Content: I arrived for a late check -in and found the room to have not been made up - I was assisted by Mohammed at the front desk who quickly moved me to an even better room with a very sincere apology- He made a less than ideal situation that I was not in the mood for disappear almost instantly-

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: harshrox
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan at Times sqaure is a tourist friendly hotel with warm & cosy room interior. The staff in this hotel is co-operativce & friendly. Looking forward to spend another vacation here very soon during winter.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, service, value”
Reviews.Author: jimewing34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great experience at the Manhattan at Times Square. The room was clean and comfortable; the staff was friendly and accommodating; the location was ideal. Two especially appreciated services were the free use of computers and the excellent health club facilities, including pool and sauna. The ONLY minor problem we encountered was an effort at 1:00 AM to get the desk to answer the phone to give us a wake-up call. Fortunately we were able to set the alarm clock. Overall, a wonderfully memorable New York visit!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk service by Mohammed saved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mbrr22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of the location, and will go back because Mohammed was so kind and helpful to me. Since this was my first business trip to NYC I had a lot to learn about navigating Manhattan. The room was nothing special, other staff were routine. Mild recommendation overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: snoopstergurl
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this hotel for location. It is so close to Times square and anything else you might want. Tons of delis and restaurants, subway is close by and central park is not far. Only problem is that there is free internet downstairs in the lobby, but always busy! Brought my own laptop which wasnt working(they have free wifi in lobby) So you have to wait forever for a computer. also was there all week, but friday night it was so loud outside with honking I couldn't sleep. Dont know if it was because it was the weekend but it was loud! never had that happen before and I have been to new york a lot. Bonus of this hotel though is that the fitness facility is free and is well equipped!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, good value”
Reviews.Author: Way-to-adventure
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan at Times Square Hotel, conveniently located on the island of Manhattan, is perfect for a stay in New York: on 7th Avenue, in Times square, just few blocks from Central Park and next to several subway. The staff is also dedicated to his "guests". Like Ron Sidcow who, when we were stuck on NYC due to the volcanic cloud over Europe, did not hesitate to contact our airline (American Airlines) to find a solution. But our airline did not take care about us, so the hotel has a commercial gesture ! Ultimately it was a great stay (gym, swimming pool, sauna, steam room, ...)! Thank you to Manhattan at Times Square Hotel and thank you to Ron.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences we ever had.”
Reviews.Author: angcris
Reviews.Content: My wife and i had the most wonderful experience at this hotel.The rooms were clean the staff was friendly and accommodating. It made our stay just that more enjoyable. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: adrixpacheco
Reviews.Content: I'm so unsatisfied with this hotel. I traveled with another 5 people. We booked 2 rooms for 3 people each and they gave us 1 room with a king size bed. Afterwards they gave us a little tiny bed for the 3rd person. We stayed 3 nights. 2nd night they moved us to a 2 bed room but one of the rooms when we got there was dirty. they never made that room since the bed was unmade. Bathroom had wet towels on the floor from somebody that just took a shower. finally they clean the room. Tv remote didn't work, phone didn't work. I tried to call the reception and could not even go thru. Last thing was that the water from the tub would not go away. Very unsatisfied and will never return to that hotel. They did gave us free breakfast 2 days for the inconevience but it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CarolineMck27
Reviews.Content: Recently had a 6 night stay in this hotel. We booked through the SPG website and got a lovely king room on the 17th floor with fab view over Broadway. The room and bathroom were a great size compared with previous New York hotels in which we have stayed. Also the room was immaculate and the bed was so comfy. The hotel foyer is nice and welcoming, and there is a nice bar/restaurant called Russos, however I see from one report that it is shortly due to close which seems such a shame. Once we checked in and took the elevator up to our room we were a little concerned as the corriders are a little grubby and could definately do with some decoratng. We were originally given a room on the 14th floor however when we went in, it had not been cleaned and I have to say I am glad as it did not look nearly as nice. The only complaint I have about the room is that the walls are paper thin and unfortunately we heard EVERYTHING from the room next door . The location is absolutely perfect, the swimming pool on the 5th floor was fantastic and we managed to have a swim most days. Had a few drinks in the hotel bar but did not have a meal or breakfast so not sure what the food was like. There are lots of nice bars and restaurants close by - Ellens Stardust diner across the street is good fun although the food is nothing special. If you are thinking of a broadway show, I would recommend Memphis, It was the highlight of my trip. I have seen lots of shows in the past and this one is definitely the best..

Reviews.Title: “so run-down”
Reviews.Author: daurang
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because the Sheraton Tower across the street didn't have the room type I needed. The lobby is decent. Otherwise everything here is just sooooo old. The mattress, elevator, sheets, bathroom, wallpaper, carpet, blanket are dirty, stained, and dated. The room here is no better than one of those independently-owed no-name roadside motel. The staffs are kind of unhelpful, too. Calls to the frontdesk, housekeeping, concierge, engineering, are put on hold, transferred, disconnected, or never picked up. If I hadn't stayed here for free, I be really p!ssed paying $300 buck a night for this crap. On the plus side, the hotel is very centrally located. There is free internet lounge in the lobby which I am using to write this. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Sheraton Tower across the street or stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: ljt064
Reviews.Content: Spent April vacation with the family in NYC. After much searching got a good value on the room for 4 days. This hotel is dated, but for NYC is a great value. Its located blocks from Times Square. Easy access to the subway and walkable to 5th Avenue and Central Park. Hotel has a very clean indoor heated pool and small but well equipped gym. If hotel amenties are what you are looking for this isn't your spot, but if value and location are important than you've found a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: LarKir
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when stuck in NYC due to volcanic cloud over Europe. Rooms were small, the carpet was a dirty brown and there was no minibar or water in the room. The bathroom needed serious updating and had a very unpleasant plastic that moved when standing to have a shower. The soundproofing was non-existent with the result that the lift noise kept me awake and if that didn't do the trick then the rowing couple in the room next to me did so very effectively. Could not wait to get out! And this was not because I wanted to fly home - I moved out asap and found another hotel I was very happy to stay a few unscheduled days in!

HotelInfo.Name: The Manhattan at Times Square Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 790 7th Avenue at 51st Street, New York City, NY 10019
